name: cancel
trans: 取消， 废除； 抵消， 对消； 删去， 划掉

sentences.english: Our flight was cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 我们的航班取消了。

sentences.english: I’m afraid I’ll have to cancel our meeting tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我得取消我们明天的会议。

sentences.english: You’ll just have to ring John and cancel.
sentences.chinese: 你只能打电话给约翰取消了。

detailed_translations.english: to decide that something that was officially planned will not happen

name: explosive
trans: 爆炸的， 爆发的； 使人冲动的

sentences.english: ...one-hundred-and-fifty pounds of Semtex explosive.
sentences.chinese: …150磅的塞姆汀塑料炸药。

sentences.english: Because the gas is highly explosive, it needs to be kept in high-pressure containers.
sentences.chinese: 由于这种气体极易爆炸，因此需要保存在高压容器内。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that can cause an explosion
able or likely to explode

sentences.english: The prosecution wanted more time to prepare their case.
sentences.chinese: 原告想要有更多的时间来准备诉讼。

detailed_translations.english: to make plans or arrangements for something that will happen in the future

name: crusade
trans: 加入十字军， 投身正义运动

sentences.english: Dante: I took up the crusade. The bishop assured us that our sins would be absolved.
sentences.chinese: 但丁： 我参与了十字军东征。主教向我们保证我们的罪会被赦免。

sentences.english: Hard to believe that a life of glamour and wealth would be able to rob Xuande of his noble ambitions and crusade to give peace and prosperity to the common people.
sentences.chinese: 很难相信一个生命充满魅力和财富的玄德会用抢和类似十字军东征的方式实现他高尚的抱负并给普通百姓带来安定与和平。

detailed_translations.chinese: 十字军东征， 宗教战争
detailed_translations.english: one of a series of wars fought in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries by Christian armies trying to take Palestine from the Muslims
a very small village

sentences.english: ...a heart surgeon.
sentences.chinese: …一位心脏外科医生。

detailed_translations.english: a doctor who does operations in a hospital

sentences.english: a huge tiled entrance hall
sentences.chinese: 铺着地砖的大门厅

sentences.english: Each floor had ten rooms on both sides of the hall.
sentences.chinese: 每一层在走廊的两边都各有十个房间。

detailed_translations.english: the area just inside the door of a house or other building, that leads to other rooms

name: discourage
trans: 使泄气， 使灰心； 阻止， 劝阻

sentences.english: Aspirin may discourage tumour growth in some types of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 阿司匹林可能遏制某些恶性肿瘤的生长。

detailed_translations.english: to make something less likely to happen

name: predispose
trans: 事先影响某人； 偏爱； 易受感染

sentences.english: They take pains to hire people whose personalities predispose them to serve customers well.
sentences.chinese: 他们煞费苦心雇用那些具备把顾客服务好的个性的人。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone more likely to suffer from a particular health problem

name: oversee
trans: 监督， 监视； 俯瞰， 眺望

sentences.english: A team leader was appointed to oversee the project.
sentences.chinese: 任命了一位组长来监管该工程。

detailed_translations.english: to be in charge of a group of workers and check that a piece of work is done satisfactorily

name: pollution
trans: 污染， 污染物； 玷污

sentences.english: California’s tough anti-pollution laws
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚州严厉的反污染法

detailed_translations.english: the process of making air, water, soil etc dangerously dirty and not suitable for people to use, or the state of being dangerously dirty

sentences.english: Let’s pretend we’re on the moon.
sentences.chinese: 我们假装自己是在月球上吧。

sentences.english: He’s not asleep – he’s just pretending.
sentences.chinese: 他并没睡着，不过是装睡而已。

sentences.english: To pretend ignorance of the situation would be irresponsible.
sentences.chinese: 装作不知情是不负责任的做法。

sentences.english: I can’t marry her and to pretend otherwise would be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我不可以娶她，装作娶她无妨是不对的。

detailed_translations.english: to behave as if something is true when in fact you know it is not, in order to deceive people or for fun
imaginary or not real - used especially by children

sentences.english: ...clouds which lift warm, moist air by convection high into the atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: ...云层通过对流把温暖湿润的空气送到高的大气层中。

detailed_translations.english: the movement in a gas or liquid caused by warm gas or liquid rising, and cold gas or liquid sinking

sentences.english: Therefore, it is important to note that individual situations may warrant including additional characters in the list of special characters.
sentences.chinese: 因此，要注意可能保证把额外字符包括到特殊字符列表中的个别情况，这一点很重要。

sentences.english: Learning incessantly is the surest way to keep pace with the times in the information age and an infallible warrant of success in times of uncertainty.
sentences.chinese: 持续的学习是在资讯时代中跟时代并驾齐驱的最稳当的方法，也是在变动的世代中成功的可靠保证。

sentences.english: At Dean Miller's suggestion, I have allowed her to give the current student organizers the opportunity to propose a program for next semester that might warrant continuation of this event on campus.
sentences.chinese: 根据米勒学监的建议，我允许她给学生机会，让他们给下学期的活动提出一个方案，保证这个活动得以在校园内继续开展。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that something is true

detailed_translations.chinese: 正当理由；许可证，委任状
detailed_translations.english: a legal document that is signed by a judge, allowing the police to take a particular action

sentences.english: On the astrolabe, an off - centered circle represents the orbit of the sun - the ecliptic.
sentences.chinese: 在星盘上， 一个偏心的圆代表了太阳的运行轨道――黄道。

sentences.english: Recall that vernal equinox is one of the two intersection points of the celestial equator and the ecliptic.
sentences.chinese: 赤经计算的起点为春分点，相信你仍记得春分点是天球赤道和黄道的其中一个相交点。

sentences.english: Because the Moon and bright planets wander through the sky near the ecliptic plane, such occultation events are not uncommon, but they are dramatic, especially in telescopic views.
sentences.chinese: 因为月球和明亮的行星出现在天空中黄道平面附近，这种掩星事件也很平常，但是它们也很富有戏剧性，特别是在望远镜影像里。

detailed_translations.english: the path along which the Sun seems to move

name: conceal
trans: 隐藏； 隐瞒； 掩盖

sentences.english: The shadows concealed her as she crept up to the house.
sentences.chinese: 她借着阴影蹑手蹑脚地走向房子。

sentences.english: The path was concealed by long grass.
sentences.chinese: 小路隐藏在长长的草里。

sentences.english: a concealed weapon
sentences.chinese: 藏匿的武器

detailed_translations.english: to hide something carefully

sentences.english: More men are finding out that the joys of work have been overrated.
sentences.chinese: 更多的男士正发现工作的种种乐趣被高估了。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that something or someone is overrated, you mean that people have a higher opinion of them than they deserve

sentences.english: Cook the sauce over a medium heat until it thickens. Meanwhile start boiling the water for the pasta.
sentences.chinese: 用中火把调味汁煮到变稠，同时烧水准备煮意大利面。

detailed_translations.english: while something else is happening

name: opulent
trans: 豪华的， 华丽的， 富裕的； 丰富的， 丰饶的

sentences.english: evening dresses in opulent fabrics
sentences.chinese: 用华丽织物做成的晚礼服

sentences.english: When our vacations coincided, we often holidayed together.
sentences.chinese: 我们的假期要是凑巧赶在一起，我们常常会一同去度假。

sentences.english: The interests of the US and those of the islanders may not coincide.
sentences.chinese: 美国的利益和这些岛民的利益可能并不一致。

detailed_translations.english: to happen at the same time as something else, especially by chance

name: competent
trans: 有能力的； 能胜任的

sentences.english: A competent mechanic should be able to fix the problem.
sentences.chinese: 一名合格的机修工应该能够解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: having enough skill or knowledge to do something to a satisfactory standard

name: require
trans: 需要； 命令； 规定， 要求

sentences.english: Campbell’s broken leg will probably require surgery.
sentences.chinese: 坎贝尔的一条腿骨折，可能需要手术。

sentences.english: What’s required is a complete reorganization of the system.
sentences.chinese: 需要做的是彻底整顿整个系统。

sentences.english: Most house plants require regular watering.
sentences.chinese: 大多数室内盆栽植物需要定期浇水。

sentences.english: The bill failed to get the required number of votes.
sentences.chinese: 法案没有得到规定的票数。

detailed_translations.english: to need something

sentences.english: John yawned and scratched his leg.
sentences.chinese: 约翰打了个呵欠，挠了挠腿。

sentences.english: Try not to scratch.
sentences.chinese: 尽量别挠。

detailed_translations.english: to rub your skin with your nails because it feels uncomfortable

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓痕， 划痕； 抓， 搔， 刮
detailed_translations.english: a small cut on someone’s skin

name: compassionate
trans: 有同情心的， 表示怜悯的

sentences.english: a caring, compassionate man
sentences.chinese: 有同情心并关爱他人的人

sentences.english: I allowed him to go home on compassionate grounds .
sentences.chinese: 我出于同情让他回家了。

sentences.english: One measure of a civilized and compassionate society is how well it treats its prison population.
sentences.chinese: 衡量一个文明和有同情心的社会的尺度之一，就是看它如何对待囚犯。

detailed_translations.english: feeling sympathy for people who are suffering

sentences.english: He was doing his best to be cooperative.
sentences.chinese: 他在尽全力配合。

sentences.english: a cooperative witness
sentences.chinese: 肯配合的目击者

detailed_translations.english: willing to cooperate

sentences.english: Military strategists had devised a plan that guaranteed a series of stunning victories.
sentences.chinese: 军事战略家们设计了一个保证了一系列惊人胜利的计划。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is good at planning things, especially military or political actions

name: irritable
trans: 急躁的， 易怒的， 易受刺激的； 过敏的

sentences.english: Jo was tired, irritable, and depressed.
sentences.chinese: 乔疲惫暴躁，而且情绪低落。

detailed_translations.english: getting annoyed quickly or easily

sentences.english: a triple murder investigation
sentences.chinese: 对一宗三重谋杀案的调查

sentences.english: a triple bill of horror movies
sentences.chinese: 三部恐怖电影的连续放映

sentences.english: the triple world champion
sentences.chinese: 三连冠世界冠军

sentences.english: a triple bypass heart operation
sentences.chinese: 三重心脏搭桥手术

detailed_translations.chinese: 三部分的，三方的；三倍的，三重的
detailed_translations.english: having three parts or involving three groups, people, events etc
to increase by three times as much, or to make something do this

name: reserved
trans: 说话不多的， 内向的； 有所保留的， 预订的

sentences.english: He was unemotional, quiet, and reserved.
sentences.chinese: 他不动感情、安静而矜持。

detailed_translations.english: Someone who is reserved keeps their feelings hidden

sentences.english: Pete hit his brother in a fit of temper .
sentences.chinese: 皮特一气之下打了他弟弟。

detailed_translations.english: the way you are feeling at a particular time, especially when you are feeling angry for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 调和， 使缓和； 【冶】使回火
detailed_translations.english: to make something less severe or extreme

sentences.english: Stop tickling me!
sentences.chinese: 别挠我痒痒！

detailed_translations.english: to move your fingers gently over someone’s body in order to make them laugh
if something touching your body tickles you, it makes you want to rub your body because it is slightly uncomfortable
a feeling in your throat that makes you want to cough

sentences.english: If no one objects, I would like Mrs Harrison to be present.
sentences.chinese: 如果没人反对的话，我想请哈里森夫人出席。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or say that you oppose or disapprove of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 实物， 物体； 目的， 目标； 对象， 客体； 宾语
detailed_translations.english: a solid thing that you can hold, touch, or see but that is not alive

name: accessible
trans: 能接近的； 易达到的

sentences.english: The island is only accessible by boat.
sentences.chinese: 这个岛只有坐船才能到。

sentences.english: There is a church which is easily accessible from my home.
sentences.chinese: 有座教堂离我家很近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易接近的；可进入的；可理解的
detailed_translations.english: a place, building, or object that is accessible is easy to reach or get into

name: hang
trans: 悬挂， 吊， 垂下； 吊死， 绞死

sentences.english: Philip hung his coat on a hook behind the door.
sentences.chinese: 菲利普把自己的大衣挂在门后的钩子上。

sentences.english: She hung the sheets on the washing line.
sentences.chinese: 她把床单晾在晒衣绳上。

detailed_translations.chinese: [hung-hung] 悬挂， 吊； 徘徊； [hanged-hanged] 吊
detailed_translations.english: to put something in a position so that the top part is fixed or supported, and the bottom part is free to move and does not touch the ground

sentences.english: The painting has been authenticated by experts.
sentences.chinese: 这幅画专家鉴定为真迹。

sentences.english: passwords which can authenticate electronic documents
sentences.chinese: 能够验证电子文档的密码

detailed_translations.english: to prove that something is true or real

name: suffice
trans: 满足， 满意； 足够

sentences.english: A light lunch will suffice.
sentences.chinese: 简单的午餐就够了。

detailed_translations.english: to be enough

sentences.english: ‘That’s the only possible solution.’ ‘Yes, I suppose so,’ Charles conceded.
sentences.chinese: “那是唯一可行的解决办法。”“对，我想是。”查尔斯承认道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认， 承认…为真； 承认失败； 允许， 让予； 让步， 认输
detailed_translations.english: to admit that something is true or correct, although you wish it were not true

name: notable
trans: 值得注意的；显著的，杰出的，显赫的

sentences.english: If there are any notable inconsistencies or discrepancies, think through how you are going to explain the situation.
sentences.chinese: 如果有任何显著的不相符或让人起疑的情况，要想好该如何去解释这个情况。

detailed_translations.english: important, interesting, excellent, or unusual enough to be noticed or mentioned

name: unparalleled
trans: 无双的， 无比的， 空前的

sentences.english: an achievement unparalleled in sporting history
sentences.chinese: 体育史上空前的成就

detailed_translations.chinese: 无比的；无双的；空前未有的
detailed_translations.english: bigger, better, or worse than anything else

sentences.english: a plush hotel
sentences.chinese: 一家豪华酒店

sentences.english: Their casino is the plushest in town.
sentences.chinese: 他们的赌场是城里最豪华的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 豪华的；长毛绒做的；舒服的
detailed_translations.english: very comfortable, expensive, and of good quality
a silk or cotton material with a thick soft surface

name: evaporate
trans: 蒸发； 消失； 不复存在

sentences.english: Most of the water had evaporated.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的水都蒸发了。

sentences.english: The sun evaporates moisture on the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 太阳会蒸发叶子上的水分。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas
if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas

sentences.english: The Government set up a commission to investigate allegations of police violence.
sentences.chinese: 政府成立了一个委员会调查对警察施暴行为的指控。

detailed_translations.chinese: 委任状；委员会；佣金，回扣；授权，委托
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have been given the official job of finding out about something or controlling something
to formally ask someone to write an official report, produce a work of art for you etc

sentences.english: They walked down the staircase together.
sentences.chinese: 他们一起沿楼梯通道往下走。

detailed_translations.english: a set of stairs inside a building with its supports and the side parts that you hold on to

sentences.english: I was fed up with his flip comments.
sentences.chinese: 我听够了他那些轻率的评论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 〈口〉无理的， 轻率的， 轻浮的
detailed_translations.english: not said or meant seriously
to move something with a quick sudden movement so that it is in a different position
an action in which you make a flat object such as a coin go upwards and turn over in the air

name: connect
trans: 连接， 衔接； 联合， 关联； 由…联想到； 给…接通电话

sentences.english: We’d like two rooms with connecting doors (= doors that join the rooms ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们想要两个有门相通的房间。

sentences.english: I didn’t connect the two events in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 我心里没把这两件事联系起来。

detailed_translations.english: to join two or more things together

name: resume
trans: 重新开始， 继续恢复

sentences.english: She hopes to resume work after the baby is born.
sentences.chinese: 她想生完孩子后继续工作。

sentences.english: The rebels have resumed hostilities against government troops.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子继续与政府军发生冲突。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新开始， 继续， 恢复
detailed_translations.english: to start doing something again after stopping or being interrupted

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要， 概要； 简历
detailed_translations.english: a short account of something such as an article or speech which gives the main points but no details

name: address
trans: 致函，写姓名地址；向…讲话，演说；处理，

detailed_translations.english: if you address a problem, you start trying to solve it

name: posture
trans: 姿势； 心情； 态度

sentences.english: her upright posture
sentences.chinese: 她笔挺的姿势

detailed_translations.english: the way you position your body when sitting or standing

sentences.english: ...a spiral staircase.
sentences.chinese: …一段旋梯。

sentences.english: The maze is actually two interlocking spirals.
sentences.chinese: 这个迷宫实际上是两个连锁的螺旋体。

sentences.english: The damaged plane spiralled to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 受损的飞机盘旋坠地

detailed_translations.english: moving in a continuous curve that winds around a central point
a line in the form of a curve that winds around a central point, moving further away from the centre all the time
to move in a continuous curve that gets nearer to or further from its central point as it goes round

sentences.english: a decapitated body
sentences.chinese: 一具无头尸体

detailed_translations.english: to cut off someone’s head

sentences.english: Heavy snowfalls brought traffic to a halt (= made it stop moving ).
sentences.chinese: 大雪使得交通陷于停顿。

sentences.english: The World Championship was brought to a temporary halt (= was stopped from continuing ).
sentences.chinese: 世界锦标赛暂停举行。

sentences.english: The President has called for a halt to the wave of emigration.
sentences.chinese: 总统呼吁遏制移民国外的热潮。

detailed_translations.english: a stop or pause
to prevent someone or something from continuing - used especially in news reports

sentences.english: Exorbitant housing prices have created an acute shortage of affordable housing for the poor.
sentences.chinese: 过高的房价使穷人负担得起的房源严重短缺。

detailed_translations.english: an exorbitant price, amount of money etc is much higher than it should be

name: surgery
trans: 外科学； 外科手术； 手术室， 诊疗室

sentences.english: major/minor surgery
sentences.chinese: 大 / 小手术

detailed_translations.english: medical treatment of injuries or diseases that involves cutting open a person's body and often removing or replacing some parts; the branch of medicine connected with this treatment

name: violent
trans: 暴力的； 带有强烈感情的； 猛烈的

sentences.english: the increase in violent crime
sentences.chinese: 暴力犯罪的增多

sentences.english: violent clashes between the police and demonstrators
sentences.chinese: 警方与示威者之间发生的暴力冲突

sentences.english: 31 people have been injured in violent incidents throughout the day.
sentences.chinese: 今天一天有31人在暴力事件中受伤。

sentences.english: The riots ended in the violent deaths of three teenagers.
sentences.chinese: 动乱以三名少年的惨死而告终。

detailed_translations.english: involving actions that are intended to injure or kill people, by hitting them, shooting them etc

name: resolve
trans: 解决，解答；决定，决意；分解，分析

sentences.english: Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼特急需钱来解决他的经济问题。

sentences.english: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
sentences.chinese: 离婚以后，她决心永不再嫁。

sentences.english: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件坚定了她找出真相的决心。

detailed_translations.english: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
strong determination to succeed in doing something

name: confront
trans: 遭遇； 面对， 正视

sentences.english: The problems confronting the new government were enormous.
sentences.chinese: 新政府面临的难题是巨大的。

sentences.english: I confronted him with my suspicions, and he admitted everything.
sentences.chinese: 我当面向他提出我的怀疑，他什么都承认了。

detailed_translations.english: (of problems or a difficult situation) to appear and need to be dealt with by sb

name: deploy
trans: 部署； 使用， 运用

sentences.english: So far, however, we have said nothing about how to deploy it.
sentences.chinese: 到现在，我们还没说任何如何部署的内容。

sentences.english: You can then customize and deploy these artifacts in the usual way.
sentences.chinese: 然后，您可以以常规的方式定制和部署这些工件。

sentences.english: Now that you have seen the anatomy of each component, you can deploy them.
sentences.chinese: 您已经了解了对每个组件的剖析，现在可以部署它们了。

name: reproduce
trans: 繁殖， 生育； 复制， 仿造， 翻版； 再现， 使…在脑海中重现

sentences.english: Klimt’s artwork is reproduced in this exquisite book.
sentences.chinese: 这本精美的书里翻印了克里木特的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: to make a photograph or printed copy of something

sentences.english: We lay huddled together for warmth.
sentences.chinese: 我们紧紧挤在一起取暖。

sentences.english: Off to one side, Sticht, Macomber, Jordan, and Kreps huddled to discuss something.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂希特、麦康伯、乔丹和克雷普斯走到一边，私下商量起事情。

sentences.english: The president has been huddling with his most senior aides.
sentences.chinese: 总统一直在和他的顶级高级助理们秘密地聚到一起进行商谈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 聚集在一起，挤作一团；把身子蜷成一团，蜷缩
detailed_translations.english: if a group of people huddle together, they stay very close to each other, especially because they are cold or frightened
If people huddle in a group, they gather together to discuss something quietly or secretly

detailed_translations.chinese: 挤在一起的人； 一堆杂乱的东西
detailed_translations.english: a group of people or things that are close together, but not arranged in any particular order, pattern, or system

name: rendition
trans: 表演， 扮演， 演唱； 翻译； 视觉再现

sentences.english: He gave a moving rendition of Lennon’s ‘Imagine’.
sentences.chinese: 他深情地演唱了列侬的《想象》。

detailed_translations.chinese: 译文；演奏；提供；引渡逃奴
detailed_translations.english: someone’s performance of a play, piece of music etc

name: intersection
trans: 道路交叉口， 十字路口

sentences.english: We crossed at a busy intersection.
sentences.chinese: 我们穿过了一个繁忙的道路交叉口。

detailed_translations.chinese: 交叉；十字路口；交集；交叉点
detailed_translations.english: a place where roads, lines etc cross each other, especially where two roads meet

name: scholarship
trans: 奖学金； 学问， 学识

sentences.english: She won a scholarship to Iowa State University.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了艾奥瓦州立大学的奖学金。

sentences.english: Her latest publication is a fine piece of scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 她最新出版的作品是一部优秀的学术著作。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is given to someone by an educational organization to help pay for their education

sentences.english: I need the money. And besides, when I agree to do something, I do it.
sentences.chinese: 我需要这笔钱，而且，我一旦答应做什么事情就会做到。

sentences.english: The area has stunning scenery, beautiful beaches, and much more besides.
sentences.chinese: 那个地方有迷人的景色、美丽的沙滩，除此之外还有很多很多。

detailed_translations.english: used when adding another reason

name: instil
trans: 滴注； 逐渐灌输； 逐步培养

sentences.english: The tough thing is trying to instil a winning attitude in the kids.
sentences.chinese: 困难在于要尽力给孩子们灌输胜利的心态。

detailed_translations.chinese: 滴注； 逐渐灌输； 逐步培养
detailed_translations.english: to teach someone to think, behave, or feel in a particular way over a period of time

sentences.english: Petrol is highly inflammable.
sentences.chinese: 汽油高度易燃。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易燃的；易怒的；易激动的
detailed_translations.english: inflammable materials or substances will start to burn very easily

sentences.english: ...writing implements.
sentences.chinese: …书写用具。

sentences.english: We have decided to implement the committee’s recommendations in full.
sentences.chinese: 我们已决定全面实施委员会提出的建议。

detailed_translations.english: a tool, especially one used for outdoor physical work
to take action or make changes that you have officially decided should happen

name: export
trans: 出口； 输出； 出口商品

sentences.english: Italian food has been exported all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 意大利食品已传遍世界。

detailed_translations.english: to sell goods to another country
to sell goods to another country
the business of selling and sending goods to other countries

sentences.english: Singing can create a sense of well-being.
sentences.chinese: 唱歌能产生一种幸福感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 健康， 幸福； 福利
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being comfortable, healthy, and happy

name: incinerate
trans: 焚化， 焚毁， 把…烧成灰烬

sentences.english: All the infected clothing was incinerated.
sentences.chinese: 所有沾染了细菌的衣服都被焚化了。

detailed_translations.english: to burn something completely in order to destroy it

sentences.english: I used to have fantasies about living in Paris with an artist.
sentences.chinese: 我过去常幻想着在巴黎与一位艺术家同住。

sentences.english: sexual fantasies
sentences.chinese: 性幻想

sentences.english: Young children sometimes can’t distinguish between fantasy and reality.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子有时不能区分幻想与现实。

sentences.english: He lived in a fantasy world of his own, even as a small boy.
sentences.chinese: 甚至还是个小孩子的时候，他就生活在一个幻想世界里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 想象， 幻想； 想象的产物
detailed_translations.english: an exciting and unusual experience or situation you imagine happening to you, but which will probably never happen

name: erode
trans: 侵蚀， 腐蚀； 削弱， 损害

sentences.english: The cliffs are being constantly eroded by heavy seas.
sentences.chinese: 悬崖正不断受到汹涌海浪的侵蚀。

sentences.english: The rocks have gradually eroded away.
sentences.chinese: 岩石逐渐风化。

detailed_translations.english: if the weather erodes rock or soil, or if rock or soil erodes, its surface is gradually destroyed

sentences.english: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.english: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.chinese: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.english: The police are failing to take adequate measures to check the growth in crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能采取适当的措施来阻止犯罪率上升。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

sentences.english: Their attempts to speak to him were frustrated by the guards.
sentences.chinese: 他们想跟他说话，但被警卫拦住了。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent someone’s plans, efforts, or attempts from succeeding

sentences.english: ‘What do you think of my new flatmate?’ ‘He’s absolutely gorgeous !’
sentences.chinese: “你觉得我的新室友怎么样？”“他帅极了！”

sentences.english: exotic birds with feathers of gorgeous colours
sentences.chinese: 长着绚丽羽毛的异国的鸟

detailed_translations.chinese: 极其漂亮的，极其吸引人的；绚丽的，华丽的
detailed_translations.english: extremely beautiful or attractive

name: pragmatic
trans: 务实的； 实事求是的； 实用主义观点的

sentences.english: Williams took a more pragmatic approach to management problems.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯在管理问题上采用的是一种更务实的做法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 实际的；实用主义的；国事的
detailed_translations.english: dealing with problems in a sensible practical way instead of strictly following a set of ideas

sentences.english: Methane is one of the principal gases contributing to the greenhouse effect.
sentences.chinese: 甲烷是造成温室效应的主要气体之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: [有化] 甲烷；[能源] 沼气
detailed_translations.english: a gas that you cannot see or smell, which can be burned to give heat

sentences.english: the problem of soil erosion
sentences.chinese: 水土流失的问题

sentences.english: the erosion of the coastline
sentences.chinese: 海岸线受到的侵蚀

detailed_translations.english: the process by which rock or soil is gradually destroyed by wind, rain, or the sea

name: ascend
trans: 攀登； 上升， 升高

sentences.english: The plane ascended rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 飞机迅速爬升。

detailed_translations.english: to move up through the air
to climb something or move to a higher position

name: superstitious
trans: 迷信的； 根据迷信的， 由迷信引起的； 受迷信思想支配的

sentences.english: a superstitious woman
sentences.chinese: 一个迷信的女人

detailed_translations.english: influenced by superstitions

name: reorient
trans: 重新定方位； 重新定位； 使适应

name: provided
trans: 倘若， 只要， 假如

sentences.english: He can come with us, provided he pays for his own meals.
sentences.chinese: 只要他付自己的饭钱，就可以跟我们一起来。

name: indispensable
trans: 必不可少的， 必需的

sentences.english: Mobile phones have become an indispensable part of our lives.
sentences.chinese: 移动电话已经成为我们生活中的必需品。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is indispensable is so important or useful that it is impossible to manage without them

name: lens
trans: 透镜； 镜片； 镜头

sentences.english: a standard 50mm lens
sentences.chinese: 50毫米标准镜头

detailed_translations.chinese: 透镜， 镜片； 镜头
detailed_translations.english: the part of a camera through which the light travels before it reaches the film

name: embody
trans: 表达， 体现； 具体表现， 使具体化； 包括， 包含

sentences.english: She embodies everything I admire in a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 她具备了我所钦佩的教师该具备的一切素质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 体现，使具体化；具体表达
detailed_translations.english: to be a very good example of an idea or quality

name: orientate
trans: 使适应， 使熟悉情况； 给…定位， 给…定向； 使朝向； 转至特定方向； 适应

sentences.english: The reason for this was that he decided to orientate the map in the direction of the Pole Star since Polaris was the immovable guiding light in which the voyagers of that era placed their trust.
sentences.chinese: 他之所以要这样做就是因为他决定以北极星的方向来确定地图的方位。 因为北极星是一盏不动的导航灯，那个时代的航海家们主要依靠北极星来导航。

name: bacterial
trans: 细菌的； 由细菌引起的

sentences.english: Cholera is a bacterial infection.
sentences.chinese: 霍乱是一种由细菌引起的感染。

detailed_translations.english: Bacterial is used to describe things that relate to or are caused by bacteria

sentences.english: What do you suppose the killer’s motive was?
sentences.chinese: 你认为凶手的动机是什么？

sentences.english: The violence was clearly prompted by political motives.
sentences.chinese: 这次暴力事件显然是由政治动机引发的。

sentences.english: It’s not the kind of thing he’d do unless he had an ulterior motive (= a reason he kept hidden ) .
sentences.chinese: 他不会做这种事的，除非他另有隐情。

detailed_translations.english: the reason that makes someone do something, especially when this reason is kept hidden
the motive power or force for a machine, vehicle etc makes it move

name: envisage
trans: 展望， 想象； 面对

sentences.english: The scheme cost a lot more than we had originally envisaged.
sentences.chinese: 该计划的花费大大超出了我们最初所预想的数额。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is likely to happen in the future

sentences.english: She waited in eager anticipation for Robert to arrive.
sentences.chinese: 她急切地期盼着罗伯特到来。

sentences.english: Taylor was excited and full of anticipation at the prospect of the trip.
sentences.chinese: 泰勒很兴奋，对这次旅行满怀期待。

detailed_translations.english: when you are expecting something to happen

name: motivate
trans: 使有动机； 激励， 激发

sentences.english: A good teacher has to be able to motivate her students.
sentences.chinese: 好教师必须能够激发学生的积极性。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone want to achieve something and make them willing to work hard in order to do this

name: reinforcement
trans: 增援， 加强， 加固

sentences.english: The police called for reinforcements .
sentences.chinese: 警方要求增援。

detailed_translations.english: more soldiers, police etc who are sent to a battle, fight etc to make their group stronger

sentences.english: tutorial staff
sentences.chinese: 辅导人员

sentences.english: tutorial supervision
sentences.chinese: 老师的教授指导

detailed_translations.chinese: 辅导的；家庭教师的，个别指导的
detailed_translations.english: relating to a tutor or their work

name: spoil
trans: 损坏，破坏，糟蹋；宠坏，溺爱；变质

sentences.english: The whole park is spoiled by litter.
sentences.chinese: 整个公园环境都给垃圾破坏了。

sentences.english: We didn’t let the incident spoil our day.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有让这件事破坏我们一整天的气氛。

sentences.english: I don’t want to spoil your fun.
sentences.chinese: 我不想扫你的兴。

sentences.english: Why do you always have to spoil everything ?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么老是要把一切都弄糟呢？

detailed_translations.english: to have a bad effect on something so that it is no longer attractive, enjoyable, useful etc

sentences.english: Children will learn to multiply in the second grade.
sentences.chinese: 儿童在二年级学习乘法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘；使增加；使繁殖；使相乘
detailed_translations.english: to do a calculation in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times

sentences.english: large areas of rough upland pasture
sentences.chinese: 大片起伏的山地牧场

sentences.english: the lush pastures of the southern counties
sentences.chinese: 南部各郡茂盛的牧场

detailed_translations.english: land or a field that is covered with grass and is used for cattle, sheep etc to feed on
to put animals outside in a field to feed on the grass

sentences.english: Health is a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being and not merely the absence of disease or infirmity.
sentences.chinese: 健康是身体的、心理的及社会的达到完全安适状态，而不仅是没有疾病或身体虚弱而已。

sentences.english: Workers lose productivity by interrupting a business meeting and disrupt social gatherings because of their infirmity, the report said.
sentences.chinese: 报告中说，因为工人们的虚弱，通过中断了业务会议而失去生产效率，并且破坏了社交聚会的范围。

detailed_translations.english: bad health or a particular illness

sentences.english: an airline pilot
sentences.chinese: 航空公司飞行员

sentences.english: a fighter pilot
sentences.chinese: 战斗机驾驶员

sentences.english: The official report into the accident says that it was caused by pilot error (= a mistake by the pilot ) .
sentences.chinese: 那宗事故的官方报告称事故是由飞行员失误造成的。

sentences.english: The plan is to launch a pilot programme next summer.
sentences.chinese: 计划是在明年夏天实施一个试验性方案。

detailed_translations.english: someone who operates the controls of an aircraft or spacecraft
A pilot plan or a pilot project is one that is used to test an idea before deciding whether to introduce it on a larger scale
to guide an aircraft, spacecraft, or ship as its pilot

name: approval
trans: 赞成， 同意； 正式批准

sentences.english: The president has already given his approval to the plan.
sentences.chinese: 总统已经批准了这个计划。

sentences.english: It is just three months since we received official approval to go ahead with the project.
sentences.chinese: 三个月前我们刚刚得到正式批准进行这个项目。

sentences.english: A company cannot be sold without the approval of the shareholders.
sentences.chinese: 没有股东的同意不能出售公司。

sentences.english: The bill will be submitted for approval by Congress.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案将提交国会通过。

sentences.english: The President would appoint the Council of Ministers, subject to the approval of the National Assembly.
sentences.chinese: 总统将任命内阁成员，但需经国民议会批准。

sentences.english: The IMF has given its seal of approval to the government’s economic strategy.
sentences.chinese: 国际货币基金组织已经同意该政府的经济策略。

sentences.english: appointments requiring parliamentary approval
sentences.chinese: 需经议会批准的任命

sentences.english: She looked to Greg for approval.
sentences.chinese: 她指望格雷格同意。

detailed_translations.english: when a plan, decision, or person is officially accepted

sentences.english: the spring’s alleged curative properties
sentences.chinese: 这处泉水号称能治病的功效

detailed_translations.chinese: 有助于治疗的，有疗效的
detailed_translations.english: able to or intended to cure illness

sentences.english: Baxter was rushed to the hospital with multiple stab wounds.
sentences.chinese: 巴克斯特因多处刺伤被紧急送往医院。

sentences.english: Having multiple partners increases your risk of sexual diseases.
sentences.chinese: 性伴侣多会增加得性病的风险。

sentences.english: His new album includes multiple versions of the same songs.
sentences.chinese: 他的新专辑包括同一些歌曲的多种版本。

detailed_translations.english: many, or involving many things, people, events etc
a number that contains a smaller number an exact number of times

sentences.english: ...a professor of microbiology and immunology.
sentences.chinese: ...一位微生物学和免疫学教授。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of very small living things such as  bacteria

name: magnet
trans: 磁铁， 磁石； 磁体； 有吸引力的人或物

sentences.english: It's possible to hang a nail from a magnet and then use that nail to pick up another nail.
sentences.chinese: 把一颗钉子挂在一个磁体上再用这颗钉子去吸起另一颗钉子是可能的。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of iron or steel that can stick to metal or make other metal objects move towards itself

sentences.english: He lifted his T-shirt to expose a jagged scar across his chest.
sentences.chinese: 他撩起T恤衫，露出横贯胸部的锯齿状伤疤。

detailed_translations.english: to show something that is usually covered or hidden

name: versatile
trans: 多才多艺的， 多面手的； 多用途的， 通用的

sentences.english: The potato is an extremely versatile vegetable.
sentences.chinese: 马铃薯是一种用途极广的蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: having many different uses

name: concentrate
trans: 全神贯注，全力以赴；集中，聚集；浓缩

sentences.english: Now please concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 现在请集中注意力。

sentences.english: Adrian was finding it difficult to concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 阿德里安觉得自己很难集中注意力。

sentences.english: Italian industry is concentrated mainly in the north.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的工业主要集中在北部。

sentences.english: orange juice made from concentrate
sentences.chinese: 用浓缩橙汁冲兑的橙汁

detailed_translations.english: to think very carefully about something that you are doing

sentences.english: the New York Knicks versus the LA Lakers
sentences.chinese: 纽约尼克斯队对洛杉矶湖人队

sentences.english: the Supreme Court decision in Roe vs. Wade
sentences.chinese: 最高法院关于罗诉韦德案的判决

detailed_translations.english: used to show that two people or teams are competing against each other in a game or court case

sentences.english: The highlands are populated mainly by peasant farmers.
sentences.chinese: 高原人口主要是农民。

detailed_translations.english: if an area is populated by a particular group of people, they live there

name: up-to-date
trans: 直到最近的； 现代的

sentences.english: ...the most up-to-date information available on foods today.
sentences.chinese: …今日有关食品的最新消息。

detailed_translations.chinese: 直到最近的， 现代的； 跟上时代的
detailed_translations.english: modern or fashionable

name: suitable
trans: 适当的， 相配的； 合适的， 适宜的

sentences.english: We are hoping to find a suitable school.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望能找到一所合适的学校。

detailed_translations.english: having the right qualities for a particular person, purpose, or situation

sentences.english: All personnel are to receive security badges.
sentences.chinese: 所有人员都将拿到安保徽章。

detailed_translations.english: the people who work in a company, organization, or military force

sentences.english: Water splashed onto the floor.
sentences.chinese: 水哗的一声泼洒在地板上。

sentences.english: He splashed cold water on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他把冷水往脸上泼。

sentences.english: We heard the splash when she fell into the pool.
sentences.chinese: 她掉进游泳池时我们听见扑通的一声。

detailed_translations.english: (of liquid) to fall noisily onto a surface
the sound of sth hitting liquid or of liquid hitting sth

name: outlook
trans: 观点， 见解； 展望， 前景

sentences.english: Exercise will improve your looks and your outlook.
sentences.chinese: 运动将会改善你的外在形象和人生态度。

detailed_translations.english: your general attitude to life and the world

name: romance
trans: 恋爱； 浪漫爱情； 爱情小说， 传奇故事

sentences.english: Michelle married him after a whirlwind romance (= one that happens very suddenly and quickly ) .
sentences.chinese: 经过一场旋风式的恋爱，米歇尔嫁给了他。

detailed_translations.chinese: 传奇；浪漫史；风流韵事；冒险故事
detailed_translations.english: an exciting and often short relationship between two people who love each other
to describe things that have happened in a way that makes them seem more important, interesting etc than they really were

sentences.english: The fountain wells its cold water.
sentences.chinese: 喷泉涌出清凉的泉水。

sentences.english: He was a fountain of information on Asian affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他是亚洲事务的信息源。

detailed_translations.english: a structure from which water is pushed up into the air, used for example as decoration in a garden or park

sentences.english: We’re focussing too much on irrelevant details.
sentences.chinese: 我们过于关注不相干的细节。

sentences.english: Students viewed Latin as boring and irrelevant.
sentences.chinese: 学生认为拉丁语无聊且无关紧要。

detailed_translations.english: not useful or not relating to a particular situation, and therefore not important

name: gadget
trans: 小巧的器械， 精巧的装置； 小玩意

sentences.english: ...sales of kitchen gadgets including toasters, kettles, and percolators.
sentences.chinese: …厨房小用品的销售，包括烤面包机、水壶和咖啡渗滤壶。

detailed_translations.chinese: 小玩意；小器具；小配件；诡计
detailed_translations.english: A gadget is a small machine or device which does something useful. You sometimes refer to something as a gadget when you are suggesting that it is complicated and unnecessary.

sentences.english: Chris Robertson of Australia beat his compatriot Chris Dittmar in the final.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚的克里斯·罗伯逊在决赛中击败了他的本国对手克里斯·迪特玛。

detailed_translations.english: someone who was born in or is a citizen of the same country as someone else

name: implication
trans: 含意； 暗示， 暗指； 卷入， 牵连

sentences.english: They are called ‘Supertrams’, the implication being that (= which is meant to suggest that ) they are more advanced than earlier models.
sentences.chinese: 它们被称作“超级电车”，这是暗指它们比先前的型号更先进。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion that is not made directly but that people are expected to understand or accept

sentences.english: fierce guard dogs
sentences.chinese: 凶猛的看门狗

sentences.english: fierce fighting in the city
sentences.chinese: 城里的激烈战斗

detailed_translations.english: a fierce person or animal is angry or ready to attack, and looks very frightening

name: reservation
trans: 保留意见， 存疑； 预定， 预订

sentences.english: a dinner reservation
sentences.chinese: 预订晚餐

sentences.english: Customers are advised to make seat reservations well in advance.
sentences.chinese: 建议顾客提前订座。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement which you make so that a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc is kept for you at a particular time in the future

name: block
trans: 一排房屋，街区；阻塞；大块木料
阻塞， 拦阻； 封锁

sentences.english: a wall made of concrete blocks
sentences.chinese: 由混凝土块砌成的墙

detailed_translations.english: a piece of hard material such as wood or stone with straight sides
to prevent anything moving through a space by being or placing something across it or in it

detailed_translations.chinese: 成批的，大块的；交通堵塞的

sentences.english: Check the expiry date for all foam extinguisher.
sentences.chinese: 检查所有泡沫灭火器的过期时间。

sentences.english: They threw eggs, sticks, bottles and a fire extinguisher at the police.
sentences.chinese: 他们向警察投掷了鸡蛋，木棍，酒瓶和一些灭火器。

sentences.english: Abstr: The text elaborated the basic step of the high civil building extinguisher distribution design, and illustrate with example.
sentences.chinese: 文章摘要： 本文阐述了高层民用建筑灭火器配置设计的基本步骤，并举例说明。

detailed_translations.english: a fire extinguisher

name: cooperation
trans: 合作， 协作； 配合

sentences.english: the need to strengthen international co-operation
sentences.chinese: 加强国际合作的需要

detailed_translations.english: when you work with someone to achieve something that you both want

sentences.english: I was a timid child.
sentences.chinese: 我曾是个胆小的孩子。

sentences.english: a policy that is both timid and inadequate
sentences.chinese: 一项既无胆识又不完善的政策

detailed_translations.english: not having courage or confidence

name: propose
trans: 提议， 建议； 提名， 推荐； 打算； 求婚

sentences.english: the changes currently proposed by the local planning authorities
sentences.chinese: 目前由地方规划局提议的改革

sentences.english: the proposed budget cuts
sentences.chinese: 所提出的预算削减

detailed_translations.english: to suggest something as a plan or course of action

sentences.english: Alexander and Gaius and Pompeius, what are they in comparison with Diogenes and Heraclitus and Socrates?
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大、盖耶斯和庞培与第欧根尼、赫拉克利特、苏格拉底比较起来是什么人呢？

sentences.english: They let the land lie fallow for a year.
sentences.chinese: 他们让土地休耕一年。

detailed_translations.english: fallow land is dug or  ploughed  but is not used for growing crops
land treated in this way
to leave (land) unseeded after ploughing and harrowing it

name: renewable
trans: 可更新的， 可再生的， 可恢复的； 可延长有效期的， 可续期的

sentences.english: It’s a six-month lease but it’s renewable.
sentences.chinese: 租期六个月，但是可以续签。

sentences.english: a renewable visa
sentences.chinese: 可延期的签证

detailed_translations.english: if an agreement or official document is renewable, you can make it continue for a further period of time after it ends

sentences.english: Her stare was malevolent, her mouth a thin line.
sentences.chinese: 她目光狠毒，嘴唇紧闭。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恶毒的；有恶意的；坏心肠的
detailed_translations.english: a malevolent person wants to harm other people

name: ensue
trans: 继而发生； 接着发生

sentences.english: If the Europeans did not reduce subsidies, a trade war would ensue.
sentences.chinese: 如果欧洲不减少补贴，贸易战将随即爆发。

detailed_translations.english: If something ensues, it happens immediately after another event, usually as a result of it

name: foreseeable
trans: 可预知的， 能预测的

sentences.english: The judge found that it was not foreseeable that the fuel would catch fire.
sentences.chinese: 法官裁定，燃料着火是无法预料的。

sentences.english: foreseeable risk
sentences.chinese: 可预料的风险

detailed_translations.english: foreseeable difficulties, events etc should be planned for because they are very likely to happen in the future

sentences.english: a tennis coach
sentences.chinese: 网球教练

sentences.english: the Norwegian national coach
sentences.chinese: 挪威国家队教练

detailed_translations.english: someone who trains a person or team in a sport

sentences.english: I pine for the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 我渴望乡下的生活。

detailed_translations.english: If you pine for something, you want it very much, especially when it is unlikely that you will be able to have it
a tall tree with long hard sharp leaves that do not fall off in winter
the moving belt that you collect your bags from at an airport

name: irony
trans: 反话， 讽刺； 出人意料的事情

sentences.english: Life is full of little ironies.
sentences.chinese: 生活中充满了小小的讽刺。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that is unusual or amusing because something strange happens, or the opposite of what is expected happens or is true

sentences.english: He’s always getting into scraps with other dogs.
sentences.chinese: 它老是和别的狗打起来。

sentences.english: There's always tons of scrap paper in Dad's office.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸的办公室里总有大量的废纸。

detailed_translations.english: a short fight or argument
Scrap metal or paper is no longer wanted for its original purpose, but may have some other use

sentences.english: The conjunction of low inflation and low unemployment came as a very pleasant surprise.
sentences.chinese: 低通货膨胀与低失业的同时出现是一大惊喜。

sentences.english: The two clauses are joined by a conjunction.
sentences.chinese: 这两个分句由一个连词连在一起.

detailed_translations.english: a combination of events, etc., that causes a particular result
of or relating to a judicial or legislative chamber

sentences.english: The meadow has been ploughed up.
sentences.chinese: 那片草地已用犁翻过。

sentences.english: The colt bounded through the meadow.
sentences.chinese: 那匹马驹跳着跑过牧场。

sentences.english: There are many lambs capering in the meadow.
sentences.chinese: 很多小羊在草地上蹦蹦跳跳。

detailed_translations.english: a field with wild grass and flowers

sentences.english: Are you going to roast the chicken?
sentences.chinese: 这鸡你是准备烤的吗？

sentences.english: the delicious smell of meat roasting
sentences.chinese: 烤肉的香味

sentences.english: We caught a rabbit and roasted it over an open fire.
sentences.chinese: 我们捉到一只兔子，放在火上烧烤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 烤，焙；烘，烘烤；暴露于某种热力下以得温暖
detailed_translations.english: to cook something, such as meat, in an  oven  or over a fire, or to cook in this way
roasted
a large piece of roasted meat

name: succession
trans: 连续； 接替， 继承

sentences.english: If the prince dies, the succession passes to his son.
sentences.chinese: 王子如果去世，就由他的儿子继承。

detailed_translations.english: the act of taking over an official job or position, or the right to be the next to take it

sentences.english: the steam locomotive which hauled the train
sentences.chinese: 拖动火车的蒸汽机车

sentences.english: I hauled the door shut behind me.
sentences.chinese: 我用力拽上了门。

detailed_translations.english: to pull something heavy with a continuous steady movement

detailed_translations.chinese: 拖， 拉， 托运； 一次获得的数量
detailed_translations.english: the amount of fish caught when fishing with a net

name: energetic
trans: 有力的， 精力旺盛的； 积极的

sentences.english: an energetic man
sentences.chinese: 精力旺盛的男子

sentences.english: an energetic drive to get more customers
sentences.chinese: 争取更多客户的十足干劲

detailed_translations.english: having or needing a lot of energy or determination

sentences.english: Guests should feel at liberty to avail themselves of your facilities.
sentences.chinese: 客人们应可以随意使用你们的设施。

sentences.english: His efforts were to no avail.
sentences.chinese: 他的努力是徒劳的。

detailed_translations.english: to be helpful or useful to sb

name: wastage
trans: 消耗量； 损耗； 减员

sentences.english: The system used to result in a great deal of food wastage.
sentences.chinese: 这种做法过去造成了大量的食物浪费。

detailed_translations.english: when something is lost or destroyed, especially in a way that is not useful or reasonable, or the amount that is lost or destroyed

name: impoverish
trans: 使贫困； 使枯竭， 使贫瘠

sentences.english: Falling coffee prices have impoverished many developing economies.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡价格下跌使很多发展中的经济面临困境。

sentences.english: families impoverished by debt
sentences.chinese: 因负债而贫穷的家庭

detailed_translations.english: to make someone very poor

name: calibre
trans: 质量， 才干， 能力； 口径

sentences.english: The school attracts a high calibre of student.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校吸引高素质的学生。

detailed_translations.english: the level of quality or ability that someone or something has achieved

name: premier
trans: 首要的， 第一位的； 最著名的

sentences.english: one of Dublin’s premier hotels
sentences.chinese: 都柏林最好的酒店之一

detailed_translations.english: best or most important
a  prime minister  – used in news reports

sentences.english: The bones will be buried in hallowed ground.
sentences.chinese: 尸骸将被安葬在神圣的土地上。

detailed_translations.english: holy or made holy by religious practices

sentences.english: Mark’s very intellectual.
sentences.chinese: 马克很聪明。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the ability to understand things and think intelligently
an intelligent, well-educated person who spends time thinking about complicated ideas and discussing them

name: reclaim
trans: 纠正； 要求归还， 收回； 开垦

sentences.english: You may be entitled to reclaim some tax.
sentences.chinese: 你也许可以享受一定额度的退税。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开拓；回收再利用；改造某人，使某人悔改
detailed_translations.english: to get back an amount of money that you have paid

name: allergic
trans: 过敏的， 变态反应的， 变应性的

sentences.english: an allergic reaction to nuts
sentences.chinese: 对坚果的过敏性反应

detailed_translations.english: having an allergy

sentences.english: The company engaged in a deliberate effort to cheat them out of their pensions.
sentences.chinese: 该公司曾蓄意诈取他们的养老金。

detailed_translations.english: If someone cheats you out of something, they get it from you by behaving dishonestly
to behave in a dishonest way in order to win or to get an advantage, especially in a competition, game, or examination

name: disable
trans: 使丧失能力， 使伤残； 使不能正常运转， 使无效

sentences.english: She did all this tendon damage and it really disabled her.
sentences.chinese: 她肌腱受了这么多损伤，这真地使她致残了。

detailed_translations.english: If an injury or illness disables someone, it affects them so badly that it restricts the way that they can live their life

name: undoubtedly
trans: 毋庸置疑地， 确凿地

sentences.english: This is undoubtedly important.
sentences.chinese: 这无疑是重要的。

sentences.english: While such ways of traveling certainly have their benefits, there are also undoubtedly some disadvantages.
sentences.chinese: 这种旅行方式当然有它们的长处所在，但毫无疑问也有一些缺憾。

name: horrify
trans: 使恐惧， 使惊骇； 使震惊； 使感到厌恶

sentences.english: His family was horrified by the change.
sentences.chinese: 他的家人对这一变化感到震惊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使恐惧；惊骇；使极度厌恶
detailed_translations.english: If someone is horrified, they feel shocked or disgusted, usually because of something that they have seen or heard

name: anecdote
trans: 短故事； 趣闻， 轶事

sentences.english: The book is full of amusing anecdotes about his life in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 这本书里全是他在日本生活的趣闻轶事。

detailed_translations.english: a short story based on your personal experience

name: extravagance
trans: 奢侈， 挥霍； 放肆的言行

sentences.english: When the company went under, tales of his extravagance surged through the industry.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司破产时，有关他的奢靡的传言传遍了整个业界。

detailed_translations.chinese: 奢侈，浪费；过度；放肆的言行
detailed_translations.english: Extravagance is the spending of more money than is reasonable or than you can afford

name: infiltrate
trans: 悄悄进入， 潜入； 渗入， 渗透

sentences.english: Police attempts to infiltrate neo-Nazi groups were largely unsuccessful.
sentences.chinese: 警方想打入新纳粹团体的行动基本上不成功。

detailed_translations.english: to secretly join an organization or enter a place in order to find out information about it or harm it

name: hostile
trans: 敌方的； 不友善的； 不利的

sentences.english: Southampton fans gave their former coach a hostile reception .
sentences.chinese: 南安普敦队的球迷对球队的前任教练很不友善。

sentences.english: Carr wouldn’t meet Feng’s stare, which was openly hostile .
sentences.chinese: 卡尔不愿意面对冯公然敌视的目光。

sentences.english: his hostile attitude
sentences.chinese: 他敌对的态度

detailed_translations.english: angry and deliberately unfriendly towards someone, and ready to argue with them

sentences.english: Coal is one of the cheapest fuels.
sentences.chinese: 煤是最廉价的燃料之一。

detailed_translations.english: a substance such as coal, gas, or oil that can be burned to produce heat or energy
if you fuel a vehicle, or if it fuels up, fuel is put into it

sentences.english: Tourism is damaging the flora and fauna (= plants and animals ) of the island.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业正在破坏该岛的动植物资源。

detailed_translations.english: all the plants that grow in a particular place or country

sentences.english: ...the clusters of celestial bodies in the ever-expanding universe.
sentences.chinese: …不断扩展的宇宙中的这些天体群。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the sky or heaven

name: crawl
trans: 缓慢的行进； 自由泳

sentences.english: We crawled into bed at 2 am.
sentences.chinese: 我们凌晨两点爬上了床。

detailed_translations.english: to move along on your hands and knees with your body close to the ground
a way of swimming in which you lie on your stomach and move one arm, and then the other, over your head

name: identical
trans: 完全相同的， 同一的

sentences.english: four identical houses
sentences.chinese: 四幢一模一样的房子

detailed_translations.english: exactly the same, or very similar

sentences.english: In this scenario, due to the lag time required to assimilate new resources, the relationship between required resources and estimated delivery timeframe may even turn negative.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，由于时间已经落后，需要吸收新的人力资源，需要的资源和预计的交付时间的关系甚至更加复杂。

sentences.english: But to many, at least as far as science is concerned, it is the countries that were doing well that are now doing better, whereas those at the bottom continue to lag significantly behind.
sentences.chinese: 但是对于许多人而言，至少在科学方面，正是那些在过去做的很好的国家现在正在做的更好，而那些位于底层的国家的科学继续落后。

sentences.english: One is that some countries still lag behind.
sentences.chinese: 一个原因是一些国家仍很落后。

name: ambitious
trans: 有抱负的， 有雄心的， 有野心的

sentences.english: Alfred was intensely ambitious, obsessed with the idea of becoming rich.
sentences.chinese: 艾尔弗雷德雄心勃勃，一心想着发财。

detailed_translations.english: determined to be successful, rich, powerful etc

name: academic
trans: 学院的；学术的；不切实际的

sentences.english: He possessed no academic qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他没有学历。

sentences.english: a program to raise academic standards
sentences.chinese: 旨在提高学术水平的计划

detailed_translations.english: relating to education, especially at college or university level

sentences.english: It is like the bow of the King of the Persians that is painted with vermilion and is tipped with coral.
sentences.chinese: 你的嘴唇就像是波斯王国的弯弓，那是一张涂上朱砂的弯弓，那是一张头上镶嵌珊瑚的弯弓。

sentences.english: I believe they are doing a good job with that. How about the coral? Is it really as beautiful as they say?
sentences.chinese: 我相信他们是在做好事。对了，珊瑚怎么样？它们真的就像人们说的那么漂亮吗？

detailed_translations.english: pink or reddish-orange in colour
a hard red, white, or pink substance formed from the bones of very small sea creatures, which is often used to make jewellery

name: function
trans: 功能； 职责， 作用； 函数

sentences.english: Her legs have now ceased to function .
sentences.chinese: 她的双腿现在已经丧失正常功能了。

sentences.english: You know I can’t function (= cannot perform normal activities ) without a coffee in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 你知道的，我早上不喝杯咖啡就无法工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作， 运行； 起作用
detailed_translations.english: to work in the correct or intended way

detailed_translations.chinese: 功能，职务；【数】函数；重大聚会
detailed_translations.english: the purpose that something has, or the job that someone or something does

sentences.english: the ever-rising statistics of delinquency and crime
sentences.chinese: 青少年违法犯罪不断增加的统计数字

name: representative
trans: 典型的， 有代表性的

sentences.english: The latest incident is representative of a wider trend.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件代表了一个更大的趋势。

sentences.english: an elected representative of the people
sentences.chinese: 民选代表

detailed_translations.english: typical of a particular group or thing
someone who has been chosen to speak, vote, or make decisions for someone else

sentences.english: The town lies at longitude 12˚ east.
sentences.chinese: 这个镇位于东经12度。

detailed_translations.english: the distance east or west of a particular  meridian (= imaginary line along the Earth’s surface from the North Pole to the South Pole )  , measured in degrees

name: lax
trans: 懒散的； 松弛的， 不严格的， 马虎的

sentences.english: One of the problem areas is lax security for airport personnel.
sentences.chinese: 其中一个问题是对机场人员的安全措施不严格。

detailed_translations.english: not strict or careful enough about standards of behaviour, work, safety etc

name: comparison
trans: 比较， 对比， 对照； 比喻， 比拟

sentences.english: Her paintings invite comparison with those of the early Impressionists (= they remind you of them ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的画作让人想起早期的印象派作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 比拟， 比喻
detailed_translations.english: the process of comparing two or more people or things

sentences.english: The problems do not end if crocodiles successfully hatch from the eggs.
sentences.chinese: 即使鳄鱼成功地从卵中孵化出来，这些问题也不会终止。

detailed_translations.english: a hole in a ship or aircraft, usually used for loading goods, or the door that covers it
if an egg hatches, or if it is hatched, it breaks, letting the young bird, insect etc come out

name: pardon
trans: 请重复一遍，请再说一遍〔没听清对方的话希望重复一遍时的用语〕

sentences.english: He craved the teacher's pardon.
sentences.chinese: 他恳求老师原谅他。

sentences.english: I earnestly pray for your pardon.
sentences.chinese: 我恳切地请求你原谅。

sentences.english: I hope you will pardon me for doing so.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你原谅我这样做。

detailed_translations.english: to forgive someone for behaving badly
used to say ‘sorry’ after you have made an impolite sound such as a  burp

sentences.english: The meat of the herbivore is, in comparison, far more edible , smellwise.
sentences.chinese: 相对地，食草动物的肉闻起来要好些，更易食用。

sentences.english: I only eat vegetables (scientists call me a herbivore) -- almost always leaves from the tops of trees.
sentences.chinese: 我只吃蔬菜(科学家称我为草食动物)—几乎常常是树梢的叶子。

sentences.english: You probably would call me a vegetarian. But scientists call me a herbivore because I only eat leaves, grass and other plants.
sentences.chinese: 可能你会说我是素食者，但科学家称我为草食动物，因为我只吃叶子、草和其它植物。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that only eats plants

name: adventure
trans: 冒险， 冒险活动； 异乎寻常的经历， 奇遇

sentences.english: a great adventure
sentences.chinese: 一大奇遇

sentences.english: Ahab’s adventures at sea
sentences.chinese: 亚哈的海上历险

sentences.english: an adventure story
sentences.chinese: 一个历险故事

detailed_translations.english: an exciting experience in which dangerous or unusual things happen

sentences.english: The team has had five successive victories.
sentences.chinese: 这支球队已经连胜五场了。

sentences.english: Successive governments have tried to deal with this issue.
sentences.chinese: 历届政府都试图解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: coming or following one after the other

name: condition
trans: 训练； 使适应， 使习惯于； 对…有重要影响

sentences.english: Profits increased by £1.5m, despite the difficult economic conditions.
sentences.chinese: 尽管经济形势不佳，利润还是增长了150万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the state that something is in, especially how good or bad its physical state is

sentences.english: Can I have a glass of water? I’m really thirsty.
sentences.chinese: 我能喝一杯水吗？ 我太渴了。

sentences.english: He’d been working in the garden and was very hot and thirsty.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在花园里干活，又热又渴。

sentences.english: All this digging is thirsty work (= work that makes you want a drink ) .
sentences.chinese: 这种挖地的活干了让人口渴。

detailed_translations.chinese: 口渴的，口干的；渴望的，热望的
detailed_translations.english: feeling that you want or need a drink

sentences.english: a wedding ceremony
sentences.chinese: 婚礼

sentences.english: the opening ceremony of the Olympic Games
sentences.chinese: 奥运会开幕式

sentences.english: The queen was crowned with due ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 女王按照规定的礼仪加冕。

detailed_translations.english: an important social or religious event, when a traditional set of actions is performed in a formal way

sentences.english: a course for students wishing to improve their English
sentences.chinese: 为想提高英语水平的学生开设的一门课

sentences.english: The doctors say she is improving (= after being ill ).
sentences.chinese: 医生说她正在康复。

sentences.english: You could use the money for improving your home.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用这笔钱改善家居。

sentences.english: Many wines improve with age (= get better as they get older ).
sentences.chinese: 很多葡萄酒年代越久越香醇。

detailed_translations.english: to make something better, or to become better
to make something better, or to become better

name: obligation
trans: 义务， 职责， 责任

sentences.english: Employers have an obligation to treat all employees equally.
sentences.chinese: 雇主有责任对所有员工一视同仁。

sentences.english: Parents are under a legal obligation to educate their children.
sentences.chinese: 家长对子女的教育负有法律责任。

sentences.english: You are under no obligation to buy any more books.
sentences.chinese: 你不必非要买更多的书。

sentences.english: Greater resources are needed to meet these obligations.
sentences.chinese: 履行这些义务需要更多的资源。

sentences.english: the rights and obligations imposed on them by treaties
sentences.chinese: 条约给他们规定的权利和义务

sentences.english: The government must pay for health care for war veterans – it is an obligation we owe to them.
sentences.chinese: 政府必须为退伍军人支付医疗保健费用——这是我们对他们负有的义务。

sentences.english: a moral obligation to help the poor
sentences.chinese: 帮助穷人的道德义务

sentences.english: He stayed with the team out of a sense of obligation.
sentences.chinese: 他出于责任感而留在队里。

detailed_translations.english: a moral or legal duty to do something

name: vice versa
trans: 反过来也是如此，反之亦然

sentences.english: The boys may refuse to play with the girls, and vice versa.
sentences.chinese: 男孩可能拒绝和女孩玩耍，反之亦然。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that the opposite of a situation you have just described is also true

sentences.english: Oil thieves sometimes hawk stolen gasoline on the side of highways.
sentences.chinese: 石油大盗们有时在公路边上兜售偷来的石油。

detailed_translations.english: a large bird that hunts and eats small birds and animals
to try to sell goods, usually by going from place to place and trying to persuade people to buy them

sentences.english: Visitors were a rarity in the village.
sentences.chinese: 村里极少有外人来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 罕见；珍贵；珍品（需用复数）；稀薄
detailed_translations.english: to not happen or exist very often

name: patriotic
trans: 爱国的， 有爱国心的； 显示出爱国精神的

sentences.english: patriotic songs
sentences.chinese: 爱国歌曲

sentences.english: a patriotic man who served his country well
sentences.chinese: 为国尽忠的爱国者

detailed_translations.english: having or expressing a great love of your country

sentences.english: ...the ladies' lavatory.
sentences.chinese: …女厕所。

detailed_translations.english: a toilet or the room a toilet is in

sentences.english: The exterior walls need a new coat of paint.
sentences.chinese: 外墙需要刷新漆了。

detailed_translations.english: on the outside of something
the outside of something, especially a building

name: censure
trans: 指责， 谴责， 责难

sentences.english: The ethics committee may take a decision to admonish him or to censure him.
sentences.chinese: 道德规范委员会可能决定对他进行警告或批评。

detailed_translations.english: If you censure someone for something that they have done, you tell them that you strongly disapprove of it
the act of expressing strong disapproval and criticism

name: airtight
trans: 密闭的； 无懈可击的

sentences.english: airtight containers
sentences.chinese: 密封容器

detailed_translations.chinese: 密闭的，密封的；无懈可击的
detailed_translations.english: not allowing air to get in or out

name: technique
trans: 技巧， 技艺； 技术， 技能

sentences.english: In mathematics, we use many techniques of problem-solving.
sentences.chinese: 在数学中，我们会使用多种方法解题。

sentences.english: He’s a great player, with brilliant technique.
sentences.chinese: 他是个伟大的球员，球技十分精湛。

detailed_translations.english: a special way of doing something

sentences.english: a secretary who takes shorthand (= writes in shorthand )
sentences.chinese: 会速记的秘书

detailed_translations.english: a fast method of writing using special signs or shorter forms to represent letters, words, and phrases

sentences.english: The hostages were released from captivity.
sentences.chinese: 人质被释放了。

detailed_translations.english: when a person or animal is kept in a prison,  cage  etc and not allowed to go where they want

name: scenery
trans: 舞台布景； 风景， 景色

sentences.english: The best part of the trip was the fantastic scenery.
sentences.chinese: 此次旅行最精彩之处就是那美妙绝伦的风景。

sentences.english: Instead of stagehands, the actors will move the scenery right in front of the audience.
sentences.chinese: 演员们将替代舞台工作人员，当着观众的面置换布景。

detailed_translations.english: the natural features of a particular part of a country that you can see, such as mountains, forests, deserts etc

name: effective
trans: 有效的， 生效的； 给人深刻印象的， 显著的

sentences.english: The cheaper drugs are just as effective in treating arthritis.
sentences.chinese: 较便宜的药品对治疗关节炎同样有效。

sentences.english: the painting’s highly effective use of colour
sentences.chinese: 绘画中得心应手的色彩运用

sentences.english: Training is often much less effective than expected.
sentences.chinese: 训练的效果往往远低于预期。

sentences.english: the most effective ways of reducing inner city congestion
sentences.chinese: 减少旧城区交通拥挤最有效的办法

detailed_translations.english: successful, and working in the way that was intended

name: mishandle
trans: 粗暴地对待； 错误地处理， 胡乱操作

sentences.english: The prime minister admitted that the crisis had been mishandled.
sentences.chinese: 首相承认此次危机处理不当。

detailed_translations.chinese: 粗暴地对待； 错误地处理， 胡乱操作
detailed_translations.english: to deal with a situation badly, because of a lack of skill or care

sentences.english: The first letter she wrote me was less than a page long, and her second letter was similarly brief.
sentences.chinese: 她写给我的第一封信不到一页，第二封信也一样简短。

sentences.english: The cost of food and clothing has come down in recent years. Similarly, fuel prices have fallen quite considerably.
sentences.chinese: 吃穿的费用近年来下降了。 同样地，燃料价格也有大幅 回落。

detailed_translations.english: in a similar way

name: muscle
trans: 肌肉； 体力； 力量， 实力

sentences.english: Relax your stomach muscles , then stretch again.
sentences.chinese: 放松腹部肌肉，然后再绷紧。

sentences.english: Regular exercise will help to strengthen your muscles .
sentences.chinese: 经常锻炼有助于强健肌肉。

sentences.english: It took muscle to work in an old-fashioned kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 在老式厨房里干活很费力。

detailed_translations.english: one of the pieces of flesh inside your body that you use in order to move, and that connect your bones together

sentences.english: Dietler is generous with his time and money.
sentences.chinese: 迪特勒在他的时间和金钱方面慷慨大方。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is generous is willing to give money, spend time etc, in order to help people or give them pleasure

sentences.english: the detrimental effect of pollution on the environment
sentences.chinese: 污染对环境的不利影响

detailed_translations.english: causing harm or damage

detailed_translations.chinese: 有害的人（或物）；不受欢迎的求婚者

sentences.english: Which direction did they go in ?
sentences.chinese: 他们朝哪个方向走了？

sentences.english: A very helpful woman gave me directions to the police station.
sentences.chinese: 一个很热心的妇女给我指了去警察局的路。

sentences.english: Be sure you read the directions before using any piece of equipment.
sentences.chinese: 使用任何设备之前一定要先阅读操作指南。

detailed_translations.english: the way something or someone moves, faces, or is aimed

sentences.english: All visitors to the exhibition must report to the main service desk.
sentences.chinese: 到展览会参观的人都必须先到总服务台报到。

sentences.english: Our country will tie up with another country to host this exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 我国将和另外一个国家联合主办这次展览会。

sentences.english: You go to the exhibition centre, I must hie myself to tell the new matters.
sentences.chinese: 你去展览中心吧，我得赶紧汇报一下这个新情况。

detailed_translations.english: a show of paintings, photographs, or other objects that people can go to see

name: twofold
trans: 两倍的，双重的；两部分的

sentences.english: a twofold increase in cases of TB
sentences.chinese: 结核病例两倍的增加

detailed_translations.chinese: 两倍的，双重的；两部分的
detailed_translations.english: two times as much or as many of something

sentences.english: Gerald was 38, and a confirmed bachelor (=  a man who has decided that he will never marry  ) .
sentences.chinese: 杰拉德38岁，抱定主意独身。

sentences.english: a Bachelor of Arts/Engineering/Science
sentences.chinese: 文学士；工程学士；理学士

detailed_translations.english: a man who has never been married

name: probe
trans: 探针； 探测器， 探测飞船； 探索， 调查

sentences.english: a fibre-optic probe
sentences.chinese: 一根光纤探针

sentences.english: The surgeon would pick up his instruments, probe, repair, and stitch up again.
sentences.chinese: 外科医生会拿起器械进行探查、修复，然后再缝合。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin metal instrument that doctors and scientists use to examine parts of the body
to look for something or examine something, using a long thin object

name: inflate
trans: 使充气， 使膨胀； 使得意， 使骄傲； 抬高， 使膨胀

sentences.english: It took us half an hour to inflate the dinghy.
sentences.chinese: 我们用了半小时给橡皮筏充好气。

sentences.english: Her life jacket failed to inflate.
sentences.chinese: 她的救生衣未能充进去气。

detailed_translations.english: to fill something with air or gas so it becomes larger, or to become filled with air or gas

name: stable
trans: 稳定的，稳固的，安定的；沉稳的，持重的

sentences.english: A wide base will make the structure much more stable.
sentences.chinese: 宽大的底座会使结构牢固许多。

sentences.english: Children like a stable environment.
sentences.chinese: 儿童喜欢稳定的环境。

detailed_translations.chinese: 稳定的，不变的；沉稳的，持重的
detailed_translations.english: steady and not likely to move or change
a building where horses are kept

sentences.english: We can harness the power of the wind to generate electricity.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以利用风力发电。

detailed_translations.english: to control and use the natural force or power of something

name: respond
trans: 回答， 答复； 响应； 作出反应

sentences.english: They are likely to respond positively to the president's request for aid.
sentences.chinese: 他们有可能积极地回应该总统的援助请求。

detailed_translations.chinese: 回答， 答复； 作出反应， 响应
detailed_translations.english: to do something as a reaction to something that has been said or done

sentences.english: So if we just sketch that.
sentences.chinese: 那么如果我们把那画个草图。

sentences.english: He squiggled a sketch on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他在地上胡乱地画了个草图。

detailed_translations.english: a simple, quickly made drawing that does not show much detail
a short humorous scene on a television programme, in a theatre etc, that is part of a larger show

name: incident
trans: 发生的事； 事件， 事变

sentences.english: His bad behaviour was just an isolated incident.
sentences.chinese: 他的不良行为只是个别事件。

sentences.english: Roads were sealed off because of a major incident.
sentences.chinese: 因为发生重大事故，道路被封锁了。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens, especially sth unusual or unpleasant

name: maintenance
trans: 维持； 保养； 抚养费

sentences.english: the cost of repairs and maintenance
sentences.chinese: 维修保养费

sentences.english: The theatres were closed on Saturday and Sunday for routine maintenance .
sentences.chinese: 戏院周六和周日关闭进行例行维护。

sentences.english: Engineers are carrying out essential maintenance work on the main line to Cambridge.
sentences.chinese: 机修工正在对通往剑桥的干线进行必要的养护。

sentences.english: an evening class in car maintenance
sentences.chinese: 汽车保养的夜校课程

detailed_translations.chinese: 维持； 保养； 抚养费
detailed_translations.english: the repairs, painting etc that are necessary to keep something in good condition

sentences.english: Do this for all nodes in the cluster.
sentences.chinese: 对集群中的所有节点都这样做。

sentences.english: This can be done on any server of the cluster.
sentences.chinese: 可以在集群的任何服务器中这样做。

sentences.english: However, there are some problems in the cluster environment.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在集群环境中却存在一些问题。

detailed_translations.english: a group of things of the same kind that are very close together
if a group of people or things cluster somewhere, or are clustered somewhere, they form a small group in that place

name: prey
trans: 捕食； 折磨， 使烦恼； 掠夺
猎物，捕获物；牺牲品，战利品

sentences.english: a tiger stalking its prey
sentences.chinese: 潜行跟踪猎物的老虎

sentences.english: Cats prey on birds and mice.
sentences.chinese: 猫捕食鸟和老鼠。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, bird etc that is hunted and eaten by another animal
(of an animal or a bird) to hunt and kill another animal for food

sentences.english: The woman gently tugged his arm.
sentences.chinese: 那女人轻轻拽了拽他的胳膊。

sentences.english: She removed the bandage with a sharp tug.
sentences.chinese: 她猛地一拉，扯下绷带。

detailed_translations.english: to pull with one or more short, quick pulls
a sudden strong pull

name: expedition
trans: 远征， 探险， 考察； 旅行， 出行； 远征队， 探险队， 考察队

sentences.english: an expedition to the North Pole
sentences.chinese: 北极探险

sentences.english: another Qomolangma expedition
sentences.chinese: 又一次珠穆朗玛峰探险

detailed_translations.english: a long and carefully organized journey, especially to a dangerous or unfamiliar place, or the people that make this journey

sentences.english: Because these cells are among the largest in the vertebrate brain, they were the first neurons to be identified.
sentences.chinese: 由于这些细胞是脊椎动物大脑中最大的细胞，它们是最早被识别出来的神经元。

sentences.english: Zoonoses are defined by the WHO as “Any disease or infection which is naturally transmissible from vertebrate animals to man".
sentences.chinese: 世界卫生组织将人畜共患病定义为“任何自然地从脊椎动物传播到人类的疾病或传染病”。

detailed_translations.english: a living creature that has a backbone

sentences.english: a rock concert
sentences.chinese: 摇滚音乐会

sentences.english: a concert of French choral music
sentences.chinese: 法国合唱音乐会

sentences.english: We were going to a concert in Bath Abbey.
sentences.chinese: 我们要去听一场在巴斯修道院内举行的音乐会。

sentences.english: She still does about 100 concerts every year.
sentences.chinese: 她每年仍然举行100场左右的演唱会。

detailed_translations.english: a performance given by musicians or singers

detailed_translations.chinese: 音乐会用的；在音乐会上演出的

name: unconcerned
trans: 漠不关心的； 不烦恼的

sentences.english: Paul was unconcerned about what he had done.
sentences.chinese: 保罗对自己所做过的事情并不在意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 漠不关心的； 不烦恼的
detailed_translations.english: not worried about something because you think it does not affect you

name: absorb
trans: 吸收； 吸引…的注意， 使全神贯注； 把…并入， 同化

sentences.english: Plants absorb nutrients from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物从土壤中吸收养分。

sentences.english: The movement and noise of the machines absorbed him completely.
sentences.chinese: 机器的运转和声响把他完全吸引住了。

detailed_translations.english: to take in liquid, gas, or another substance from the surface or space around something

name: supply
trans: 供给， 供应； 满足， 弥补

sentences.english: The nation’s fuel supplies will not last forever.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的燃料供应不会无穷无尽。

sentences.english: To protect the food supply , the government ordered the slaughter of affected cattle.
sentences.chinese: 为保护食品供应，政府下令宰杀被感染的牛。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of something that is available to be used

sentences.english: He was moved by her obvious concern.
sentences.chinese: 她明显的关心使他感动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 关切的事，有关的事；关心，挂念；关系，关联；公司，企业
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of wanting someone to be happy and healthy

detailed_translations.chinese: 涉及， 有关； 使关心， 使担心
detailed_translations.english: if a story, book, report etc concerns someone or something, it is about them

sentences.english: ...the chalk subsoil on the site.
sentences.chinese: ...工地的白垩底土。

detailed_translations.english: the layer of soil between the ground’s surface and the lower layer of hard rock

sentences.english: ...the institute's free fact sheet, Driving Abroad.
sentences.chinese: …该学院的免费简报《国外驾驶》。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper giving all the most important information about something

name: refrain
trans: 反复句， 叠句； 副歌； 经常重复的评价

sentences.english: Mrs. Hardie refrained from making any comment.
sentences.chinese: 哈迪太太忍住了没做任何评论。

detailed_translations.english: to not do something that you want to do
part of a song or poem that is repeated, especially at the end of each  verse

sentences.english: The company plans to merge its subsidiaries in the US.
sentences.chinese: 该公司计划合并其在美国的几家子公司。

detailed_translations.english: to combine, or to join things together to form one thing

sentences.english: The crash happened as the ferry attempted to dock on Staten Island.
sentences.chinese: 这次碰撞发生于渡船试图停靠在斯塔滕岛时。

detailed_translations.english: if a ship docks, or if the captain docks it, it sails into a dock so that it can unload
a place in a port where ships are loaded, unloaded, or repaired
if a ship docks, or if the captain docks it, it sails into a dock so that it can unload

sentences.english: The photographs were all jumbled up.
sentences.chinese: 照片乱七八糟地堆在一起。

sentences.english: Ben’s words became jumbled.
sentences.chinese: 本开始语无伦次起来。

detailed_translations.english: to mix things together in an untidy way, without any order
a lot of different things mixed together in an untidy way, without any order

name: element
trans: 要素； 元素； [the -s] 基本原理

sentences.english: Business and management elements are built into the course.
sentences.chinese: 本课程加入了商务和管理方面的内容。

sentences.english: Hydrogen is a one-valence element.
sentences.chinese: 氢是一价的元素。

detailed_translations.english: one part or feature of a whole system, plan, piece of work etc, especially one that is basic or important

name: opulence
trans: 财富， 富裕； 丰富， 富饶

sentences.english: They have concentrated on a opulence life style and realize thepoor working man who has seen very little benefit from the sale of oil is notgoing to come to their rescue.
sentences.chinese: 他们现在过着富裕的生活，并意识到那些从石油销售中没有获得多少好处的贫穷工人是不会来拯救他们的。

sentences.english: We believe our clients are more sophisticated they believe in a lifestyle of improved working environment, we believe this means opulence is not sufficient and more tools will be required.
sentences.chinese: 我们认为客户更复杂，他们信仰改善工作环境的生活方式，我们认为这意味空间的富裕是不够的，需要更多的工具。

sentences.english: The probable cause of the fire was faulty wiring.
sentences.chinese: 起火的原因很可能是电路故障。

sentences.english: Success is highly probable .
sentences.chinese: 成功的希望相当大。

detailed_translations.english: likely to exist, happen, or be true

detailed_translations.chinese: 很可能的事；大有希望的候选者
detailed_translations.english: someone who is likely to be chosen for a team, to win a race etc

sentences.english: I thought the medicine would make him sleep, but it had the opposite effect.
sentences.chinese: 我以为这药会让他睡觉，但是它却起了反作用。

sentences.english: At the opposite extreme, Ashworth’s style is very simple and modern.
sentences.chinese: 截然相反的是，阿什沃思的风格非常简单和现代。

sentences.english: Bob was quicker than Ed? It’s usually the opposite way round.
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃比埃德快？通常是反过来的。
