sentences.english: We work mainly with the elderly and other vulnerable groups.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要和老年人以及其他弱势群体打交道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脆弱的, 易受影响的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is vulnerable can be easily harmed or hurt

sentences.english: people who volunteer to donate blood
sentences.chinese: 自愿献血者

detailed_translations.english: to give something, especially money, to a person or an organization in order to help them

name: deplete
trans: 倒空； 枯竭； 消耗

sentences.english: ...substances that deplete the ozone layer.
sentences.chinese: …消耗臭氧层的物质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 耗尽，用尽；使衰竭，使空虚
detailed_translations.english: To deplete a stock or amount of something means to reduce it

sentences.english: They say that one sad story is tragic, but a thousand of them is a statistic.
sentences.chinese: 他们说一个悲惨的故事是悲剧，但一千个这样的故事就只是一个统计了。

sentences.english: You can track your time many different ways but some of the best apps that I have found for Android and iPhone are great when you are on the run and need to get a quick statistic to use for planning.
sentences.chinese: 你可以通过许多不同的方式来追踪你的时间，但是我发现当你正在进行或者为了制订计划需要快速统计时，一些适用于安卓手机或者苹果手机的应用软件十分有效。

detailed_translations.english: a single number which represents a fact or measurement

name: significant
trans: 有意义的； 重大的， 重要的

sentences.english: His most significant political achievement was the abolition of the death penalty.
sentences.chinese: 他政治上最重大的成就是废除了死刑。

sentences.english: Please inform us if there are any significant changes in your plans.
sentences.chinese: 你们的计划如有重大变动，请通知我们。

detailed_translations.english: having an important effect or influence, especially on what will happen in the future

name: bold
trans: 粗体的； 大胆的， 鲁莽的， 勇敢的； 醒目的

sentences.english: In a surprisingly bold move , he is threatening court action against the company.
sentences.chinese: 他出人意料地做出一个大胆举动，威胁要起诉这家公司。

sentences.english: My aunt Flo was a bold determined woman.
sentences.chinese: 我姑妈芙洛是一个大胆果断的人。

sentences.english: He had the ability to take bold imaginative decisions.
sentences.chinese: 他能够作出富有创见的大胆决定。

sentences.english: She marched into his office as bold as brass (= very confident and not showing enough respect ).
sentences.chinese: 她放肆地直闯进他的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: not afraid of taking risks and making difficult decisions

sentences.english: a mail order catalog
sentences.chinese: 邮购商品目录

sentences.english: an online catalogue
sentences.chinese: 网上目录

detailed_translations.english: a complete list of things that you can look at, buy, or use, for example in a library or at an art show
to make a complete list of all the things in a group

sentences.english: When the bag is folded, the bottom overlaps one side.
sentences.chinese: 把包折叠起来时，其底部与一边就重合了。

sentences.english: Overlap the slices carefully so there are no gaps.
sentences.chinese: 把薄片小心地叠放在一起，那样就没有间隙。

detailed_translations.chinese: 部分重叠； 部分相同
detailed_translations.english: If one thing overlaps another, or if you overlap them, a part of the first thing occupies the same area as a part of the other thing. You can also say that two things overlap.
the amount by which two activities, ideas, things etc overlap

sentences.english: Most of the relief work was done by volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 大部分救援工作都由志愿人员完成。

sentences.english: I volunteered my services as a driver.
sentences.chinese: 我主动提出来当司机。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does a job willingly without being paid
to offer to do something without expecting any reward, often something that other people do not want to do

sentences.english: They agreed to call a truce .
sentences.chinese: 他们同意宣布休战。

detailed_translations.english: an agreement between enemies to stop fighting or arguing for a short time, or the period for which this is arranged

name: distance
trans: 距离； 远方； 一长段时间

sentences.english: Measure the distance between the two points.
sentences.chinese: 量出两点之间的距离。

sentences.english: The cottage is some distance (= quite a long distance ) from the road.
sentences.chinese: 小屋离开大路有些距离。

sentences.english: Church bells rang in the distance (= they were far away ) .
sentences.chinese: 远处教堂的钟声响起。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of space between two places or things

sentences.english: You’re in a good mood this morning!
sentences.chinese: 你今天早晨心情不错啊！

sentences.english: the general mood of depression in the office
sentences.chinese: 办公室里普遍的沮丧情绪

detailed_translations.english: the way you feel at a particular time

sentences.english: Slavery was abolished in the US in the 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 美国于19世纪废除了奴隶制。

detailed_translations.english: to officially end a law, system etc, especially one that has existed for a long time

name: attract
trans: 吸引， 招引， 引诱， 引起

sentences.english: I’m not usually attracted to blondes.
sentences.chinese: 我一般不喜欢金发女子。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone interested in something, or make them want to take part in something

name: cautious
trans: 十分小心的， 谨慎的

sentences.english: a cautious driver
sentences.chinese: 一位谨慎的司机

sentences.english: a cautious approach to the crisis
sentences.chinese: 处理危机的谨慎态度

sentences.english: The air-pollution board has reacted with cautious optimism to the announcement.
sentences.chinese: 空气污染委员会对这项通告表示谨慎乐观。

detailed_translations.english: careful to avoid danger or risks

name: situated
trans: 位于…的； 处于…境地的

sentences.english: The house is situated near the college.
sentences.chinese: 这幢房子位于学院附近。

sentences.english: a farm situated in the valley
sentences.chinese: 位于山谷里的一个农场

sentences.english: The hotel is ideally situated near the seafront.
sentences.chinese: 酒店的位置理想，靠近海滨。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a particular place or position

name: recession
trans: 衰退， 衰退时期； 撤回， 退回

sentences.english: the economic recession of the early 1980s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代初的经济衰退

sentences.english: There is deep recession in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 英国处于严重的经济衰退之中。

detailed_translations.english: a difficult time when there is less trade, business activity etc in a country than usual

name: negative
trans: 否定的，反面的；消极的；负的，阴性的

sentences.english: students with a negative attitude to school
sentences.chinese: 对上学抱消极态度的学生

sentences.english: They have a uniformly negative image of the police.
sentences.chinese: 他们都对警察印象不好。

sentences.english: Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 琼很少这么说她母亲不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否定的，消极的；负的，阴性的
detailed_translations.english: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones

detailed_translations.chinese: 负片， 底片； 负数
detailed_translations.english: an image on a photographic film that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark, from which the final picture is printed

name: mantle
trans: 披风，斗篷；覆盖物；纱罩；【解】外层；包膜；外表；槽；【地】地幔

sentences.english: The parks and squares looked grim under a mantle of soot and ash.
sentences.chinese: 在一层烟尘的笼罩下，这些公园和广场显得阴沉沉的。

detailed_translations.english: a loose piece of outer clothing without sleeves, worn especially in former times
to cover the surface of something

name: hence
trans: 因此， 所以； 今后， 从此

sentences.english: The cost of transport is a major expense for an industry. Hence factory location is an important consideration.
sentences.chinese: 运输成本是企业的一大支出，因此工厂选址是重要的考虑因素。

detailed_translations.english: for this reason

name: boot
trans: 靴子； 行李箱； [the ～] 解雇

sentences.english: hiking boots
sentences.chinese: 远足靴

sentences.english: a pair of boots
sentences.chinese: 一双靴子

detailed_translations.english: a type of shoe that covers your whole foot and the lower part of your leg

sentences.english: Marine construction technology like this is very complex, somewhat analogous to trying to build a bridge under water.
sentences.chinese: 像这样的海洋建筑技术非常复杂，有些类似于尝试在水下建筑一座桥。

detailed_translations.chinese: 类似的；[昆] 同功的；可比拟的
detailed_translations.english: similar to another situation or thing so that a comparison can be made

name: introduce
trans: 介绍； 传入， 引进； 提出； 采用， 推行

sentences.english: Several senators introduced legislation aimed at sexual harassment.
sentences.chinese: 几位参议员提交了针对性骚扰的立法议案。

detailed_translations.english: to formally present a possible new law to be discussed

sentences.english: The leaves were covered with a strange sticky substance.
sentences.chinese: 树叶上覆着一层黏糊糊的怪东西。

sentences.english: The substance of his argument was that people on welfare should work.
sentences.chinese: 他论点的主旨是享受社会福利的人应该去工作。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of solid, liquid, or gas

sentences.english: She frowned as she read the letter.
sentences.chinese: 她看着信皱起了眉头。

detailed_translations.english: to make an angry, unhappy, or confused expression, moving your  eyebrows  together

name: grimy
trans: 积满污垢的， 肮脏的

sentences.english: grimy windows
sentences.chinese: 落满灰尘的窗子

detailed_translations.english: covered with dirt

name: tribal
trans: 部落的， 部族的； 集团意识强的

sentences.english: a tribal dance
sentences.chinese: 部落舞蹈

sentences.english: tribal cultures
sentences.chinese: 部落文化

detailed_translations.english: relating to a tribe or tribes

sentences.english: Mist rose from a nearby stand of thriving eucalyptus trees she planted after receiving title to more than a hectare of farmland.
sentences.chinese: 雾气从附近生长繁茂的桉树林中升起，这些树是她在获得对一公顷多农田的所有权后栽种的。

sentences.english: This could be estimated at 1000 litres of hydrogen for 330 grams of chlorophyll per day whereas for example colza produces roughly only 1000 litres of oil per hectare . . .
sentences.chinese: 这种农场每天估计能够产生1000升氢气，而且只消耗330克叶绿素； 而比如种植菜籽，每公顷土地才能产生大约1000升油。

sentences.english: Researchers at the algae greenhouse plan to scale up the trial to a 100 hectare (247 acre) site over the next three years.
sentences.chinese: 藻类温室的研究人员计划在未来三年内将试验范围扩大到一片100公顷（合247英亩）的场地上。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring area, equal to 10,000 square metres

sentences.english: There is no target date for completion of the new project.
sentences.chinese: 这个新的项目何时完工没有预定日期。

sentences.english: The government may fail to meet (= achieve ) its target of recycling 25% of domestic waste.
sentences.chinese: 政府可能达不到回收利用25%的生活垃圾的目标。

sentences.english: Jiang set annual growth targets of 8–9%.
sentences.chinese: 江确定了8%至9%的年增长目标。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying to achieve, such as a total, an amount, or a time
to make something have an effect on a particular limited group or area

name: momentum
trans: 动力， 冲力， 势头； 动量

sentences.english: incentives to maintain the momentum of European integration
sentences.chinese: 保持欧洲一体化发展势头的激励措施

sentences.english: Governments often lose momentum in their second term of office.
sentences.chinese: 政府往往会在第二届任期中丧失冲劲。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to keep increasing, developing, or being more successful

name: obstruct
trans: 妨碍， 阻止； 阻塞； 截断

sentences.english: A small aircraft was obstructing the runway.
sentences.chinese: 一架小型飞机堵住了跑道。

sentences.english: The column obstructed our view of the stage.
sentences.chinese: 柱子挡着，我们看不见舞台。

detailed_translations.english: to block a road, passage etc

sentences.english: a stone for grinding knives and scissors
sentences.chinese: 磨刀剪的石头

sentences.english: The lenses are ground to a high standard of precision.
sentences.chinese: 镜片被磨到很高的精确度。

detailed_translations.english: to make something smooth or sharp by rubbing it on a hard surface or by using a machine

a movement in  skateboarding  or  rollerblading  , which involves moving sideways along the edge of something, so that the bar connecting the wheels of the  skateboard  or  rollerblade  presses hard against the edge

name: acrobatic
trans: 杂技的； 杂技般的； 杂技演员的

sentences.english: They performed some amazing acrobatic feats.
sentences.chinese: 他们表演了一些令人惊叹的杂技动作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 杂技的； 杂技般的； 杂技演员的
detailed_translations.english: acrobatic movements involve moving your body in a very skilful way, for example by jumping through the air or balancing on a rope

sentences.english: I went to a counselor for guidance on my career.
sentences.chinese: 我去找了一位顾问给我作职业指导。

detailed_translations.english: help and advice that is given to someone about their work, education, or personal life

name: underpin
trans: 加固…的基础； 加强， 巩固

sentences.english: the theories that underpin his teaching method
sentences.chinese: 支持他的教学方法的理论

sentences.english: America’s wealth is underpinned by a global system which exploits the world’s poor.
sentences.chinese: 美国的财富是靠一个剥削全世界穷人的全球体系来支撑的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 巩固；支持；从下面支撑；加强…的基础
detailed_translations.english: to give strength or support to something and to help it succeed

sentences.english: Our applications take in massive amounts of information and crunch it with the power of the microprocessor.
sentences.chinese: 我们的应用程序将接收大量信息并使用微处理器的能力来处理这些信息。

sentences.english: It is possible to copyright the design of an invention, such as the documents that describe a microprocessor, but not the physical processor itself.
sentences.chinese: 所以有这样的可能，即版权保护的是发明的设计，比如描述微处理器的文档，而非处理器产品本身。

sentences.english: Typically, these devices run a 32-bit microprocessor/controller and have more than 2 MB of total memory for the storage of the virtual machine and libraries.
sentences.chinese: 典型地，这些设备运行一个 32 位的微处理器／控制器，而且有总量大于 2 MB 的用于虚拟机和库的存储的存储器。

detailed_translations.english: the central  chip  in a computer, which controls most of its operations

name: delicate
trans: 纤细的； 精巧的； 微妙的

sentences.english: his delicate hands
sentences.chinese: 他纤细的手

sentences.english: delicate hand-cut glass
sentences.chinese: 易碎的手工刻花玻璃

sentences.english: The sun can easily damage a child’s delicate skin .
sentences.chinese: 阳光很容易晒伤小孩娇嫩的皮肤。

detailed_translations.english: small and having a beautiful shape or appearance

sentences.english: Harry took me to a fancy restaurant for our anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 哈里带我去了一家豪华餐厅，庆祝我们的结婚纪念日。

detailed_translations.english: fancy hotels, restaurants, cars etc are expensive and fashionable
an idea or opinion that is not based on fact
to like or want something, or want to do something

name: bounce
trans: 弹跳； 反弹力； 活力， 精力

sentences.english: Stop bouncing up and down on the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 别在沙发上蹦来蹦去了。

detailed_translations.english: if a ball or other object bounces, or you bounce it, it immediately moves up or away from a surface after hitting it
the action of moving up and down on a surface

sentences.english: ...the asymmetry of Van de Velde's designs of this period.
sentences.chinese: ...这一时期范•德•费尔德设计作品的不对称性。

detailed_translations.english: Asymmetry is the appearance that something has when its two sides or halves are different in shape, size, or style

sentences.english: I pay the rent at the beginning of every month.
sentences.chinese: 我每逢月初交付房租。

sentences.english: She rents out two rooms to students.
sentences.chinese: 她把两个房间出租给学生

detailed_translations.english: the money that someone pays regularly to use a room, house etc that belongs to someone else
to let someone live in a house, room etc that you own, or use your land, in return for money

name: cast
trans: 投射； 把…加于； 投， 扔； 丢弃， 剔除； 脱落， 蜕； 浇铸， 铸造
演员表， 全体演员； 石膏绷带； 铸模， 铸件； 外貌， 特征

sentences.english: the shade cast by low-hanging branches
sentences.chinese: 低垂的树枝投下的阴影

detailed_translations.english: to make light or a shadow appear somewhere

detailed_translations.chinese: 演员表， 全体演员； 石膏绷带； 铸型， 铸件； 投， 抛
detailed_translations.english: all the people who perform in a play, film etc

sentences.english: She gave me an anxious look.
sentences.chinese: 她焦急地看了我一眼。

sentences.english: He seemed most anxious to speak to me alone.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎迫切地想同我单独谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: causing anxiety; showing anxiety

sentences.english: vocational qualifications
sentences.chinese: 职业资格

detailed_translations.english: teaching or relating to the skills you need to do a particular job

sentences.english: special dietary requirements
sentences.chinese: 特殊的饮食要求

detailed_translations.chinese: 规定的食物；饮食的规定；食谱
饮食的，饭食的，规定食物的
detailed_translations.english: related to the food someone eats

name: slice
trans: 薄片， 切片； 份， 部分

sentences.english: pizza slices
sentences.chinese: 比萨块

sentences.english: Cut the tomatoes into slices .
sentences.chinese: 把番茄切成片。

detailed_translations.english: a thin flat piece of food cut from a larger piece
to hit a ball, for example in tennis or golf, so that it spins sideways instead of moving straight forward

sentences.english: The eggs quickly hatch into larvae.
sentences.chinese: 这些卵很快孵化成幼虫。

detailed_translations.english: a young insect with a soft tube-shaped body, which will later become an insect with wings

sentences.english: Normally timid, they rarely stray far from their burrows.
sentences.chinese: 它们通常很胆小，极少远离自己的洞穴。

sentences.english: The larvae burrow into cracks in the floor.
sentences.chinese: 幼虫钻进地板的裂缝中。

detailed_translations.english: a passage in the ground made by an animal such as a rabbit or  fox  as a place to live
If an animal burrows into the ground or into a surface, it moves through it by making a tunnel or hole

name: elevate
trans: 提升…的职位； 举起； 使更有修养

sentences.english: Language has elevated humans above the other animals.
sentences.chinese: 语言使人类高于其他动物。

sentences.english: Gradually elevate the patient into an upright position.
sentences.chinese: 把病人慢慢托到直立的位置。

detailed_translations.english: to move someone or something to a more important level or rank, or make them better than before

sentences.english: Cash was taken during a burglary of the apartment.
sentences.chinese: 在一次公寓盗窃案中现金被盗。

sentences.english: There are similar charges if you want to cash a cheque or withdraw money at a branch other than your own.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在其他银行兑现支票或支取现金，将会产生差不多的手续费。

detailed_translations.english: money in the form of coins or notes rather than cheques,  credit card s  etc
If you cash a cheque, you exchange it at a bank for the amount of money that it is worth

name: item
trans: 条款， 项目； 一则

sentences.english: He opened the cardboard box and took out each item.
sentences.chinese: 他打开纸板箱把里面的物品一一拿出来。

sentences.english: The store is having a sale on furniture and household items.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店正在减价出售家具和家居用品。

sentences.english: luxury items such as exotic spices and perfumes
sentences.chinese: 异国香料和香水之类的奢侈品

sentences.english: The original 1965 bottle is now a collector’s item (= one of a set of objects people like to collect because they are interesting or valuable ).
sentences.chinese: 这瓶1965年生产的原装酒现在是收藏品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔尤指清单上、一群或一组事物中的〕一项，一件，一条
detailed_translations.english: a single thing, especially one thing in a list, group, or set of things

sentences.english: Do you lose your balance because of dizziness or do you ever lose consciousness?
sentences.chinese: 你曾否因为头昏眼花而失却平衡或你曾否失去知觉？

name: invasive
trans: 侵略的， 入侵的； 侵袭的， 扩散的； 切入的， 开刀的

sentences.english: invasive bladder cancers
sentences.chinese: 扩散性膀胱癌

detailed_translations.english: an invasive disease spreads quickly and is difficult to stop

sentences.english: human genes
sentences.chinese: 人类基因

sentences.english: the genes that regulate cell division
sentences.chinese: 控制细胞分裂的基因

detailed_translations.english: a part of a cell in a living thing that controls what it looks like, how it grows, and how it develops. People get their genes from their parents

name: hollow
trans: 空的，空洞的；沉闷的；虚伪的，空虚的

sentences.english: a hollow tree
sentences.chinese: 空心树

sentences.english: Any threat to bring in the police is a hollow one.
sentences.chinese: 任何要叫警察来的威胁都是虚张声势。

sentences.english: The steps were hollowed by centuries of use.
sentences.chinese: 经过几个世纪的踩踏，台阶上出现了凹痕

detailed_translations.chinese: 空的,中空的;；空洞的,无价值的
detailed_translations.english: having an empty space inside
to make the surface of something curve inwards

name: trunk
trans: 树干， 躯干； 大箱子； 象鼻

sentences.english: He left his bicycle leaning against a tree trunk .
sentences.chinese: 他把他的自行车斜靠在树干上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 树干；躯干；象鼻；汽车车尾的行李箱
detailed_translations.english: the thick central woody stem of a tree

sentences.english: I knew I could rely on David.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我可以信赖戴维。

sentences.english: They relied heavily on the advice of their professional advisers.
sentences.chinese: 他们非常依赖专业顾问的建议。

detailed_translations.english: to depend on something in order to continue to live or exist

name: slide
trans: 滑动， 下滑； 滑坡， 滑道， 滑面； 幻灯片； 突然崩落

sentences.english: He slid open the door of the glass cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 他滑开玻璃柜的门。

detailed_translations.english: to move smoothly over a surface while continuing to touch it, or to make something move in this way
to move smoothly over a surface while continuing to touch it, or to make something move in this way
a large structure with steps leading to the top of a long sloping surface which children can slide down

sentences.english: There’s some sticky stuff in your hair.
sentences.chinese: 你的头发上有什么黏糊糊的东西。

sentences.english: a sticky floor
sentences.chinese: 黏糊糊的地板

detailed_translations.english: made of or covered with a substance that sticks to surfaces

name: niggle
trans: 拘泥小节； 挑剔， 吹毛求疵； 为小事操心； 不断地烦扰

sentences.english: Something’s been niggling her all day.
sentences.chinese: 有什么事烦了她一整天。

sentences.english: It niggles me that we can’t go home yet and get warm.
sentences.chinese: 我很生气，我们到现在还不能回家暖和暖和。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拘泥小节； 挑剔， 吹毛求疵； 为小事操心； 不断地烦扰
detailed_translations.english: if something niggles you, you keep worrying about it or feeling annoyed about it and you cannot forget it

sentences.english: The skirt was too big around the waist.
sentences.chinese: 那条裙子腰围太大。

detailed_translations.english: the narrow part in the middle of the human body

name: excessive
trans: 过多的， 极度的， 过分的

sentences.english: his excessive drinking
sentences.chinese: 他的酗酒

sentences.english: $15 for two beers seems a little excessive.
sentences.chinese: 两杯啤酒要15美元，似乎有点过分。

detailed_translations.english: much more than is reasonable or necessary

sentences.english: the Amazon jungle
sentences.chinese: 亚马孙丛林

detailed_translations.english: a thick tropical forest with many large plants growing very close together

sentences.english: Grill the bacon until crisp.
sentences.chinese: 将培根烤至酥脆。

sentences.english: swordfish grilled over charcoal
sentences.chinese: 炭火烤的剑鱼

detailed_translations.english: if you grill something, or if it grills, you cook it by putting it on a flat metal frame with bars across it, above or below strong direct heat
a part of a  cooker  in which strong heat from above cooks food on a metal shelf below

sentences.english: Thank you for your participation.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你的参与。

sentences.english: entertainment with plenty of audience participation
sentences.chinese: 有许多观众参与的娱乐活动

detailed_translations.english: the act of taking part in an activity or event

sentences.english: a bunch of cherries
sentences.chinese: 一串樱桃

sentences.english: cherry pie
sentences.chinese: 樱桃馅饼

detailed_translations.english: a small round red or black fruit with a long thin stem and a stone in the middle

sentences.english: insects that damage crops
sentences.chinese: 破坏庄稼的昆虫

sentences.english: There may be permanent brain damage.
sentences.chinese: 可能有永久性脑损伤。

detailed_translations.english: to cause physical harm to something or to part of someone’s body
physical harm that is done to something or to a part of someone’s body, so that it is broken or injured

name: assault
trans: 攻击，袭击；侵犯人身罪；冲击；

sentences.english: Two men assaulted him after he left the bar.
sentences.chinese: 他离开酒吧之后遭到两名男子的袭击。

sentences.english: The refugee camp came under assault again last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚难民营再次遭袭。

detailed_translations.english: to attack someone in a violent way
a military attack to take control of a place controlled by the enemy

name: settle
trans: 定居， 安家； 解决， 调停； 安排， 安放； 支付， 结算； 安置于； 飞落， 停留， 栖息

sentences.english: When the children had settled, Miss Brown gave out the new reading books.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们静下来后，布朗小姐给他们发新的故事书。

sentences.english: She breathed deeply to settle her nerves (= stop herself from feeling worried or frightened ) .
sentences.chinese: 她深深地吸了口气平静自己的情绪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安排， 安放； 调停； 支付， 核算； 安家； 飞落， 停留； 安定
detailed_translations.english: to become quiet and calm, or to make someone quiet and calm

name: pattern
trans: 构成图案； 使形成， 促成

sentences.english: Weather patterns have changed in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 气候模式近年已经发生了变化。

sentences.english: A general pattern began to emerge .
sentences.chinese: 一个总体模式开始显现。

sentences.english: Their descriptions seemed to follow a set pattern (= always develop in the same way ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的描述似乎依据固定的模式。

sentences.english: His behavior fits a pattern of violent acts.
sentences.chinese: 他的举动符合暴力行为的模式。

sentences.english: a dress pattern
sentences.chinese: 连衣裙的纸样

detailed_translations.english: the regular way in which something happens, develops, or is done

sentences.english: There are fears that the march will heighten racial tension.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心这次游行会加深种族间的紧张局势。

sentences.english: Increased levels of fat in the diet could heighten the risk of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 饮食中脂肪摄入量的提升会增加患癌症的风险。

detailed_translations.english: if something heightens a feeling, effect etc, or if a feeling etc heightens, it becomes stronger or increases

name: harsh
trans: 严厉的， 严酷的； 粗糙的， 毛糙的； 刻薄的； 恶劣的； 刺耳的， 刺目的

sentences.english: The hostages are being held in harsh conditions.
sentences.chinese: 人质被拘押在恶劣环境中。

sentences.english: a young girl suddenly exposed to the harsh realities of life
sentences.chinese: 骤然暴露于残酷现实生活中的小女孩

detailed_translations.english: harsh conditions are difficult to live in and very uncomfortable

name: smother
trans: 厚厚地覆盖； 窒息； 把闷熄

sentences.english: A teenage mother was accused of smothering her 3-month-old daughter.
sentences.chinese: 一个少女妈妈被指控闷死自己三个月大的女儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使窒息；抑制；（用灰等）闷熄；忍住
detailed_translations.english: to kill someone by putting something over their face to stop them breathing

detailed_translations.chinese: 窒息状态；令人窒息的浓烟

sentences.english: The garage charges £30 an hour for labour.
sentences.chinese: 汽车修理厂收取每小时30英镑的人工费。

sentences.english: Many women do hard manual labour(= work with their hands ).
sentences.chinese: 许多妇女从事繁重的体力劳动。

sentences.english: Workers withdrew their labour (= protested by stopping work ) for twenty-four hours.
sentences.chinese: 工人罢工24小时。

sentences.english: a shortage of skilled labor
sentences.chinese: 熟练工人短缺

detailed_translations.english: work, especially physical work

sentences.english: Scrape the carrots and slice them thinly.
sentences.chinese: 把这些胡萝卜去皮切成薄片。

sentences.english: The two of them scraped their dishes clean.
sentences.chinese: 他们两个把盘子擦得干干净净。

sentences.english: I heard the side of the car scrape against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 我听到汽车的侧面蹭着墙了。

sentences.english: the scrape of iron on stone
sentences.chinese: 铁摩擦石头发出的嚓嚓声

sentences.english: She emerged from the overturned car with only a few scrapes and bruises.
sentences.chinese: 她从翻了的车里钻出来，只擦破一点皮，碰了几块淤青。

detailed_translations.english: to remove something from a surface using the edge of a knife, a stick etc
the action of one thing rubbing roughly against another

name: bleak
trans: 寒冷的， 阴沉的； 阴郁的， 暗淡的； 没有希望的， 不乐观的； 荒凉的； 索然无味的

sentences.english: a bleak January afternoon
sentences.chinese: 一月里一个阴冷的下午

sentences.english: The landscape was bleak.
sentences.chinese: 景色一片凄凉。

detailed_translations.english: cold and without any pleasant or comfortable features

name: hassle
trans: 困难， 麻烦； 分歧， 争论

sentences.english: Then my husband started hassling me.
sentences.chinese: 然后我丈夫便开始不停地烦我。

detailed_translations.chinese: 找麻烦，搅扰；与…争辩；使…烦恼
detailed_translations.english: If someone hassles you, they cause problems for you, often by repeatedly telling you or asking you to do something, in an annoying way
something that is annoying, because it causes problems or is difficult to do

sentences.english: a truly glorious future
sentences.chinese: 无比美好的将来

sentences.english: a glorious victory
sentences.chinese: 光荣的胜利

sentences.english: glorious views of the coast
sentences.chinese: 沿海的迷人景色

detailed_translations.english: having or deserving great fame, praise, and honour

sentences.english: ...bilateral talks between Britain and America.
sentences.chinese: …英美之间的双边会谈。

detailed_translations.english: involving two groups or nations

sentences.english: A broad valley opened up leading to a high, flat plateau of cultivated land.
sentences.chinese: 一个宽阔的山谷展开，通向一片平坦的高原耕地。

sentences.english: Inflation rates have reached a plateau.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率已趋平稳。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of flat land that is higher than the land around it

name: aptitude
trans: 天资， 天赋， 天生的才能

sentences.english: He drifted into publishing and discovered an aptitude for working with accounts.
sentences.chinese: 他偶入出版界，发现自己具有管账的天资。

detailed_translations.english: natural ability or skill, especially in learning

name: vile
trans: 糟糕透顶的， 可恶的； 恶劣的， 卑鄙的

sentences.english: a vile act of betrayal
sentences.chinese: 卑鄙的背叛行为

detailed_translations.chinese: 卑鄙的；邪恶的；低廉的；肮脏的
detailed_translations.english: evil or immoral

name: architecture
trans: 建筑学； 建筑设计， 建筑风格； 【计】 体系结构

sentences.english: modern/classical/medieval etc architecture
sentences.chinese: 现代/古典/中世纪等的建筑风格

sentences.english: He studied architecture at university.
sentences.chinese: 他在大学里读的是建筑学。

detailed_translations.english: the style and design of a building or buildings

name: stress
trans: 压力；重音；强调，重点，着重

sentences.english: Crawford stressed the need for more housing downtown.
sentences.chinese: 克劳福德强调市中心需要建更多的住宅。

sentences.english: She stressed the importance of a balanced diet.
sentences.chinese: 她强调了均衡饮食的重要性。

detailed_translations.english: to emphasize a statement, fact, or idea

sentences.english: If it’s any consolation, things do get easier as the child gets older.
sentences.chinese: 聊可安慰的是，随着这孩子慢慢长大，境况也好起来了。

sentences.english: He had the consolation of knowing that he couldn’t have done any better.
sentences.chinese: 他知道自己已经尽了最大努力，心中便有了安慰。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes you feel better when you are sad or disappointed

sentences.english: the country’s heavy reliance on trade
sentences.chinese: 该国对贸易的严重依赖

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is dependent on someone or something else

name: display
trans: 陈列， 展览； 显示， 表现

sentences.english: a dazzling display (= very good display ) of flowers
sentences.chinese: 令人目眩神迷的花卉展

sentences.english: The window display caught her eye.
sentences.chinese: 橱窗陈列吸引了她的目光。

sentences.english: shop windows displaying the latest fashions
sentences.chinese: 展示最新时装的商店橱窗

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement of things for people to look at or buy
to show something to people, or put it in a place where people can see it easily

sentences.english: Get the special drill bit to bore the correct size hole for the job.
sentences.chinese: 找个特殊的钻头，钻个尺寸合适的孔。

detailed_translations.english: to make a deep round hole in a hard surface
something that is not interesting to you or that annoys you

name: acrobat
trans: 特技演员； 杂技演员

sentences.english: The acrobat balanced himself on the high rope.
sentences.chinese: 杂技演员在高绳上保持平衡。

sentences.english: Leggy models and a child acrobat wait offstage at a pop music concert in Ulaanbaatar.
sentences.chinese: 乌兰巴托的一场流行音乐会会场外，一群美腿模特和一位少年杂技演员正在等待入场。

sentences.english: He also added a crotch belt, a unicycle-like seat and an acrobat’s trapeze for a footrest; all help to keep the operator in optimal flying position.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他还添加了三叉腰带、独轮车式车座、还有一个杂技演员所用的秋千，用来放脚。 所有这些装置，都能够帮助操作者保持良好的飞行位置。

detailed_translations.english: someone who entertains people by doing difficult physical actions such as walking on their hands or balancing on a high rope, especially at a  circus

name: disorder
trans: 混乱； 失调， 紊乱， 疾病

sentences.english: severe eating disorders such as bulimia and anorexia
sentences.chinese: 像贪食症和厌食症这类严重的进食障碍

detailed_translations.chinese: 混乱， 杂乱， 骚乱
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which a lot of people behave in an uncontrolled, noisy, or violent way in public

sentences.english: Why is the height of foreland person taller than inland, a mountainous area person?
sentences.chinese: 为什么沿海地区人的身高比内地、山区人高?。

name: aggravate
trans: 恶化， 加重， 加剧

sentences.english: Their money problems were further aggravated by a rise in interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 由于利率上调，他们的财务问题更加严重。

sentences.english: Building the new road will only aggravate the situation .
sentences.chinese: 建造那条新路只会使情况恶化。

detailed_translations.english: to make a bad situation, an illness, or an injury worse

sentences.english: In my childhood, local dairies bought milk from local farmers.
sentences.chinese: 在我小时候，本地的乳品公司向当地农场主收购牛奶。

sentences.english: dairy products/produce
sentences.chinese: 乳制品；奶类产品

detailed_translations.english: a place on a farm where milk is kept and butter and cheese are made
made from milk

sentences.english: a colossal statue of the King
sentences.chinese: 国王的巨大雕像

sentences.english: This whole holiday was a colossal waste of money.
sentences.chinese: 这次度假浪费了大量的钱财。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is extremely large

sentences.english: Laura is very mature for her age.
sentences.chinese: 相对她的年龄来说劳拉是很成熟的。

sentences.english: We’re mature enough to disagree on this issue but still respect each other.
sentences.chinese: 我们都很成熟，尽管我们对此事意见不同，但还是彼此尊重。

sentences.english: As the fish matures, its colours and patternings change.
sentences.chinese: 随着发育成熟，这种鱼的颜色和斑纹都会改变。

detailed_translations.english: someone, especially a child or young person, who is mature behaves in a sensible and reasonable way, as you would expect an adult to behave
to become fully grown or developed

name: alleviate
trans: 减轻， 缓解， 缓和

sentences.english: measures to alleviate poverty
sentences.chinese: 扶贫措施

detailed_translations.english: to make something less painful or difficult to deal with

sentences.english: He used his influence to get his son into medical school.
sentences.chinese: 他利用权势把儿子弄进了医学院。

sentences.english: He denies exerting any political influence over them.
sentences.chinese: 他否认曾向他们施加过政治影响。

detailed_translations.english: the power to make other people agree with your opinions or do what you want

name: obscurity
trans: 模糊； 费解； 不出名

sentences.english: Now, on the eve of the bicentenary of the independence movements, he sets out to rescue San Martín from his relative obscurity.
sentences.chinese: 今天，在那场独立运动二百周年纪念前夕，他再度出手以挽救相对默默无闻的圣·马丁。

sentences.english: At this time he knew nothing of Wells’s and Matthew’s accounts of natural selection; indeed, both accounts languished in obscurity until after the “Origin” was published.
sentences.chinese: 此时他对马修和威尔士关于自然选择的阐述一无所知；事实上，直到《物种的起源》发表这两人一直默默无闻。

sentences.english: The obscurity of JTS is in some sense due to its own success: because it hides the details of transaction management so effectively, we don't hear or say very much about it.
sentences.chinese: 在某种意义上，JTS 的默默无闻恰恰是它的成功：因为它非常有效地隐藏了事务管理的很多细节，因此，我们没有听说过或者谈论过很多关于它的内容。

detailed_translations.english: the state of not being known or remembered

sentences.english: Interest rates fell by six percentage points (= 6% ) .
sentences.chinese: 利息下降了6个百分点。

sentences.english: The numbers are small in percentage terms (= when calculated as a percentage ) .
sentences.chinese: 按百分比来看，这些数字很小。

detailed_translations.english: an amount expressed as if it is part of a total which is 100

name: factual
trans: 事实的； 真实的， 确凿的

sentences.english: Try to keep your account of events as factual as possible.
sentences.chinese: 你要尽量如实地说明情况。

detailed_translations.english: based on facts or relating to facts

name: negotiate
trans: 洽谈， 协商； 商定， 达成； 顺利通过

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: speculation
trans: 推测， 思索； 投机活动， 投机买卖

sentences.english: The witness’s statement was pure speculation (= not based on any facts ) .
sentences.chinese: 这名证人的陈述纯粹是猜测。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投机；推测；思索；投机买卖
detailed_translations.english: when you guess about the possible causes or effects of something without knowing all the facts, or the guesses that you make

name: crisis
trans: 危机； 紧要关头， 关键阶段

sentences.english: The country now faces an economic crisis .
sentences.chinese: 该国目前正面临一场经济危机。

sentences.english: The Prime Minister was criticized for the way in which he handled the crisis .
sentences.chinese: 首相处理危机的方式遭到了批评。

sentences.english: the current debt crisis
sentences.chinese: 当前的债务危机

sentences.english: a major political crisis
sentences.chinese: 重大的政治危机

sentences.english: I was relieved that we had averted yet another financial crisis .
sentences.chinese: 我如释重负，我们又避免了一场财政危机。

sentences.english: Oil companies were heavily criticized when they made large profits during the oil crisis of the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 石油公司因在20世纪70年代的石油危机中赚取了丰厚利润而受到严厉抨击。

sentences.english: The car industry is now in crisis .
sentences.chinese: 汽车工业现在正处于危机之中。

sentences.english: He doesn’t seem to be very good at crisis management .
sentences.chinese: 他好像不大擅长处理危机。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there are a lot of problems that must be dealt with quickly so that the situation does not get worse or more dangerous

sentences.english: Some retailers worry that new regulations will hurt their ability to compete in the marketplace.
sentences.chinese: 有些零售商担心新规定会削弱他们的市场竞争力。

detailed_translations.english: the part of business activity that is concerned with buying and selling goods in competition with other companies

sentences.english: She helped him fight his drug addiction.
sentences.chinese: 她帮助了他对抗自己的毒瘾。

detailed_translations.english: the need to take a harmful drug regularly, without being able to stop

sentences.english: Type your street address and postcode.
sentences.chinese: 键入你的街道地址和邮政编码。

detailed_translations.english: a group of numbers and letters that you write at the end of an address on an envelope, package etc. The postcode shows the exact area where someone lives and helps the post office deliver the post more quickly.

name: germ
trans: 微生物， 细菌； 起源， 萌芽

sentences.english: Put disinfectant down the toilet to kill any germs.
sentences.chinese: 在抽水马桶里投放消毒剂杀菌。

sentences.english: germ cells containing DNA
sentences.chinese: 含DNA的生殖细胞

detailed_translations.english: a very small living thing that can make you ill

name: shatter
trans: 破碎， 碎裂； 给予极大打击

sentences.english: The explosion shattered the building.
sentences.chinese: 这次爆炸把大楼炸成一片废墟。

sentences.english: A tragic accident shattered her dreams of Olympic glory.
sentences.chinese: 一场不幸的意外事故使她获得奥运奖牌的梦想破灭了。

detailed_translations.english: to break suddenly into very small pieces, or to make something break in this way

sentences.english: ...ground covered over with moss.
sentences.chinese: …长满青苔的地面。

detailed_translations.english: a very small green plant that grows in a thick soft furry mass on wet soil, trees, or rocks

sentences.english: I glimpsed a figure at the window.
sentences.chinese: 我瞥见窗前有个身影。

sentences.english: They caught a glimpse of a dark green car.
sentences.chinese: 他们瞥见一辆深绿色的汽车。

detailed_translations.english: to see someone or something for a moment without getting a complete view of them
a quick look at someone or something that does not allow you to see them clearly

sentences.english: She hired a detective to find out if her husband was having an affair.
sentences.chinese: 她雇了一个私人侦探调查她丈夫是否有外遇。

detailed_translations.english: a police officer whose job is to discover information about crimes and catch criminals

name: transfer
trans: 搬， 转移； 调动， 转学； 转让， 过户； 转车， 换乘
转移； 调动； 转车， 换乘

sentences.english: He was transferred for a fee of £8 million.
sentences.chinese: 他以800万英镑的转会费转到了其他球队。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搬， 转移； 调动， 转学； 转让， 过户； 乘车， 转乘
detailed_translations.english: to move from one place, school, job etc to another, or to make someone do this, especially within the same organization

name: suicidal
trans: 自杀的； 有自杀倾向的

sentences.english: She was depressed and almost suicidal.
sentences.chinese: 她很抑郁，几乎想自杀。

sentences.english: For many years before treatment, Clare had suicidal tendencies (= behaviour that showed she wanted to kill herself ) .
sentences.chinese: 在治疗前的许多年里，克莱尔都有自杀倾向。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自杀的，自杀性的；自我毁灭的；自取灭亡的
detailed_translations.english: wanting to kill yourself

sentences.english: a condition which affects the nerves in the back
sentences.chinese: 影响背部神经的疾病

sentences.english: She finally found the nerve to tell him she wanted a divorce.
sentences.chinese: 她终于鼓起勇气告诉他自己想离婚。

detailed_translations.english: nerves are parts inside your body which look like threads and carry messages between the brain and other parts of the body

name: diversion
trans: 转向， 转移， 转换； 转移视线的事物； 娱乐

sentences.english: ...the illegal diversion of profits from secret arms sales.
sentences.chinese: …销售秘密武器所得收益的非法转移。

sentences.english: The party will make a pleasant diversion.
sentences.chinese: 晚会会是一个很不错的消遣。

detailed_translations.english: a change in the direction or use of something, or the act of changing it

sentences.english: Those who fail can resit the exam in 60 days.
sentences.chinese: 考试不及格的人可以在60天后重考。

detailed_translations.english: to take an examination again, because you failed it or did not do well enough

sentences.english: His economic predictions are based on some erroneous assumptions.
sentences.chinese: 他的经济预测是基于错误假设之上的。

detailed_translations.english: erroneous ideas or information are wrong and based on facts that are not correct

name: overlie
trans: 躺在…上面； 置于…上面

sentences.english: Clay overlies chalk in the southern mountains.
sentences.chinese: 在南部山脉，黏土层覆在白垩层之上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 躺在…上面；覆在…上面；压在（婴儿、幼仔）身上使之窒息而死
detailed_translations.english: to lie over something

sentences.english: a nuclear limitation treaty
sentences.chinese: 核限制条约

detailed_translations.chinese: 限制， 限度； 局限
detailed_translations.english: the act or process of controlling or reducing something

name: sponsor
trans: 发起者，赞助人，主办者；主顾
发起， 主办； 赞助， 资助； 惠顾

sentences.english: When you define the project, you make sure that you have an agreement with the project sponsor on what work should be completed in this project.
sentences.chinese: 在你定义项目的时候，你要确保和项目发起人在项目应该完成的所有工作内容上达成一致意见。

sentences.english: It is important that your sponsor be truly committed to the value of the project to ensure that funds and support are not in jeopardy if adoption is not immediate.
sentences.chinese: 发起人必须真正认可项目的价值，这一点很重要，只有这样才能确保在推广没有立即见效时资金和支持不会随之消失。

detailed_translations.english: someone who officially introduces or supports a proposal for a new law

sentences.english: Her husband’s violence terrified her.
sentences.chinese: 丈夫的暴力行为让她感到害怕。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone extremely afraid

name: ascertain
trans: 弄清， 查明； 确定

sentences.english: A postmortem was ordered to try to ascertain the cause of death.
sentences.chinese: 下令验尸以查明死因。

detailed_translations.chinese: 弄清， 查明； 确定
detailed_translations.english: to find out something

sentences.english: He took a small key from his pocket and slowly inserted it into the lock.
sentences.chinese: 他从衣袋里掏出一把小钥匙，然后缓缓地将其插入锁孔里。

detailed_translations.english: to put something inside or into something else

detailed_translations.chinese: 插入物；管芯；镶块；[机械]刀片
detailed_translations.english: something that is designed to be put inside something else

sentences.english: climatic conditions
sentences.chinese: 气候情况

detailed_translations.english: relating to the weather in a particular area

name: inspiration
trans: 启示， 灵感； 鼓舞人心的人， 激励

sentences.english: The Malvern Hills have provided inspiration for many artists and musicians over the decades.
sentences.chinese: 几十年来，莫尔文丘陵为很多艺术家和音乐家提供了灵感。

sentences.english: He raised his eyes to the altar as if seeking inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 他抬头看看祭坛，似乎在寻求灵感。

sentences.english: He draws inspiration from ordinary scenes.
sentences.chinese: 他从日常生活中得到灵感。

sentences.english: Mary Quant’s inspiration comes from the glam style of the seventies.
sentences.chinese: 玛莉·官的灵感来自70年代的魅惑风格。

sentences.english: He had a sudden flash of inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 他突然灵感闪现。

sentences.english: He has always been a source of inspiration for me.
sentences.chinese: 他一直是我灵感的源泉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 灵感； 鼓舞人心的人
detailed_translations.english: a good idea about what you should do, write, say etc, especially one which you get suddenly

name: generative
trans: 生殖的， 生产的； 有生产能力的

sentences.english: the generative power of the life force
sentences.chinese: 生命力的生成能力

detailed_translations.english: able to produce something

name: highlight
trans: 强调，突出；以强烈光线照射；集中注意力于
最精彩的部分， 最重要的事件

sentences.english: Your résumé should highlight your skills and achievements.
sentences.chinese: 你的简历应该突出自己的技能和成绩。

sentences.english: That weekend in Venice was definitely the highlight of our trip.
sentences.chinese: 在威尼斯度过的那个周末无疑是我们这次旅行最精彩的部分。

detailed_translations.english: to make a problem or subject easy to notice so that people pay attention to it
the most important, interesting, or enjoyable part of something such as a holiday, performance, or sports competition

name: tortoise
trans: 龟， 陆龟； 行动迟缓的人

sentences.english: I saw a big sea tortoise .
sentences.chinese: 我看见过一个大海龟。

sentences.english: Run like a tortoise.
sentences.chinese: 像乌龟一样慢慢跑。

sentences.english: Either way, both the hare and tortoise get what they deserve based on how they behave.
sentences.chinese: 无论如何，野兔和乌龟得到什么都是基于它们的行为举止的。

detailed_translations.english: a slow-moving land animal that can pull its head and legs into the hard round shell that covers its body

name: administrator
trans: 管理者， 管理人员； 行政人员

sentences.english: On Friday the company's administrators sought permission from a Melbourne court to keep operating.
sentences.chinese: 在星期五，该公司的管理人员们从一家墨尔本法院取得了继续经营的许可。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job involves managing the work of a company or organization

sentences.english: customer details held on a database
sentences.chinese: 存储在数据库内的客户详细信息

detailed_translations.english: a large amount of data stored in a computer system so that you can find and use it easily

name: stuffy
trans: 不透气的， 不新鲜的， 不通风的； 乏味的

sentences.english: It’s getting stuffy in here – do you mind if I open the window?
sentences.chinese: 这里越来越闷了，我开开窗行吗？

detailed_translations.english: (of a building, room, etc.) warm in an unpleasant way and without enough fresh air

name: reject
trans: 被拒货品， 不合格品

sentences.english: Sarah rejected her brother’s offer of help.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉拒绝了她弟弟的帮助。

sentences.english: Dexter flatly rejected (= completely rejected ) calls for his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 德克斯特断然拒绝让他辞职的要求。

sentences.english: His proposal was rejected outright (= completely rejected ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的建议被彻底否决了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒绝； 拒纳， 退回， 摈弃
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept, believe in, or agree with something

detailed_translations.chinese: 被拒货品， 不合格产品
detailed_translations.english: a product that has been rejected because there is something wrong with it

name: sheer
trans: 十足的； 纯粹的 ； 陡峭的

sentences.english: cliffs which rose sheer from the sea
sentences.chinese: 从海面垂直拔起的悬崖

detailed_translations.english: straight up or down in an almost vertical line
to change direction suddenly, especially in order to avoid something

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全的，十足的；陡峭的，垂直的；极薄的，透明的
detailed_translations.english: a sheer drop, cliff, slope etc is very steep and almost vertical

sentences.english: It’s a miracle you weren’t killed!
sentences.chinese: 你没有死真是奇迹！

sentences.english: By some miracle, we managed to catch the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我们奇迹般地赶上了飞机。

sentences.english: the economic miracle of the 1950s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪50年代的经济奇迹

sentences.english: She’s our miracle baby.
sentences.chinese: 她是我们的奇迹宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: something very lucky or very good that happens which you did not expect to happen or did not think was possible

name: imitation
trans: 模仿； 仿造； 仿制品， 假货， 赝品

sentences.english: The remake of ‘Casablanca’ was a pale imitation (= something that is much less good than the thing it imitates ) of the original movie.
sentences.chinese: 重拍的《卡萨布兰卡》远不如原版。

sentences.english: ...a complete set of Dickens bound in imitation leather.
sentences.chinese: …用人造革装帧的一整套《狄更斯全集》。

detailed_translations.english: when you copy someone else’s actions
Imitation things are not genuine but are made to look as if they are

sentences.english: All the guests paid her extravagant compliments.
sentences.chinese: 所有客人都对她赞不绝口。

sentences.english: Being compared to Abba is a great compliment.
sentences.chinese: 能和阿巴乐队相提并论是极大的赞誉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恭维；称赞；问候；致意；道贺
detailed_translations.english: a remark that shows you admire someone or something
to say something nice to someone in order to praise them

sentences.english: The shop’s daily profit is usually around $500.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店每天的利润一般在500美元左右。

sentences.english: She sold the business and bought a farm with the profits.
sentences.chinese: 她卖了公司，用所得利润买下了一座农场。

sentences.english: They sold their house at a healthy profit.
sentences.chinese: 他们卖掉房子，赚了一大笔钱。

sentences.english: There’s no profit in letting meetings drag on.
sentences.chinese: 会议拖拖拉拉没什么好处。

detailed_translations.english: money that you gain by selling things or doing business, after your costs have been paid
to get money from doing something

sentences.english: Please pay the full amount (=  of money  ) by the end of the month.
sentences.chinese: 请在月底前全额付清。

detailed_translations.english: a quantity of something such as time, money, or a substance

sentences.english: The commander said that the army would comply with the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 指挥官说过部队会遵从停火协议。

sentences.english: Some beaches had failed to comply with environmental regulations.
sentences.chinese: 一些海滩没能遵守环保规定。

detailed_translations.english: to do what you have to do or are asked to do

name: original
trans: 最初的，原始的；新颖的，有独创性的

sentences.english: The land was returned to its original owner.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地归还给了原主。

sentences.english: The kitchen still has many original features (= parts that were there when the house was first built ).
sentences.chinese: 这间厨房仍保留着当初的许多特点。

sentences.english: the original meaning of the word
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的原意

sentences.english: The original plan was to fly out to New York.
sentences.chinese: 原先的计划是飞往纽约。

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening first, before other people or things

sentences.english: She’s gone to Italy on a special assignment.
sentences.chinese: 她去意大利执行一项特殊任务。

sentences.english: a history assignment
sentences.chinese: 历史作业

detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that is given to someone as part of their job

name: differ
trans: 不同， 相异； 发生分歧

sentences.english: The two systems differ in many respects.
sentences.chinese: 这两个系统在许多方面不同。

sentences.english: Experts have differing views on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 在这个问题上专家们意见不同。

detailed_translations.english: to be different from something in some way

sentences.english: an appointment at an outpatient clinic
sentences.chinese: 门诊预约

detailed_translations.english: a place, often in a hospital, where medical treatment is given to people who do not need to stay in the hospital

name: depression
trans: 忧愁， 消沉； 低气压， 低压； 不景气， 萧条

sentences.english: Mr. Thomas was suffering from depression.
sentences.chinese: 托马斯先生当时正受抑郁症折磨。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抑郁， 沮丧； 不景气， 萧条； 洼地， 凹陷
detailed_translations.english: the period during the 1930s when there was not much business activity and not many jobs

sentences.english: I had no dollars, but offered him an equivalent amount of sterling.
sentences.chinese: 我没有美金，但给了他等值的英镑。

detailed_translations.english: having the same value, purpose, job etc as a person or thing of a different kind
something that has the same value, purpose, job etc as something else

name: mentor
trans: 导师； 顾问， 指导者

sentences.english: Leon Sullivan was my mentor and my friend.
sentences.chinese: 利昂·沙利文既是我的导师，也是我的朋友。

detailed_translations.english: an experienced person who advises and helps a less experienced person

name: sensational
trans: 轰动性的， 引起哗然的； 耸人听闻的； 极好的； 绝妙的

sentences.english: a sensational discovery
sentences.chinese: 引起轰动的发现

sentences.english: The show was a sensational success.
sentences.chinese: 这次演出取得了轰动性的成功。

sentences.english: a sensational 6-0 victory
sentences.chinese: 轰动性的6比0大胜

detailed_translations.chinese: 轰动的；耸人听闻的；非常好的；使人感动的
detailed_translations.english: very interesting, exciting, and surprising

sentences.english: The explorers paddled their canoe cautiously upstream.
sentences.chinese: 探险者们谨慎地把独木舟向上游划去。

sentences.english: At a summer job working as park naturalists that year, I flipped the canoe Air and I were paddling and we had to push it to shore.
sentences.chinese: 那年我在公园里做暑期兼职，我把独木舟翻转个身，然后我们一起合力将它推到岸边，这样我们就可以划船了。

sentences.english: I remember the first time I visited a village in Vietnam, in 1995: we endured hours and hours of rutty roads or long hours in a canoe to reach project sites.
sentences.chinese: 我记得1995年第一次访问越南一个村落，我们捱过很多小时的路途颠簸、坐了很多小时的独木舟，才到达项目的所在地。

detailed_translations.english: to travel by canoe
a long light boat that is pointed at both ends and which you move along using a  paddle

sentences.english: He hammered the wedge into the crack in the stone.
sentences.chinese: 他用锤子把楔子砸入石缝里。

sentences.english: The phone was wedged under his chin.
sentences.chinese: 电话夹在他下巴下面。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of wood, metal etc that has one thick edge and one pointed edge and is used especially for keeping a door open or for splitting wood
to force something firmly into a narrow space

name: alienate
trans: 使疏远， 使不友好； 转让， 让渡

sentences.english: The latest tax proposals will alienate many voters.
sentences.chinese: 最新的纳税提案将失去远许多选民的支持。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that makes someone unfriendly or unwilling to support you
a British gold coin or unit of money used in the past, worth one pound and one  shilling  (£1.05). Prices are sometimes still given in guineas when buying or selling  racehorses .

name: perpetual
trans: 连续不断的； 长期的； 永久的

sentences.english: the perpetual snows of the mountaintops
sentences.chinese: 山顶的终年积雪

detailed_translations.english: permanent

name: fascinate
trans: 强烈地吸引， 使着迷

sentences.english: Politics fascinated Franklin's father.
sentences.chinese: 政治让富兰克林的父亲着迷。

detailed_translations.english: If something fascinates you, it interests and delights you so much that your thoughts tend to concentrate on it

name: suffer
trans: 遭受， 忍受； 忍耐； 容许； 患病； 受损失

sentences.english: At least he died suddenly and didn’t suffer.
sentences.chinese: 至少他死得突然，没有遭罪。

sentences.english: She’s suffering a lot of pain.
sentences.chinese: 她遭受着巨大的痛苦。

detailed_translations.english: to experience physical or mental pain

sentences.english: The public bar was crowded.
sentences.chinese: 大众酒吧间里人很多。

sentences.english: a candy bar
sentences.chinese: 一根糖果棒

sentences.english: houses with bars across the windows
sentences.chinese: 窗户上钉有铁条的房屋

detailed_translations.english: one of the rooms inside a pub

name: draft
trans: 草稿，草案；汇票；征兵，服役；通风，气流
起草， 草拟； 选派，抽调；征募， 征召…入伍

sentences.english: the rough draft of his new novel
sentences.chinese: 他的新小说的草稿

sentences.english: I read the first draft and thought it was very good.
sentences.chinese: 我读了第一稿，觉得非常好。

sentences.english: All parties eventually approved the final draft (= finished form ) of the peace treaty.
sentences.chinese: 各方最后都同意了和平条约的终稿。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing or a plan that is not yet in its finished form
to write a plan, letter, report etc that will need to be changed before it is in its finished form

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

sentences.english: Sarah was loath to tell her mother what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉不愿意告诉母亲所发生的事。

detailed_translations.english: to be unwilling to do something

sentences.english: The room is kept at 72 degrees and 50% relative humidity.
sentences.chinese: 房间的温度保持在72度，相对湿度50%。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of water contained in the air

sentences.english: a house with a view across the bay
sentences.chinese: 能看到海湾全景的一幢房子

sentences.english: Montego Bay
sentences.chinese: 蒙特哥湾

sentences.english: A dog suddenly howled, baying at the moon.
sentences.chinese: 一只狗忽然嚎叫起来，对月长嗥。

detailed_translations.english: a part of the sea that is partly enclosed by a curve in the land
If a dog or wolf bays, it makes loud, long cries

sentences.english: a political pamphlet
sentences.chinese: 政治宣传册

detailed_translations.english: a very thin book with paper covers, that gives information about something

name: documentation
trans: 文件证据， 文献资料， 文件

sentences.english: Applicants must provide supporting documentation .
sentences.chinese: 申请人必须提供证明文件。

detailed_translations.chinese: 文件, 证明文件, 史实, 文件编制
detailed_translations.english: official documents, reports etc that are used to prove that something is true or correct

name: vernacular
trans: 本国话；方言；土语；民间风格

sentences.english: In some churches, they speak Latin, but in others they use the vernacular.
sentences.chinese: 在一些教堂中，人们讲拉丁语，但在其他一些教堂中，人们使用本地话。

detailed_translations.english: a form of a language that ordinary people use, especially one that is not the official language

sentences.chinese: 从个人角度他很同情他们，但是他有任务在身。

name: artery
trans: 动脉； 干线， 要道

sentences.chinese: 动脉的动脉的，似动脉的，或在动脉里的。

sentences.chinese: 当它们被发现后，医生通过一个软管把一个小气球进入狭小的区域并且膨胀这个气球去压缩动脉边沉淀下来的血小板。

sentences.english: This term is used to describe a condition in which the blood supply to part of the brain is suddenly and critically impaired by a blood clot or when a ruptured artery leaks blood into the brain.
sentences.chinese: 该术语是用来形容如下的一种情况：提供给大脑部分的血液突然地削弱，这种削弱是由于血液的凝固或由于动脉割裂导致血液漏到大脑里面。

detailed_translations.english: one of the tubes that carries blood from your heart to the rest of your body

sentences.english: We underestimated how long it would take to get there.
sentences.chinese: 我们低估了到那里所需的时间。

sentences.english: Never underestimate the power of the press.
sentences.chinese: 绝不要低估新闻界的力量。

sentences.chinese: 新闻界对这位总统进行了新一轮的恶毒抨击。

sentences.english: synthetic chemicals

relating to substances, the study of substances, or processes involving changes in substances

计划，方案；体系，体制；阴谋

sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将用于教师培训计划。

sentences.chinese: 隔热[隔音]的阁楼

sentences.chinese: 影响我们生活的决定

sentences.chinese: 洪水使该镇与外界隔绝。

sentences.chinese: 这种情形显然源于他们本性上的某种缺陷，但是这种缺陷既不容易诊断也不容易治疗。

sentences.chinese: 我真不愿意让你失望，但我想她是不会回来了。

sentences.chinese: 对各个确立的政党有幻灭感。

Disillusion is the same as

sentences.chinese: 这两个历史时期的差别在哪里？

sentences.chinese: 小镇与外界的联系被切断了。

sentences.chinese: 你如果有任何疑问，尽管和我联系。

sentences.chinese: 有毒废物向海里的排放

sentences.chinese: 这篇报道应该可以对其他可能的购买者起到警告作用。

sentences.chinese: 犯罪行为可能会与经济困难有关。

sentences.chinese: 即使她从头到脚涂抹上防晒系数是7的防晒霜，她也会被晒伤。

sentences.chinese: 由于这个地区的交通流量有所增加，居民都在抱怨。

sentences.chinese: 你的狗每天需要进行至少20分钟的剧烈运动。
