sentences.english: The measures provoked vigorous opposition in right-wing circles.
sentences.chinese: 这些举措激起了右翼群体的强烈反对。

detailed_translations.english: using a lot of energy and strength or determination

sentences.english: He had enough money to pay off his outstanding debts.
sentences.chinese: 他有足够的钱偿还亏欠的债务。

sentences.english: students who run up huge debts
sentences.chinese: 欠下巨额债务的学生

detailed_translations.english: a sum of money that a person or organization owes

sentences.english: This is a cheap and simple process. However, there are dangers.
sentences.chinese: 这是个花钱少而又简单的方法，不过有危险。

sentences.english: an extremely unpleasant disease that is, however, easy to treat
sentences.chinese: 一种让人极其难受却容易治疗的病

sentences.english: However you look at it, it's going to cost a lot.
sentences.chinese: 不管你怎么看，它都要花很多钱。

detailed_translations.english: used when you are adding a fact or piece of information that seems surprising, or seems very different from what you have just said

name: humane
trans: 善良的， 人道的， 仁慈的， 慈悲的； 促进文明或教化的， 人文的

sentences.english: the campaign for the humane treatment of criminals
sentences.chinese: 提倡人道地对待罪犯的运动

sentences.english: a better, more humane world
sentences.chinese: 更美好、更人道的社会

detailed_translations.english: treating people or animals in a way that is not cruel and causes them as little suffering as possible

sentences.english: French and German were deemed essential.
sentences.chinese: 法语和德语被认为是必需的。

detailed_translations.english: to think of something in a particular way or as having a particular quality

sentences.english: ...the introduction of legislation to compel cyclists to wear a helmet.
sentences.chinese: …强制骑车人戴头盔的法律的引入。

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to do something

name: depress
trans: 使沮丧； 使不景气； 降低， 减少

sentences.english: The thought of taking the exam again depressed him.
sentences.chinese: 想到要补考，他就心情沮丧。

sentences.english: It depresses me that nobody seems to care.
sentences.chinese: 似乎没有人在乎，这让我感到很沮丧。

sentences.english: Depress the clutch fully.
sentences.chinese: 把离合器踩到底。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very unhappy

sentences.english: I don’t think he’s capable of murder.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他没有能力杀人。

sentences.english: The company isn’t capable of handling an order that large.
sentences.chinese: 那家公司没有能力应付那么大的订单。

sentences.english: I’m perfectly capable of looking after myself, thank you!
sentences.chinese: 我完全能够自己照顾自己，多谢了！

detailed_translations.english: having the qualities or ability needed to do something

name: disruptive
trans: 制造混乱的； 分裂性的； 破坏性的

sentences.english: Mike’s parents thought I was a disruptive influence (= a person who causes disruption ) .
sentences.chinese: 迈克的父母认为我是个捣蛋分子。

sentences.english: ways to handle disruptive pupils
sentences.chinese: 对付捣乱学生的办法

detailed_translations.english: causing problems and preventing something from continuing in its usual way

name: supervision
trans: 监督， 管理； 指导

sentences.english: The baby needs constant supervision.
sentences.chinese: 宝宝时刻都要有人照看。

detailed_translations.english: when you supervise someone or something

name: client
trans: 委托人； 顾客， 客户

sentences.english: a meeting with an important client
sentences.chinese: 与一位重要客户的会面

detailed_translations.english: someone who gets services or advice from a professional person, company, or organization

sentences.english: Bees sip honey from flowers and hum their thanks when they leave.
sentences.chinese: 蜜蜂从花中啜蜜，离开时营营地道谢。 獥，% 韐罔。

sentences.english: We afford you the opportunity to dine with delight, to sip in style, to relax in Comfort.
sentences.chinese: 我们将竭诚为您提供愉快进餐的良机，优雅的啜饮，舒适的休憩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 小口喝， 抿； 一小口的量
detailed_translations.english: a very small amount of a drink

name: demerit
trans: 过失； 缺点， 短处

sentences.english: Demerits were given to students for late attendance at prayers.
sentences.chinese: 祷告会上迟到的学生被记过了。

detailed_translations.english: a bad quality or feature of something

name: conversion
trans: 转化； 转变， 变换； 兑换； 改变信仰， 皈依

sentences.english: ...the conversion of disused rail lines into cycle routes.
sentences.chinese: …把废弃的铁路改变成自行车道。

detailed_translations.english: when you change something from one form, purpose, or system to a different one

sentences.english: The two sides have also pledged to enhance cooperation in tourism, and the protection and utilisation of cultural heritage.
sentences.chinese: 双方承诺在旅游、文化遗产保护和利用等领域加强交流合作。

sentences.english: But this requires greater domestic competition, reallocation of resources to more productive activity and better utilisation of labour.
sentences.chinese: 但这要求加强国内竞争，将资源重新配置到生产率更高的经济活动，并更好地利用劳动力。

name: brilliant
trans: 光辉灿烂的； 卓越的， 有才华的

sentences.english: She closed her eyes against the brilliant light.
sentences.chinese: 强烈的光线下，她闭起了眼睛。

sentences.english: We sat outside in the brilliant sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐在外面，沐浴在灿烂的阳光下。

sentences.english: She was dressed in brilliant white.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着一身耀眼的白色。

sentences.english: The film was absolutely brilliant.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影极为出色。

detailed_translations.english: brilliant light or colour is very bright and strong

name: historic
trans: 有历史意义的； 历史的， 历史性的

sentences.english: a historic meeting of world leaders
sentences.chinese: 具有历史意义的世界领导人会议

sentences.english: ‘It is a historic moment ,’ he told journalists.
sentences.chinese: “那是历史性的一刻。”他告诉新闻记者。

detailed_translations.english: a historic event or act is very important and will be recorded as part of history

name: practical
trans: 实际的， 实用的； 实践的， 应用的

sentences.english: Candidates should have training and practical experience in basic electronics.
sentences.chinese: 应征者应该具备基础电子学方面的培训和实践经验。

sentences.english: the practical problems of old age
sentences.chinese: 老年的实际问题

sentences.english: They provide financial and practical help for disabled students.
sentences.chinese: 他们为残障学生提供经济上的援助以及实际的帮助。

sentences.english: a combination of theoretical and practical training
sentences.chinese: 理论培训和实践培训的结合

sentences.english: They haven’t thought about the practical consequences of the new regulations.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有考虑过新法规会产生什么实际后果。

sentences.english: In practical terms, this means spending more time with each student.
sentences.chinese: 具体地说，这意味着花更多的时间和每个学生在一起。

detailed_translations.english: relating to real situations and events rather than ideas, emotions etc

name: easy-going
trans: 脾气随和的， 心平气和的； 随便的

sentences.english: Her easy-going nature made her popular.
sentences.chinese: 她生性随和，人缘很好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脾气随和的， 心平气和的； 随便的
detailed_translations.english: not easily upset, annoyed, or worried

name: bound
trans: 负有义务的； 一定的， 必然的

sentences.english: Don’t lie to her. She’s bound to find out.
sentences.chinese: 别骗她，她肯定会发现的。

sentences.english: When you are dealing with so many patients, mistakes are bound to happen.
sentences.chinese: 你要照顾这么多病人，失误在所难免。

detailed_translations.english: to be very likely to do or feel a particular thing

name: stroke
trans: 击，打；突然发作，中风；击球；笔触，一笔；划，划法；一击；报时的钟声；抚摸

sentences.english: She died following a massive stroke.
sentences.chinese: 她重度中风后去世了。

sentences.english: a stroke patient
sentences.chinese: 中风患者

sentences.english: His punishment was six strokes of the cane.
sentences.chinese: 给他的惩罚是挨六教鞭。

sentences.english: At the first stroke it will be 9 o'clock exactly.
sentences.chinese: 等到钟敲第一下时就是9点整。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden serious illness when a blood vessel in the brain bursts or is blocked, which can cause death or the loss of the ability to move or to speak clearly

name: breed
trans: 饲养，养殖，繁殖；养育，培育；酿成，招致

sentences.english: Spaniels are my favourite breed of dog.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙猎犬是我最喜欢的犬种。

sentences.english: Eagles breed during the cooler months of the year.
sentences.chinese: 鹰在一年中较凉爽的季节交配繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that is kept as a pet or on a farm
if animals breed, they  mate in order to have babies

name: fragrance
trans: 芳香， 香味； 香水

sentences.english: ...a shrubby plant with a strong characteristic fragrance.
sentences.chinese: …一种有独特浓郁香味的灌木。

detailed_translations.english: a pleasant smell

sentences.english: You disobeyed my orders.
sentences.chinese: 你违抗我的命令。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to do what someone with authority tells you to do, or refuse to obey a rule or law

name: elusive
trans: 难懂的， 难捉摸的； 易忘的

sentences.english: She enjoys a firm reputation in this country but wider international success has been elusive.
sentences.chinese: 她在这个国家享有稳固的声誉，但却一直难以在国际上取得更大的成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 难懂的；易忘的；逃避的；难捉摸的
detailed_translations.english: an elusive result is difficult to achieve

name: realm
trans: 界， 领域， 范围； 王国， 国度

sentences.english: the spiritual realm
sentences.chinese: 精神领域

detailed_translations.english: a general area of knowledge, activity, or thought

sentences.english: Road safety is taught to young children to avoid road accidents.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子受到道路安全知识的教育，以避免交通事故。

sentences.english: It is important to take measures to avoid the risk of fire.
sentences.chinese: 采取措施避免火灾风险很重要。

sentences.english: Alan narrowly avoided an accident.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦险出事故。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something bad from happening

name: lull
trans: 间歇， 暂停； 平静期

sentences.english: The hum of the tyres on the road lulled her to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 一路上滚滚的车轮声使她昏昏欲睡。

sentences.english: There was a lull in political violence after the election of the current president.
sentences.chinese: 现任总统选举结束以后，政治暴力曾暂时平息。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel calm or as if they want to sleep
A lull is a period of quiet or calm in a longer period of activity or excitement

sentences.english: the person who places the highest bid
sentences.chinese: 出价最高的人

sentences.english: We’ve made a bid of nearly £400 million for the company.
sentences.chinese: 我们出价近四亿英镑收购那家公司。

sentences.english: A takeover bid for the airline was launched today.
sentences.chinese: 今天有人出价收购该航空公司。

sentences.english: She bid £100 for a Victorian chair.
sentences.chinese: 她出价100英镑买一把维多利亚时代的椅子。

sentences.english: The two men ended up bidding against each other at the auction.
sentences.chinese: 结果那两个人在拍卖会上较起劲来。

detailed_translations.english: an offer to pay a particular price for something, especially at an  auction
to offer to pay a particular price for goods, especially in an auction

name: comprehensive
trans: 全面的， 广泛的； 综合的； 包容的

sentences.english: We offer our customers a comprehensive range of financial products.
sentences.chinese: 我们为客户提供全面的金融产品。

sentences.english: a comprehensive guide to British hotels and restaurants
sentences.chinese: 一本介绍英国酒店和餐厅的详尽指南

sentences.english: The following guidelines do not aim to be totally comprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 以下指导原则并非想要面面俱到。

detailed_translations.english: including all the necessary facts, details, or problems that need to be dealt with

sentences.english: Her reply astonished me.
sentences.chinese: 她的回答让我大吃一惊。

sentences.english: It astonished him that she had changed so little.
sentences.chinese: 他很惊讶，她几乎没怎么变。

sentences.english: What astonishes me most is his complete lack of fear.
sentences.chinese: 最令我吃惊的是，他什么都不怕。

detailed_translations.english: to surprise someone very much

sentences.english: a railway tunnel
sentences.chinese: 铁路隧道

sentences.english: the Channel Tunnel (= between England and France )
sentences.chinese: 〔英吉利〕海峡隧道

detailed_translations.english: a passage that has been dug under the ground for cars, trains etc to go through

detailed_translations.chinese: 挖；在…打开通道；在…挖掘隧道
detailed_translations.english: to dig a long passage under the ground

name: elaborate
trans: 详尽的；复杂的；精心制作的[ɪ'læbəreIt]

sentences.english: pure silks embroidered with elaborate patterns
sentences.chinese: 绣有精美图案的真丝衣服

sentences.english: A spokesman declined to elaborate on a statement released late yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 发言人拒绝对昨天晚些时候发表的一份声明作出更多说明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 复杂的； 精心制作的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of small parts or details put together in a complicated way
If you elaborate on something that has been said, you say more about it, or give more details

sentences.english: Go down here and the bathroom’s at the end of the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 沿着这儿走，浴室就在走廊的尽头。

detailed_translations.english: a long narrow passage on a train or between rooms in a building, with doors leading off it

sentences.english: The party was small and select.
sentences.chinese: 团里人员不多，都是经过精心挑选的。

sentences.english: Honorary degrees are handed out to a select few .
sentences.chinese: 荣誉学位颁给挑选出的少数几个人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精选的， 挑选出来的； 优等的， 第一流的
detailed_translations.english: a select group of people or things is a small special group that has been chosen carefully
to choose something or someone by thinking carefully about which is the best, most suitable etc

sentences.english: advanced learners of English
sentences.chinese: 高级程度的英语学习者

sentences.english: advanced physics
sentences.chinese: 高等物理（学）

detailed_translations.english: studying or dealing with a school subject at a difficult level

sentences.english: Put your rubbish in the bin.
sentences.chinese: 把你的垃圾放进箱子。

sentences.english: But you know how it is with us human you take something good you dissect it scrutinise it time and again not believing your good fortune and finally cast it to the "no" bin.
sentences.chinese: 可是你知道的，对我们人类来说，你以为某件事物很好、你仔细分析它、细看它一次又一次，不相信你的好运，最后又把它丢到「不」的箱子里（不再理它），这真是很消极又愚蠢的。

detailed_translations.english: a large container for storing things, such as goods in a shop or substances in a factory

name: mechanical
trans: 机械的， 机械制造的； 呆板的； 习惯性的； 体力的

sentences.english: The flight has been cancelled due to mechanical failure.
sentences.chinese: 因机械故障航班被取消了。

sentences.english: The plane had to make an emergency landing because of mechanical problems.
sentences.chinese: 飞机因机械故障不得不紧急降落。

sentences.english: the mechanical properties of solids
sentences.chinese: 固体的力学性能

detailed_translations.english: affecting or involving a machine

name: recommendation
trans: 推荐， 推荐信； 劝告， 建议

sentences.english: Academic staff are appointed on the recommendation of a committee.
sentences.chinese: 教员是委员会推荐任命的。

sentences.english: We will review the case and make a recommendation to the client.
sentences.chinese: 我们将审查此案，然后向当事人提出建议。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion to someone that they should choose a particular thing or person that you think is very good

name: invoke
trans: 恳求， 祈求； 援用， 援引； 使用， 应用

sentences.english: a painting that invokes images of the Rocky Mountains
sentences.chinese: 使人联想到落基山脉的画

sentences.english: During his speech, he invoked the memory of Harry Truman.
sentences.chinese: 他演讲时使人想起哈里 · 杜鲁门。

detailed_translations.english: to make a particular idea, image, or feeling appear in people’s minds by describing an event or situation, or by talking about a person

name: bit
trans: 少许； 小片； 小块

sentences.english: He’s taken the engine to bits .
sentences.chinese: 他把发动机拆开了。

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of something

sentences.english: Output is up 30% on last year.
sentences.chinese: 产量比去年提高了30%。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of goods or work produced by a person, machine, factory etc
if a computer outputs information, it produces it

sentences.english: She hoped to sleep off her fatigue.
sentences.chinese: 她希望睡一觉之后会消除疲劳。

sentences.english: I have got over my weakness and fatigue.
sentences.chinese: 我已从虚弱和疲劳中恢复过来了。

sentences.english: Everyone has analogy fatigue at this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上，人人都有类比疲劳。

detailed_translations.english: very great tiredness

sentences.english: The brain cells are inactive during sleep.
sentences.chinese: 在睡觉时脑细胞不活跃。

sentences.english: Young people are becoming politically inactive.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人变得不热衷政治了。

detailed_translations.english: not doing anything, not working, or not moving

name: striking
trans: 显著的， 惹人注目的

sentences.english: a striking contrast between wealth and poverty
sentences.chinese: 显著的贫富差异

sentences.english: The most striking feature of those statistics is the high proportion of suicides.
sentences.chinese: 那些统计数据最显著的特征是高自杀率。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or interesting enough to be easily noticed

sentences.english: unsanitary conditions
sentences.chinese: 不卫生的环境

detailed_translations.english: dirty and likely to cause disease

sentences.english: He sent his work to his publishers by modem.
sentences.chinese: 他通过调制解调器把作品发给他的出版商。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of electronic equipment that allows information from one computer to be sent along telephone wires to another computer

sentences.english: The Labour Party won a huge majority at the last general election.
sentences.chinese: 工党在上次大选中以巨大的票数优势获胜。

detailed_translations.english: most of the people or things in a group

sentences.english: the film’s lavish costumes and spectacular sets
sentences.chinese: 影片中奢华的戏装和壮观的场景

sentences.english: Hallowe’en costumes
sentences.chinese: 万圣节前夕化装服

detailed_translations.english: a set of clothes worn by an actor or by someone to make them look like something such as an animal, famous person etc

name: crown
trans: 王冠； 花冠； 齿冠

sentences.english: a hat with a high crown
sentences.chinese: 高顶帽

detailed_translations.english: the top part of a hat or someone’s head
to place a crown on the head of a new king or queen as part of an official ceremony in which they become king or queen

name: reduce
trans: 减少， 缩小； 简化

sentences.english: The governor announced a new plan to reduce crime.
sentences.chinese: 州长宣布了一项降低犯罪率的新计划。

sentences.english: The helmet law should reduce injuries in motorcycle accidents.
sentences.chinese: 头盔法的实施应该能减少摩托车事故的受伤率。

sentences.english: Small businesses will need to reduce costs in order to survive.
sentences.chinese: 小企业要想生存必须削减成本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something smaller or less in size, amount, or price

name: surface
trans: 浮出水面； 浮现， 显露； 在…上加表面

sentences.english: Nearly 10% of the Earth’s surface is covered by ice.
sentences.chinese: 地球表面将近 10% 被冰层覆盖。

sentences.english: Gas bubbles in any liquid tend to rise to the surface .
sentences.chinese: 在任何液体中气泡往往都会浮到表面。

detailed_translations.english: the top layer of an area of water or land
relating to the part of the army, navy etc that travels by land or on the sea, rather than by air or under the sea
if someone or something surfaces, they suddenly appear somewhere, especially after being gone or hidden for a long time

name: aggressiveness
trans: 侵略； 争斗； 攻击

sentences.english: Shareholders have been told to expect an even lower result next year.
sentences.chinese: 股东们被告知明年的业绩还会更差。

detailed_translations.english: someone who owns shares in a company or business

name: congested
trans: 拥挤不堪的； 充塞的

sentences.english: congested airspace
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的空域

sentences.english: London’s roads are heavily congested (= very congested ) .
sentences.chinese: 伦敦的马路非常拥挤。

detailed_translations.english: full of traffic

detailed_translations.chinese: 挤满；超负荷（congest的过去分词）

name: operate
trans: 运转； 动手术； 起作用； 操作； 经营

sentences.english: The whole tax system is now operating more efficiently.
sentences.chinese: 现在整个税收制度运作效率更高了。

sentences.english: The new law doesn’t operate in our favour.
sentences.chinese: 这项新法规对我们不利。

sentences.english: The car parks operate a pay-as-you-leave system.
sentences.chinese: 这些停车场按“离开时付费”的模式运作。

sentences.english: The bus company operates a Monday to Saturday service.
sentences.chinese: 这家公共汽车公司周一至周六运营。

detailed_translations.english: if a system, process, or service operates, or if you operate it, it works
to use and control a machine or equipment

name: verdict
trans: 裁定； 定论； 判断； 意见

sentences.english: The verdict was ‘not guilty’.
sentences.chinese: 裁决为“无罪”。

detailed_translations.english: an official decision made in a court of law, especially about whether someone is guilty of a crime or how a death happened

sentences.english: The concert will be broadcast in stereo.
sentences.chinese: 音乐会将用立体声播放。

sentences.english: stereo equipment
sentences.chinese: 立体声音响设备

detailed_translations.english: a way of recording or playing sound so that it is separated into two signals and produces more natural sound
using a recording or broadcasting system in which the sound is directed through two speakers

sentences.english: ...an exclusively male domain.
sentences.chinese: …一个由男性独占的领域。

detailed_translations.english: Exclusively is used to refer to situations or activities that involve only the thing or things mentioned, and nothing else

name: proportion
trans: 比例； 部分； 相称

sentences.english: A large proportion of the dolphins in that area will eventually die.
sentences.chinese: 那个地区的很大一部分海豚最终都会死去。

sentences.english: What’s the proportion of boys to girls in your class?
sentences.chinese: 你们班里男女生的比例是多少？

detailed_translations.english: a part of a number or an amount, considered in relation to the whole

sentences.english: The village isn’t very well signposted.
sentences.chinese: 这个村子在路标上指示得不是很清楚。

detailed_translations.english: a sign at the side of a road showing directions and distances

name: penalize
trans: 惩罚， 处罚； 判罚； 使处于不利地位

sentences.english: Women feel professionally penalized for taking time off to raise children.
sentences.chinese: 女性认为休假带孩子在职业上对自己不利。

detailed_translations.english: to punish someone or treat them unfairly

sentences.english: The quarterback sprinted toward the end zone with Jansen in hot pursuit (= following closely behind ) .
sentences.chinese: 那名四分卫快速冲向底线区，詹森穷追不舍。

detailed_translations.english: when someone tries to get, achieve, or find something in a determined way

sentences.english: In 1999 it was revealed that he was close to bankruptcy.
sentences.chinese: 1999年他被披露几近破产。

sentences.english: When inflation rises, so do bankruptcies.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀加剧，破产个案也会增加。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being unable to pay your debts

sentences.english: Bribe paying is not only abhorrent but is counterproductive in the longer term.
sentences.chinese: 贿赂不仅是可恶的，而且从长远看还会产生相反的结果。

sentences.english: In the face of that inherent dignity, Gombinerconcludes, the human practice of delivering animals to the table in the form offood is abhorrent and inexcusable.
sentences.chinese: 面对这与生俱来的尊严，高姆宾尔断言，人类把动物放到餐桌上作为食物的做法是可恶且不可原谅的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is abhorrent is completely unacceptable because it seems morally wrong

name: ruthless
trans: 无情的， 冷酷的， 残忍的

sentences.english: a ruthless dictator
sentences.chinese: 无情的独裁者

sentences.english: They have shown a ruthless disregard for basic human rights.
sentences.chinese: 他们冷酷地无视基本人权。

detailed_translations.english: so determined to get what you want that you do not care if you have to hurt other people in order to do it

name: handicapped
trans: 残废的， 有生理缺陷的

sentences.english: a special school for mentally handicapped children
sentences.chinese: 弱智儿童特殊学校

sentences.english: ...measures to prevent discrimination against the handicapped.
sentences.chinese: …防止歧视残疾人的措施。

detailed_translations.english: if someone is handicapped, a part of their body or their mind has been permanently injured or damaged. Some people think that this word is offensive.
You can refer to people who are handicapped as the handicapped

name: dissolve
trans: 溶解； 解散； 结束

sentences.english: Stir until the sugar dissolves.
sentences.chinese: 一直搅拌到糖溶解掉。

detailed_translations.english: if a solid dissolves, or if you dissolve it, it mixes with a liquid and becomes part of it

name: angle
trans: 移向； 使成角度移动； 从报道

sentences.english: You didn’t measure the angle accurately.
sentences.chinese: 你没有量准角度。

detailed_translations.english: the space between two straight lines or surfaces that join each other, measured in degrees

sentences.english: an illegal immigrant
sentences.chinese: 非法移民

sentences.english: a new wave of immigrants from the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 来自中东的一股新兴的移民浪潮

detailed_translations.english: someone who enters another country to live there permanently

sentences.english: the traditions of South East Asia
sentences.chinese: 东南亚的传统

sentences.english: the tradition that the eldest son inherits the property
sentences.chinese: 长子继承家产的传统

sentences.english: By tradition, it’s the bride’s parents who pay for the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 根据传统习俗，婚礼的费用由新娘的父母承担。

detailed_translations.english: a belief, custom, or way of doing something that has existed for a long time, or these beliefs, customs etc in general

name: urgent
trans: 紧急的， 紧迫的； 催促的， 急切的

sentences.english: He was in urgent need of medical attention.
sentences.chinese: 他急需治疗。

sentences.english: The report called for urgent action to reduce lead in petrol.
sentences.chinese: 报告呼吁迅速采取行动，减少汽油中的铅含量。

sentences.english: an urgent message
sentences.chinese: 一封急报

detailed_translations.english: very important and needing to be dealt with immediately

sentences.english: the optic nerve
sentences.chinese: 视神经

detailed_translations.english: relating to the eyes

name: predominate
trans: 统治， 支配； 占优势

sentences.english: In this type of case, the rights of the parent predominate.
sentences.chinese: 像这样的案例，要首先考虑父母的权利。

detailed_translations.english: to have the most importance or influence, or to be most easily noticed

name: fluency
trans: 流利， 流畅； 通顺

sentences.english: Mary is ambitious enough to aspire to conversational fluency in Chinese in four months.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽雄心很大，竟想在四个月里学会用汉语流利地会话。

sentences.english: I have achieved varying degrees of fluency in 12 languages, and look forward to learning more.
sentences.chinese: 我已经在12门语言上达到了不同程度的流利，还期待学更多种语言。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being able to speak or write a language, especially a foreign language, easily and well

sentences.english: a systematic approach to solving the problem
sentences.chinese: 系统解决问题的办法

detailed_translations.english: done according to a system or plan, in a thorough, efficient or determined way
the analysis of biological data using mathematical and statistical methods

name: hide
trans: 〔可观察鸟兽行动的〕隐匿处，埋伏处

sentences.english: She keeps a bottle of gin hidden behind a stack of books.
sentences.chinese: 她在一堆书的后面藏了一瓶杜松子酒。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately put or keep something or someone in a place where they cannot easily be seen or found

name: irrevocable
trans: 无法取消的， 不能改变的

sentences.english: Think about the situation carefully before you take an irrevocable step.
sentences.chinese: 在你踏出不能回头的一步之前要三思。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可改变的；不能取消的；不能挽回的
detailed_translations.english: an irrevocable decision, action etc cannot be changed or stopped

name: corporate
trans: 团体的， 共同的； 法人的， 公司的

sentences.english: The company is moving its corporate headquarters (= main offices ) from New York to Houston.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司要把总部从纽约迁到休斯敦。

sentences.english: Vince is vice-president of corporate communications.
sentences.chinese: 文斯是负责企业宣传的副总裁。

sentences.english: Corporate America is not about to be converted to the environmentalist cause.
sentences.chinese: 美国企业界不打算投身环保事业。

sentences.english: changing the corporate culture (= the way that people in a corporation think and behave ) to accept family-friendly policies
sentences.chinese: 改变公司文化，采取更关怀家庭的政策

sentences.english: an advertising campaign intended to reinforce our corporate identity
sentences.chinese: 旨在加强我们公司形象的广告宣传活动

sentences.english: The yacht can be hired for corporate hospitality (= entertainment provided by companies for their customers ) .
sentences.chinese: 可以租下这艘游艇用于公司招待客户。

detailed_translations.chinese: 法人团体的， 公司的； 全体的， 共同的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to or relating to a corporation

sentences.english: the discovery of oil in Alaska
sentences.chinese: 在阿拉斯加发现石油

sentences.english: The Hubble Telescope allowed astronomers to make significant discoveries about our galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 哈勃望远镜使天文学家对我们的银河系有了重大发现。

detailed_translations.english: when someone discovers something

sentences.english: Staff work at the council to a "flexitime system" which means they take breaks at different times and if they go out to buy a sandwich they clock in and out by swiping their cards .
sentences.chinese: 该地方议会实行“弹性工作制”，工作人员可以在不同时间段休息。 如果他们出去买三明治，就必须刷卡登记。

sentences.english: Telecommuting, flexitime and job sharing were the main types of flexibility cited in the  study published in the Psychologist-Manager journal.
sentences.chinese: 该项在《心理学家与管理人》期刊上发表的研究报告提到，远程办公、弹性工时，以及分工合作是弹性工作制的几种主要形式。

detailed_translations.english: a system in which people work a particular number of hours each week or month, but can change the times at which they start and finish each day

name: constant
trans: 经常的，不断的；坚定的，永恒的，忠实的；持续的，不变的

sentences.english: There was a constant stream of visitors to the house.
sentences.chinese: 参观这幢房子的游客川流不息。

sentences.english: Amy lived in constant fear of being attacked.
sentences.chinese: 埃米一直生活在害怕遭到袭击的恐惧之中。

sentences.english: He kept in constant contact with his family while he was in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他在澳大利亚时一直和家人保持着联系。

sentences.english: travelling at a constant speed
sentences.chinese: 以恒定速度行驶

detailed_translations.english: happening regularly or all the time

sentences.english: They riprapped the breakwater with stone.
sentences.chinese: 他们以乱石基巩固防波堤。

sentences.english: Back of the breakwater the dredger was working.
sentences.chinese: 在防波堤后面挖泥船正在工作。

sentences.english: The actual breakwater itself will be built on a foundation of slag—a permeable byproduct of steel which will provide a habitat for aquatic wildlife in the lake.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，防浪堤本身是建在矿渣（具有渗透性的钢铁的副产物）上的，这能为水中的生物营造良好的生活环境。

detailed_translations.english: a wall built out into the sea to protect the shore from the force of the waves

name: diffuse
trans: 散布， 传播； 漫射； 扩散， 弥漫
扩散的， 漫射的； 冗长的， 难解的

sentences.english: The pollutants diffuse into the soil.
sentences.chinese: 污染物渗进了土壤。

sentences.english: Their ideas diffused quickly across Europe.
sentences.chinese: 他们的观点很快在欧洲传播开来。

sentences.english: His writing is diffuse and difficult to understand.
sentences.chinese: 他写的东西冗长难懂。

detailed_translations.english: to make heat, light, liquid etc spread through something, or to spread like this
using a lot of words and not explaining things clearly and directly

sentences.english: Police are sifting through the evidence.
sentences.chinese: 警方在筛查证据。

detailed_translations.english: to put flour, sugar etc through a sieve or similar container in order to remove large pieces

sentences.english: games that can be downloaded free from the Internet
sentences.chinese: 可以从因特网上免费下载的游戏

detailed_translations.english: to move information or programs from a computer network to a small computer

name: split
trans: 分裂，分离；撕裂，裂开；劈开；分担，分享
裂口； 分化， 分裂

sentences.english: The branch split under their weight.
sentences.chinese: 树枝承受不住他们的重量断裂了。

sentences.english: In a severe gale the ship split in two.
sentences.chinese: 在一次强劲的大风中那艘船断成了两半。

sentences.english: If the chicken is fairly small, you may simply split it in half.
sentences.chinese: 要是鸡不太大，你把它分成两半就行。

detailed_translations.english: to divide or separate something into different parts or groups, or to be divided into different parts or groups
If something splits or if you split it, it is divided into two or more parts

sentences.english: Stamen is most, helix is arranged, centrifugal direction development, sometimes little at 10, often have degrade staminal .
sentences.chinese: 雄蕊多数，螺旋排列，离心方向发育，有时少于10个，常有退化雄蕊。

sentences.english: Based on the center of gravity of cab, this paper offers the improvement ways for helix spring and shock absorber of the heavy truck cab suspension.
sentences.chinese: 文章在测出某重卡驾驶室质心的基础上，对重卡驾驶室悬置系统中前、后螺旋弹簧及减振器的参数进行改进。

detailed_translations.english: a line that curves and rises around a central line

sentences.english: petroleum-based products
sentences.chinese: 石油产品

detailed_translations.english: oil that is obtained from below the surface of the Earth and is used to make petrol,  paraffin  , and various chemical substances

name: novice
trans: 生手， 新手； 初学者； 新信徒， 初学修士

sentences.english: The computer course is ideal for novices.
sentences.chinese: 这门计算机课程非常适合初学者。

sentences.english: This trail is not recommended for novice bikers.
sentences.chinese: 不建议自行车新手走这条小路。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has no experience in a skill, subject, or activity

sentences.english: Tom knelt down and patted the dog.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆跪下来轻轻拍了拍那只狗。

detailed_translations.english: to be in or move into a position where your body is resting on your knees

sentences.english: When others check in their code, you will see it as incoming to your workspace.
sentences.chinese: 当其他人核查他们的代码时，您将看到它像引入您的工作空间一样。

sentences.english: Reject no incoming request, regardless of the impact they may have on service level agreements.
sentences.chinese: 不拒绝任何传入的请求，不管它们会对服务水平协议产生什么影响。

sentences.english: You can see how using this mechanism enables you to influence the behavior of the ESB, and how it handles incoming requests based on policy definitions you store in the registry.
sentences.chinese: 您可以看到使用此机制如何使您能够影响 ESB 的行为，以及它如何基于您存储在注册中心的策略定义对传入请求进行处理。

sentences.english: a diplomat who had a peripheral role in the negotiations
sentences.chinese: 在谈判中发挥辅助作用的外交官

sentences.english: Her involvement in the case was peripheral.
sentences.chinese: 她在这宗案件中是从犯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 外围的；次要的；（神经）末梢区域的
detailed_translations.english: not as important as other things or people in a particular activity, idea, or situation
a piece of equipment that is connected to a computer and used with it, for example a  printer

name: discretion
trans: 判断力； 谨慎， 审慎； 明智

sentences.english: British newspapers no longer feel they must treat the royal family with discretion.
sentences.chinese: 英国报界不再觉得他们非得审慎对待王室不可了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自由裁量权；谨慎；判断力；判定；考虑周到
detailed_translations.english: the ability to deal with situations in a way that does not offend, upset, or embarrass people or tell any of their secrets

name: disruption
trans: 动乱； 打乱； 破坏

sentences.english: The strike caused widespread disruption .
sentences.chinese: 罢工造成了大规模的混乱。

name: level
trans: 平的，水平的；同高度的，同等程度的；平稳的；冷静的
水平面，水平线；高度，水平；等级

sentences.english: Your arms should be at the same level as your desk.
sentences.chinese: 手臂应该与桌子齐平。

sentences.english: The floors in the old house were not completely level.
sentences.chinese: 老房子的地面不是完全平整的。

detailed_translations.english: the height of something in relation to the ground or to another object
flat and not sloping in any direction

name: lever
trans: 〔机器或设备的〕控制杆，操纵杆

sentences.english: Pull this lever to open the gate.
sentences.chinese: 拉此横杆开启大门。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin piece of metal that you use to lift something heavy by putting one end under the object and pushing the other end down
to move something with a lever

name: preserve
trans: 保护； 维持； 保存， 保藏； 腌渍

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

name: establish
trans: 建立； 确立； 安置， 使定居

sentences.english: He’d already begun to establish quite a reputation as a journalist.
sentences.chinese: 身为记者，他已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: He had three years in which to establish himself as Prime Minister.
sentences.chinese: 他有三年时间来确立自己首相的地位。

detailed_translations.english: to make people accept that you can do something, or that you have a particular quality

name: relevant
trans: 有关的， 相应的； 适当的， 中肯的； 有重大意义的

sentences.english: Relevant documents were presented in court.
sentences.chinese: 法庭上出示了相关的文件。

sentences.english: We received all the relevant information.
sentences.chinese: 我们收到了所有相关信息。

detailed_translations.english: directly relating to the subject or problem being discussed or considered

name: deter
trans: 威慑， 吓住， 断念

sentences.english: The company’s financial difficulties have deterred potential investors.
sentences.chinese: 该公司的财务困境令潜在的投资者望而却步。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from doing something, by making them realize it will be difficult or have bad results

sentences.english: synthetic chemicals
sentences.chinese: 合成化学品

detailed_translations.english: produced by combining different artificial substances, rather than being naturally produced

name: proclaim
trans: 宣告， 宣布， 声明； 显示

sentences.english: The President proclaimed the republic’s independence.
sentences.chinese: 总统宣布共和国独立。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宣告，公布；声明；表明；赞扬
detailed_translations.english: to say publicly or officially that something important is true or exists

name: bunch
trans: 集中， 挤在一起； 使成一束

sentences.english: She bunched the cloth up and threw it away.
sentences.chinese: 她把布揉成一团扔了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 集中， 挤在一起； 形成一束
detailed_translations.english: to pull material together tightly in folds
a group of things that are fastened, held, or growing together
to hold or tie things together in a bunch

sentences.english: Is anything wrong? You look a little tense.
sentences.chinese: 有什么不对劲吗？你看起来有点紧张。

detailed_translations.english: a tense situation is one in which you feel very anxious and worried because of something bad that might happen
to make your muscles tight and stiff, or to become tight and stiff

any of the forms of a verb that show the time, continuance, or completion of an action or state that is expressed by the verb. ‘I am’ is in the present tense, ‘I was’ is past tense, and ‘I will be’ is future tense.

name: predominant
trans: 卓越的， 突出的； 支配的， 主要的； 盛行的

sentences.english: the predominant group in society
sentences.chinese: 社会中的主导群体

sentences.english: In this painting, the predominant colour is black.
sentences.chinese: 这幅画的主色调是黑色。

detailed_translations.english: more powerful, more common, or more easily noticed than others

name: domesticate
trans: 驯养， 教化； 使喜爱家居生活

sentences.english: We domesticated the dog to help us with hunting.
sentences.chinese: 我们驯养狗来帮助我们打猎。

detailed_translations.english: to make an animal able to work for people or live with them as a pet

name: recipe
trans: 食谱； 方法， 秘诀， 秘方

sentences.english: a recipe book
sentences.chinese: 一本烹饪书

detailed_translations.english: a set of instructions for cooking a particular type of food

name: mental
trans: 心理的， 精神的； 智力的

sentences.english: The centre provides help for people suffering from mental illness .
sentences.chinese: 该中心对精神病患者提供帮助。

sentences.english: Stress has an effect on both your physical and mental health .
sentences.chinese: 压力对身体健康和心理健康都有影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 心理的， 精神的， 思想上的； 精神病的； 智力的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the health or state of someone’s mind

sentences.english: It’s not easy to apportion blame (=  say who deserves to be blamed  ) when a marriage breaks up.
sentences.chinese: 婚姻破裂很难说是谁的错。

detailed_translations.english: to decide how something should be shared among various people

name: hostility
trans: 敌意，敌对，对抗；抵制，反对，否决；

sentences.english: The last decade has witnessed a serious rise in the levels of racism and hostility to black and ethnic groups.
sentences.chinese: 过去的10年里，种族主义及对黑人和少数民族的敌意变得更加严重了。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is unfriendly and full of anger towards another person

sentences.english: She bowed and left the stage.
sentences.chinese: 她鞠了一躬，离开了舞台。

sentences.english: Corbett entered the room, bowing respectfully.
sentences.chinese: 科比特走进房间，恭敬地鞠了一躬。

sentences.english: The servant bowed low and handed his master the sealed note.
sentences.chinese: 仆人深深一鞠躬，把那个封好的短笺递给了主人。

sentences.english: This is done with a formal bow to the king or queen.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，还要向国王或女王正式鞠躬行礼。

detailed_translations.english: to bend the top part of your body forward in order to show respect for someone important, or as a way of thanking an  audience
the act of bending the top part of your body forward to show respect for someone when you meet them, or as a way of thanking an audience

name: decent
trans: 大方的， 体面的， 像样的； 正派的， 合乎礼仪的

sentences.english: a decent burial
sentences.chinese: 得体的葬礼

sentences.english: Paul visited the local bars more frequently than was decent for a senior lecturer.
sentences.chinese: 保罗过于频繁地光顾当地酒吧，不太合乎高级讲师的身份。

sentences.english: The chairman did the decent thing (= did what people thought he ought to ) and resigned.
sentences.chinese: 主席体面地辞去了职务。

detailed_translations.english: following moral standards that are acceptable to society

sentences.english: He published his autobiography last autumn.
sentences.chinese: 他去年秋天出版了他的自传。

detailed_translations.english: a book in which someone writes about their own life, or books of this type

name: regularity
trans: 规律性， 规则性； 整齐， 匀称

sentences.english: the regularity of his features
sentences.chinese: 他端正的五官

detailed_translations.english: when something is arranged in an even way

name: switch
trans: 改变， 转变； 转换； 对调

sentences.english: The terrorists will switch tactics .
sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子会改变战术。

detailed_translations.english: to change from doing or using one thing to doing or using another

name: viable
trans: 可行的， 可实施的； 【生】 能自行生长发育的

sentences.english: viable seeds
sentences.chinese: 可存活的种子

detailed_translations.chinese: 可行的；能养活的；能生育的
detailed_translations.english: a viable idea, plan, or method can work successfully

sentences.english: Consumers will soon be paying higher airfares.
sentences.chinese: 不久消费者就要支付更高的机票价了。

sentences.english: It will offer a wider choice of goods for the consumer (= consumers in general ).
sentences.chinese: 它将为消费者提供更多的商品选择。

sentences.english: Consumer demand led to higher imports of manufactured goods.
sentences.chinese: 消费者需求促使制造商品的进口量增加了。

sentences.english: Consumer spending was down by 0.1% last month.
sentences.chinese: 上个月消费支出下降了0.1%。

sentences.english: sources of consumer advice
sentences.chinese: 给予消费者建议的信息来源

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys and uses products and services

sentences.english: Victor’s facial expression didn’t change.
sentences.chinese: 维克托脸上的表情没有变化。

sentences.english: facial hair
sentences.chinese: 脸部的汗毛

detailed_translations.chinese: 面部的，表面的；脸的，面部用的
detailed_translations.english: on your face or relating to your face
if you have a facial, you have a beauty treatment in which your face is cleaned and creams are rubbed into it

name: initiative
trans: 倡议， 新方案； 主动性， 积极性； 主动权

sentences.english: I wish my son would show more initiative.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我的儿子能表现得再主动一些。

sentences.english: Don’t keep asking me for advice. Use your initiative.
sentences.chinese: 别老是要我给你出主意，发挥一下你自己的决断能力吧。

sentences.english: Lt. Carlos was not obeying orders. He acted on his own initiative (= he was not told what to do ).
sentences.chinese: 卡洛斯中尉没有服从命令，而是自作主张。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to make decisions and take action without waiting for someone to tell you what to do

sentences.english: Screw the lid on clockwise.
sentences.chinese: 按顺时针方向拧紧盖子。

sentences.english: Gently swing your right arm in a clockwise direction.
sentences.chinese: 按顺时针方向轻轻摆动你的右臂。

detailed_translations.english: in the same direction as the  hands  of a clock move
Clockwise is also an adjective

sentences.english: When somebody comes for treatment I always ask them if they are on any medication.
sentences.chinese: 有人来治疗时，我总是会问他们是否在服药。

detailed_translations.chinese: 药物；药物治疗；药物处理
detailed_translations.english: medicine or drugs given to people who are ill

sentences.english: an electric drill
sentences.chinese: 电钻

sentences.english: rifle drill
sentences.chinese: 步枪操练

sentences.english: Drill a hole in each corner.
sentences.chinese: 在每个角上钻一个孔。

detailed_translations.english: a tool or machine used for making holes in something
to make a hole in something using a drill

sentences.english: a clerk in a commercial firm
sentences.chinese: 一家商行的文员

detailed_translations.chinese: 职员，办事员；店员；书记；记账员；<古>牧师，教士
detailed_translations.english: someone who keeps records or accounts in an office

detailed_translations.chinese: 当销售员，当店员；当职员
detailed_translations.english: to work as a clerk

name: dormant
trans: 休眠的； 静止的； 隐匿的

sentences.english: a huge dormant volcano
sentences.chinese: 一座巨大的休眠火山

detailed_translations.chinese: 休眠的；静止的；睡眠状态的；隐匿的
detailed_translations.english: not active or not growing at the present time but able to be active later

name: acknowledge
trans: 承认， 确认； 致意； 感谢

sentences.english: The family acknowledge the need for change.
sentences.chinese: 全家人都承认需要改变一下。

sentences.english: I would be grateful if you would acknowledge receipt of this letter.
sentences.chinese: 收到此信后请告知，不胜感谢。

detailed_translations.english: to admit or accept that something is true or that a situation exists

sentences.english: a hotel lobby
sentences.chinese: 宾馆大堂

sentences.english: I’ll meet you in the entrance lobby.
sentences.chinese: 我们在入口大厅见。

sentences.english: The group is lobbying for a reduction in defence spending.
sentences.chinese: 该团体正在游说政府削减国防开支。

detailed_translations.english: a wide passage or large hall just inside the entrance to a public building
to try to persuade the government or someone with political power that a law or situation should be changed

sentences.english: The buildings were in a decrepit state.
sentences.chinese: 这些建筑物破旧不堪。

sentences.english: He was a rather decrepit old man.
sentences.chinese: 他年老体弱。

detailed_translations.english: old and in bad condition

sentences.english: ...America's part in the postwar reconstruction of Germany.
sentences.chinese: …美国在战后德国重建中扮演的角色。

detailed_translations.english: the work that is done to repair the damage to a city, industry etc, especially after a war

name: hereditary
trans: 遗传的， 遗传性的； 可继承的， 世袭的

sentences.english: a hereditary peer
sentences.chinese: 世袭贵族

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗传的；世袭的；世代相传的
detailed_translations.english: a quality or illness that is hereditary is passed from a parent to a child before the child is born

name: inflict
trans: 把…强加给， 使遭受， 使承受

sentences.english: ...the damage being inflicted on industries by the recession.
sentences.chinese: …经济衰退给工业造成的损失。

detailed_translations.chinese: 造成；使遭受（损伤、痛苦等）；给予（打击等）
detailed_translations.english: To inflict harm or damage on someone or something means to make them suffer it

name: stance
trans: 姿势； 观点， 立场

sentences.english: a fighting stance
sentences.chinese: 搏击姿势

detailed_translations.chinese: 立场；姿态；位置；准备击球姿势
detailed_translations.english: an opinion that is stated publicly

sentences.english: The next day, we drove inland.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，我们乘车开往内陆。

sentences.english: We beached the boat and headed inland.
sentences.chinese: 我们想使船靠岸，朝内陆方向驶去。

sentences.english: In 1985 a glacier buried this shore; since then the ice has retreated a half mile inland.
sentences.chinese: 1985年，一座冰川在海滨融化，自那时起冰川已经向内陆退缩了半英里。

detailed_translations.english: an inland area, city etc is not near the coast

detailed_translations.chinese: 在内地；向内地；向内陆；在内陆
detailed_translations.english: in a direction away from the coast and towards the centre of a country

name: worthwhile
trans: 值得花费时间的， 值得做的

sentences.english: He wanted to do a worthwhile job.
sentences.chinese: 他想做有意义的工作。

sentences.english: We decided to give the money to a worthwhile cause (= one that helps people ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定把这笔钱投入到慈善事业中。

detailed_translations.english: if something is worthwhile, it is important or useful, or you gain something from it

sentences.english: Conclusions Using HACCP method in refectory obtained good effect.
sentences.chinese: 结论：在学校食堂应用HACCP管理是有效的。

sentences.english: Do you know if hereabout have preferable refectory for Western - style food.
sentences.chinese: 你知道附近有比较好的西餐厅吗?。

sentences.english: There is no denying that the qualities of food in our refectory have gone from bad to worse .
sentences.chinese: 不可否认的，我们学校食堂食物的质量已经每况愈下。

detailed_translations.english: a large room in a school, college etc where meals are served and eaten

name: mould
trans: 用模子制作， 浇铸； 使形成， 把…塑造成
霉，霉菌；模型，铸模；性格，气质

sentences.english: Clothes mould in wet weather.
sentences.chinese: 天气潮湿时衣服会发霉。

sentences.english: Such oil can contain carcinogens and toxic mould.
sentences.chinese: 这种油可能包含致癌物和有毒的霉。

detailed_translations.english: to become or cause to become covered with this growth
a hollow container that you pour a liquid or soft substance into, so that when it becomes solid, it takes the shape of the container

sentences.english: Johnson’s specialty is medieval European history.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊的专业是中世纪欧洲史。

detailed_translations.chinese: 专业，专长；特产；特性；招牌菜
detailed_translations.english: a subject or job that you know a lot about or have a lot of experience of

sentences.english: He slipped and fell, badly bruising an elbow.
sentences.chinese: 他滑倒了，严重挫伤了一只胳膊肘。

detailed_translations.english: the joint where your arm bends
to push someone with your elbows, especially in order to move past them

name: vary
trans: 改变； 多样化； 变化； 不同

sentences.english: Test scores vary from school to school.
sentences.chinese: 测验成绩各校不同。

sentences.english: The heights of the plants vary from 8 cm to 20 cm.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物的高度从8厘米到20厘米不等。

sentences.english: Medical treatment varies greatly from state to state.
sentences.chinese: 医疗制度州与州之间差异很大。

sentences.english: Cooking times may vary slightly, depending on your oven.
sentences.chinese: 烹饪时间可能略有不同，因烤炉而异。

sentences.english: Charges vary according to size.
sentences.chinese: 费用因大小而异。

sentences.english: She has tried different diets with varying degrees of success.
sentences.chinese: 她试过各种不同的节食方式，效果各不相同。

sentences.english: tests of varying levels of difficulty
sentences.chinese: 难易程度不一的测验

sentences.english: Quentin’s mood seems to vary according to the weather.
sentences.chinese: 昆廷的情绪似乎随天气而变化。

detailed_translations.english: if several things of the same type vary, they are all different from each other

name: coherent
trans: 条理清楚的， 连贯的； 一致的， 协调的

sentences.english: The three years of the course are planned as a coherent whole.
sentences.chinese: 这三年的课程是作为连贯的整体来安排的。

sentences.english: a coherent account of the incident
sentences.chinese: 对该事件条理分明的陈述

sentences.english: He's so calm when he answers questions in interviews. I wish I could be that coherent.
sentences.chinese: 他如此镇定地回答了访谈中的问题。我希望我也能那样有条不紊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一致的，协调的；(话语等)条理清楚的
detailed_translations.english: if a piece of writing, set of ideas etc is coherent, it is easy to understand because it is clear and reasonable

name: inviolable
trans: 不可侵犯的， 不容亵渎的， 不容破坏的

sentences.english: The game had a single inviolable rule: obstacles were to be overcome, not circumvented.
sentences.chinese: 这个游戏有一个单一的不可违反的规则：困难是被克服的，不是被回避的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可侵犯的；神圣的；不可亵渎的
detailed_translations.english: an inviolable right, law, principle etc is extremely important and should be treated with respect and not broken or removed

name: upper
trans: 上面的； 地位较高的

sentences.english: the upper lip
sentences.chinese: 上唇

detailed_translations.english: in a higher position than something else

name: delta
trans: 三角洲； 希腊字母表的第四个字母

sentences.english: the Nile delta
sentences.chinese: 尼罗河三角洲

detailed_translations.chinese: （河流的）三角洲；德耳塔（希腊字母的第四个字）
detailed_translations.english: the fourth letter of the Greek alphabet

sentences.english: Fairfax County, Virginia
sentences.chinese: 弗吉尼亚州费尔法克斯县

detailed_translations.english: an area of a state or country that has its own government to deal with local matters

name: respondent
trans: 回答者， 响应者； 调查对象； 被告

sentences.english: Upon receipt of a copy of the arbitration application, the respondent shall, within the time limit prescribed by the Arbitration Rules, submit its defence to the arbitration commission.
sentences.chinese: 被申请人收到仲裁申请书副本后，应当在仲裁规则规定的期限内向仲裁委员会提交答辩书。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has to defend their own case in a law court, especially in a  divorce  case

sentences.english: She asked the doctor to speak to her parents on her behalf.
sentences.chinese: 她请医生代她同她父母谈谈。

sentences.english: On behalf of everyone here, may I wish you a very happy retirement.
sentences.chinese: 请允许我代表在座的各位祝你退休后生活愉快。

detailed_translations.english: instead of someone, or as their representative

name: animate
trans: 赋予生命； 使生机勃勃

sentences.english: Laughter animated his face for a moment.
sentences.chinese: 笑容使他的脸上一时增添了生气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使有生气；使活泼；鼓舞；推动
detailed_translations.english: to give life or energy to something
living

sentences.english: He vowed to achieve certain objectives before the end of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 他立誓要在他的总统任期结束之前实现某些目标。

sentences.english: the best way to accomplish your objectives
sentences.chinese: 完成目标的最佳方法

sentences.english: The degree program has two main objectives.
sentences.chinese: 该学位课程有两个主要目标。

sentences.english: Managers should set specific performance objectives for their teams.
sentences.chinese: 经理应该为自己的团队制定明确的绩效目标。

sentences.english: The main objective was to improve children’s knowledge of geography.
sentences.chinese: 主要目的是要增长儿童的地理知识。

sentences.english: A clear objective was set and adhered to.
sentences.chinese: 定下了明确的目标并坚持到底。

sentences.english: One of your first business objectives should be to get your own office.
sentences.chinese: 你的首要工作目标之一应该是拥有自己的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying hard to achieve, especially in business or politics

name: scandal
trans: 丑事， 丑闻； 恶意诽谤； 流言飞语； 反感， 愤慨

sentences.english: It caused quite a scandal when he left his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他离开妻子成了一大丑闻。

sentences.english: The college has recently been involved in a drugs scandal .
sentences.chinese: 这所大学最近卷入了毒品丑闻。

sentences.english: He has been at the centre of a political scandal .
sentences.chinese: 他成了一桩政治丑闻的焦点。

sentences.english: a major scandal involving the government
sentences.chinese: 涉及政府的一桩重大丑闻

sentences.english: a series of financial scandals
sentences.chinese: 一连串金融丑闻

sentences.english: a sex scandal that ruined his reputation
sentences.chinese: 让他名誉扫地的性丑闻

sentences.english: They had already left the country when the scandal broke .
sentences.chinese: 丑闻爆出时他们已经离开了这个国家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丑事， 丑闻； 流言蜚语； 反感， 愤慨
detailed_translations.english: an event in which someone, especially someone important, behaves in a bad way that shocks people

name: dormancy
trans: 休眠； 催眠状态； 冬眠； 隐匿

sentences.english: Automatic logoff feature helps alleviate such risks by automatically disabling the session using recommended time-out values for dormancy.
sentences.chinese: 自动下线特性通过对休眠使用推荐的超时值，可以帮助降低此类风险。

sentences.english: All nine were put in dimensional locks, essentially powered down into energetic dormancy through the technology of the Alliance. Many other magnificent Temple Crystals were lost.
sentences.chinese: 这 九个水晶都放置着维度锁，基本上经由(外星)联盟的技术将其能量降至休眠的状态 。

sentences.english: After a 20-year period of dormancy, the volcanobegan to erupt once more.
sentences.chinese: 在20年的休眠后，这座火山又再一次肆虐。

name: reputable
trans: 名声好的， 高尚的； 受尊敬的； 值得信赖的

sentences.english: You are well advised to buy your car through a reputable dealer.
sentences.chinese: 你通过一个声誉好的经销商来买车是明智的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声誉好的；受尊敬的；卓越的
detailed_translations.english: respected for being honest or for doing good work

sentences.english: His career has been hindered by injury.
sentences.chinese: 由于受伤，他的事业受到了阻碍。

sentences.english: policies that will hinder rather than help families
sentences.chinese: 对家庭有害无益的政策

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for something to develop or succeed

sentences.english: Our friendship has steadily strengthened over the years.
sentences.chinese: 我们的友谊逐年加深。

sentences.english: Steve’s opposition only strengthened her resolve to go ahead.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫的反对反而坚定了她继续下去的决心。

sentences.english: The company plans to strengthen its hand (= make itself more powerful ) in Europe by opening an office in Spain.
sentences.chinese: 该公司计划在西班牙设立办事处，以此增强在欧洲的实力。

detailed_translations.english: to become stronger or make something stronger

sentences.english: a yellow rose with a lovely scent
sentences.chinese: 香气怡人的黄玫瑰

detailed_translations.english: a pleasant smell that something has

name: exhibit
trans: 陈列， 展览； 显示

sentences.english: Her paintings have been exhibited all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 她的绘画作品在世界各地展出。

detailed_translations.english: to show something in a public place so that people can go to see it
something, for example a painting, that is put in a public place so that people can go to see it

name: adjunct
trans: 附加物， 附件； 附加语， 修饰语

sentences.english: For me, it represents a potent adjunct to antidepressant medications and, for some patients, it’s something you can take in lieu of pills.
sentences.chinese: 对于我，它是一个抗抑郁剂曾用药物的强有力的助手，对一些病人来说，它是能够代替药丸的东西。

sentences.english: " Lyte urges caution as well."It MAY, in really big capitals, prove to be an adjunct to therapy, but there are a number of steps that need to be done.
sentences.chinese: 我们在花费了大量的人力物力之后，也许，也许证明它可以成为一种附属的治疗手段，但是我们仍然有大量的工作要做。

detailed_translations.english: something that is added or joined to something that is bigger or more important

sentences.english: mushroom soup
sentences.chinese: 蘑菇汤

detailed_translations.chinese: 蘑菇，伞菌；蘑菇形物体；暴发户
detailed_translations.english: one of several kinds of  fungus  with stems and round tops, some of which can be eaten

detailed_translations.chinese: 蘑菇的；蘑菇形的；迅速生长的
迅速增加；采蘑菇；迅速生长
detailed_translations.english: to grow and develop very quickly

name: altruistic
trans: 无私的， 为他人着想的

sentences.english: Were his motives entirely altruistic?
sentences.chinese: 他的动机是完全无私的吗？

detailed_translations.english: altruistic behaviour shows that you care about and will help other people, even though this brings no advantage for yourself

name: alcohol
trans: 含酒精饮料， 酒； 酒精

sentences.english: I don’t drink alcohol anymore.
sentences.chinese: 我不再喝酒了。

sentences.english: alcohol abuse
sentences.chinese: 酗酒

sentences.english: people with alcohol problems
sentences.chinese: 有酗酒问题的人

detailed_translations.english: drinks such as beer or wine that contain a substance which can make you drunk

name: inadequate
trans: 不充分的； 不适当的

sentences.english: inadequate resources
sentences.chinese: 资源缺乏

sentences.english: The new air conditioning system proved inadequate.
sentences.chinese: 新的空调系统不够好。

detailed_translations.english: not good enough, big enough, skilled enough etc for a particular purpose

name: deny
trans: 否认， 否定； 拒绝

sentences.english: The government denied the existence of poverty among 16- and 17-year-olds.
sentences.chinese: 政府否认十六七岁的青少年当中存在贫困问题。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something is not true, or that you do not believe something

sentences.english: Would you rather be an alchemist or a chemist?
sentences.chinese: 那么，你想做一个炼金术士，还是一个化学家呢？

sentences.english: At first glance, it all seems an alchemist's illusion.
sentences.chinese: 乍看上去， 它完全象是一位炼金术士的幻术。

sentences.english: The original museum of 1683 was based on the collections of Elias Ashmole, alchemist and antiquarian , a leading figure of "The New Philosophy".
sentences.chinese: 1683年老馆里的展品基本是伊莱亚斯·阿什莫尔的藏品。 他是一位炼金术士和古文物收集者，也是“新哲学”的领军人物。

detailed_translations.english: An alchemist was a scientist in the Middle Ages who tried to discover how to change ordinary metals into gold

sentences.english: Orders came that we should spade the trench in an hour.
sentences.chinese: 有命令要我们必须在一小时内挖好战壕。

sentences.english: From nine to eleven he planned to dig a hole, or trench, and possibly find something good to eat buried in the dirt.
sentences.chinese: 九点到十一点，他打算挖一个洞，或者一条小沟也行，没准儿还能从脏土里翻出什么好吃的呢。

sentences.english: The bridge lies like a trench in the fortress of the moat, which is shaped to blend in with the outlines of the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 这座桥就像是坐落在护城河中的一条沟渠，这种造型是为了使它与周围的风景融合在一起。

detailed_translations.english: a long narrow hole dug into the surface of the ground

name: unrealistic
trans: 不现实的， 不切实际的

sentences.english: Some parents have totally unrealistic expectations of teachers.
sentences.chinese: 有些家长对老师抱着完全不切实际的期望。

detailed_translations.english: unrealistic ideas or hopes are not reasonable or sensible

name: miserable
trans: 悲惨的， 痛苦的； 令人难受的

sentences.english: I’ve been so miserable since Pat left me.
sentences.chinese: 自从帕特离我而去后，我十分痛苦。

sentences.english: I spent the weekend feeling miserable .
sentences.chinese: 我那个周末心情很糟糕。

sentences.english: Jan looks really miserable .
sentences.chinese: 简看上去很痛苦。

sentences.english: Why do you make yourself miserable by taking on too much work?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么揽这么多活儿，把自己弄得很辛苦呢？

detailed_translations.english: extremely unhappy, for example because you feel lonely, cold, or badly treated

sentences.english: Then the deal is that when you sell the house they subtract -you've got to pay this.
sentences.chinese: 那么当你售出房子后，他们会从中减去，这个余额，这就是你要付给他们的。

sentences.english: That is, if you find that a sensor consistently overestimates by a certain value, you can subtract that value before the final value is reported.
sentences.chinese: 也就是说，如果您发现某个传感器总是偏高于某个特定数值，那么就可以减去该数值后再报告最终的数值。

sentences.english: Thus, if you have staff activities in loops and want to run the above request, you need to ensure that you subtract only events which belong together.
sentences.chinese: 因此，如果您在循环中具有人员活动，并且想要运行以上的请求，那么您必须确保您只减去了属于一起的事件。

detailed_translations.english: to take a number or an amount from a larger number or amount

sentences.english: Any illness of the lungs or throat , such as asthma or a cough.
sentences.chinese: 消耗病，痨病肺部或喉咙的任何一种病变，如哮喘或咳嗽。

sentences.english: It scares me sometimes because I do have asthma and when I walk, I do gasp for air.
sentences.chinese: 她说：“我会担心体重，因为我有哮喘，我走路的时候总是气喘吁吁。

sentences.english: Another aspect of this problem is control of asthma among children in these populations.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题的另一个方面是在这些群体的儿童中控制哮喘。

detailed_translations.english: a medical condition that causes difficulties in breathing

sentences.english: I still remember a hurricane that hit us thirty years ago.
sentences.chinese: 我还记得三十年前袭击我们的一次飓风。

sentences.english: Our love is not fierce, not hot, but despite the tsunami hurricane, also vowed.
sentences.chinese: 我们的爱，不剧烈，不炙热，可是任凭海啸飓风，也矢志不渝。

sentences.english: If an earthquake, hurricane, winter storm, or other disaster strikes your community, you might not have access to food , water, and electricity for days or even weeks.
sentences.chinese: 如果有地震、飓风、暴风雪或其他的灾害突袭你的家园，你可能会好几天甚至好几个星期都得不到食物、水和电。

detailed_translations.english: a storm that has very strong fast winds and that moves over water

name: hike
trans: 远足， 徒步旅行； 猛增

sentences.english: He wants to hike round the world.
sentences.chinese: 他打算徒步旅行环游世界一周。

sentences.english: You can organize a picnic in the park, a group hike or bike ride, or meet up with friends for one of those free local events.
sentences.chinese: 你可以组织在公园野餐一群徒步旅行或者骑自行车或者和朋友会面为其中的一个免费本地事件。

detailed_translations.english: to take a long walk in the mountains or countryside
a long walk in the mountains or countryside
to increase a price, tax etc by a large amount

name: secondary
trans: 次要的， 二级的； 中等的； 辅助的， 从属的

sentences.english: the novel’s secondary characters
sentences.chinese: 这本小说中的次要人物

detailed_translations.chinese: 第二的；中等的；次要的；中级的
detailed_translations.english: not as important as something else

name: badge
trans: 徽章； 标记； 象征

sentences.english: We were each handed a badge with our name on it.
sentences.chinese: 我们每个人都拿到一个徽章，上面有我们的名字。

sentences.english: He now sees his wartime injuries as a badge of honor.
sentences.chinese: 现在，他把自己在战争中受的伤看成是一种光荣标记。

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of metal or plastic, with a design or words on it, that a person wears to show that they belong to an organization, support sth, have achieved sth, have a particular rank, etc.

name: mission
trans: 使命， 任务； 代表团， 使团； 传教， 布道

sentences.english: He was sent on over 200 missions before being killed in action.
sentences.chinese: 在阵亡之前他奉命执行过200多次军事任务。

sentences.english: US troops taking part in the peacekeeping mission
sentences.chinese: 参与维和任务的美军

sentences.english: a British trade mission to Moscow
sentences.chinese: 派往莫斯科的英国贸易代表团

detailed_translations.english: an important job that involves travelling somewhere, done by a member of the air force, army etc, or by a spacecraft

sentences.english: When I go to the neighborhood, see in the road, so I made a detour, from another trail walk home.
sentences.chinese: 当我走到居委会时，看到前面在修路，于是我绕道而行，从另外一条小路走回家。

sentences.english: But what if you could take a detour through a lobby that exhibits art, or down a lane that borders a green space?
sentences.chinese: 但是，你愿不愿意绕道穿过一个陈列着艺术品的大厅，或者行走在一条毗邻绿色空间的小巷子？

sentences.english: A meeting in a London bus with jewel thief Lady Christina takes a turn for the worst for the Doctor when the bus takes a detour to a desert-like planet, where the deadly Swarm awaits.
sentences.chinese: 一个在伦敦公共汽车上的一个会议在一个珠宝窃贼夫人克莉丝汀采取了转为医生的最坏的时候，公共汽车需要绕道沙漠般的行星，那里的致命的群等待。

detailed_translations.english: to make a detour
a way of going from one place to another that is longer than the usual way

sentences.english: Cinnamon is an excellent flavour enhancer.
sentences.chinese: 肉桂是一种绝佳的提味料。

detailed_translations.english: An enhancer is a substance or a device that makes a particular thing look, taste, or feel better

sentences.english: Access is by means of a small door on the right.
sentences.chinese: 入口是右边的一扇小门。

detailed_translations.chinese: 接近；通道，入口；接近的机会
detailed_translations.english: the way you use to enter a building or reach a place
to find information, especially on a computer

name: primitive
trans: 原始的，上古的；简单的，粗糙的

sentences.english: a primitive society
sentences.chinese: 原始社会

sentences.english: a primitive nomadic tribe
sentences.chinese: 原始的游牧部落

sentences.english: the tools used by primitive man
sentences.chinese: 原始人所用的工具

sentences.english: primitive art
sentences.chinese: 原始艺术

sentences.english: The first station buildings were quite primitive.
sentences.chinese: 最初的车站建筑很简陋。

detailed_translations.chinese: 原始的；简单的；简单的，简陋的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to a simple way of life that existed in the past and does not have modern industries and machines

name: advisable
trans: 可取的， 适当的； 明智的

sentences.english: I deem it advisable to buy property now.
sentences.chinese: 我认为现在购置房地产是明智的。

sentences.english: It would't be advisable for us to kiss off their objections.
sentences.chinese: 对人家的意见不予理睬是不明智的。

sentences.english: She lived in a college dormitory.
sentences.chinese: 她住在一幢大学宿舍楼里。

detailed_translations.english: a large building at a college or university where students live

sentences.english: They agreed to co-operate with Brazil on a programme to protect the rain forests.
sentences.chinese: 他们同意和巴西合作进行一个保护热带雨林的项目。

sentences.english: I advised my client to cooperate fully with the police.
sentences.chinese: 我建议我的当事人要全力与警方配合。

detailed_translations.english: to work with someone else to achieve something that you both want

name: overcome
trans: 战胜， 克服； 压倒

sentences.english: He struggled to overcome his shyness.
sentences.chinese: 他努力克服自己的羞怯。

sentences.english: Her financial problems could no longer be overcome.
sentences.chinese: 她的经济困难再也无法解决。

sentences.english: Australia overcame the Netherlands 2-1.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚队2比1战胜了荷兰队。

detailed_translations.english: to successfully control a feeling or problem that prevents you from achieving something

sentences.english: the current President
sentences.chinese: 现任总统

sentences.english: In its current state, the car is worth £1,000.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车按现在的车况来看值1,000英镑。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing now

sentences.english: Each year they audit our accounts and certify them as being true and fair.
sentences.chinese: 每年他们都会审核我们的账目，以证明其准确合理。

detailed_translations.english: to officially examine a company’s financial records in order to check that they are correct
an official examination of a company’s financial records in order to check that they are correct

sentences.english: Harry inherited the house and a sizeable chunk of land.
sentences.chinese: 哈里继承了这座房子以及相当大的一片土地。

sentences.english: By and large the limbed tetrapods and near-tetrapods unearthed thus far have been sizeable beasts around a meter long.
sentences.chinese: 整体说来，目前发掘出的有肢四足动物或近四足动物，都是相当大的怪兽，体长约有一公尺。

detailed_translations.english: fairly large

sentences.english: audio and video equipment
sentences.chinese: 音频视频设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 声音的；[声] 音频的，[声] 声频的
detailed_translations.english: relating to sound that is recorded or broadcast

name: intake
trans: 吸入， 纳入； 进气口， 入口

sentences.english: Your intake of alcohol should not exceed two units per day.
sentences.chinese: 你每天酒精摄入量不能超过两个单位。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of food, drink etc that you take into your body

name: offensive
trans: 冒犯的；使人不快的；无礼的；攻击性的，进攻性的
进攻， 攻击； 攻势

sentences.english: I found her remarks deeply offensive.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得她的话令人非常恼火。

sentences.english: offensive behaviour
sentences.chinese: 无礼的行为

detailed_translations.chinese: 冒犯的，无礼的；进攻的，攻击性的
detailed_translations.english: very rude or insulting and likely to upset people
a planned military attack involving large forces over a long period

name: untrustworthy
trans: 不值得信任的， 靠不住的

sentences.english: I think he is shallow, vain and untrustworthy.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得他肤浅、虚荣，并不值得信赖。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is untrustworthy cannot be trusted

name: texture
trans: 质地， 纹理； 口感

sentences.english: This cloth has a silky texture.
sentences.chinese: 这种布具有丝的质地。

sentences.english: What is the texture of your experience?
sentences.chinese: 这次经历的实质是什么？

name: launch
trans: 将…投放市场；开始从事，发动，发起；发射

sentences.english: A test satellite was launched from Cape Canaveral.
sentences.chinese: 一颗实验人造卫星从卡纳维拉尔角发射升空。

sentences.english: The organization has launched a campaign to raise $150,000.
sentences.chinese: 为了筹集15万美元，该组织发起了一场募捐活动。

sentences.english: The Canadian police plan to launch an investigation into the deal.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大警方计划对这宗交易进行调查。

sentences.english: The book launched his career as a novelist.
sentences.chinese: 这本书开启了他的小说创作生涯。

detailed_translations.english: to send a weapon or spacecraft into the sky or into space

sentences.english: Diseases were spread through poor sanitary conditions .
sentences.chinese: 疾病因卫生条件很差而传播开来。

sentences.english: a prison with no proper sanitary facilities
sentences.chinese: 一座缺少适当卫生设施的监狱

detailed_translations.english: relating to the ways that dirt, infection, and waste are removed, so that places are clean and healthy for people to live in

sentences.english: The lake was almost solid with silt and vegetation.
sentences.chinese: 这个湖几乎填满了泥沙和植被。

detailed_translations.english: sand, mud, soil etc that is carried in water and then settles at a bend in a river, an entrance to a port etc

name: afield
trans: 在野外， 在田中； 在战场上； 离乡背井地； 到远方， 在远处

sentences.english: They were exporting as far afield as Alexandria.
sentences.chinese: 他们出口货物远至亚历山德里亚。

sentences.english: students who come from further afield
sentences.chinese: 远方来的学生

detailed_translations.chinese: 在战场上；去野外；在远处；远离著
detailed_translations.english: far away, especially from home

name: confirm
trans: 证实， 确定； 肯定； 批准， 使有效

sentences.english: New evidence has confirmed the first witness’s story.
sentences.chinese: 新的证据证实了第一个证人的说法。

sentences.english: To confirm my diagnosis I need to do some tests.
sentences.chinese: 为了证实我的诊断，我要做一些化验。

sentences.english: Could you confirm the dates we discussed?
sentences.chinese: 你能确认我们商讨过的日期吗？

sentences.english: After a six-month probationary period, her position was confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 经过六个月的试用期后，她获准正式担任该职。

detailed_translations.english: to state or show that sth is definitely true or correct, especially by providing evidence

sentences.english: rose buds
sentences.chinese: 玫瑰花苞

detailed_translations.english: a young tightly rolled-up flower or leaf before it opens
to produce buds

name: discerning
trans: 有识别力的， 眼光敏锐的

sentences.english: an ideal tour for the discerning traveller
sentences.chinese: 对具鉴赏品位的游客而言一次理想之旅

detailed_translations.chinese: 有辨识能力的；眼光敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: showing the ability to make good judgments, especially about art, music, style etc

name: gallop
trans: 奔驰， 飞跑， 飞驰

sentences.english: I was forced to attempt a gallop.
sentences.chinese: 我被迫尝试一次骑马疾驰。

detailed_translations.english: a very fast speed

detailed_translations.chinese: 飞驰；急速进行；急急忙忙地说
detailed_translations.english: if a horse gallops, it moves very fast with all its feet leaving the ground together

sentences.english: a palace built in a neoclassical style
sentences.chinese: 新古典主义风格的宫殿

detailed_translations.english: neoclassical art or architecture copies the style of ancient Greece or Rome

name: appoint
trans: 任命， 委任； 指定

sentences.english: officials appointed by the government
sentences.chinese: 政府任命的官员

sentences.english: The committee appointed a day in June for celebrations.
sentences.chinese: 委员会把庆典定在6月的一天举行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 任命，委派；约定，确定，指定
detailed_translations.english: to choose someone for a position or a job

sentences.english: Mortality from heart disease varies widely across the world.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病死亡率世界各地差异很大。

detailed_translations.english: the number of deaths during a particular period of time among a particular type or group of people

sentences.english: The refugees come across the border in vast numbers.
sentences.chinese: 大量难民涌过边境。

sentences.english: In the past five years, there has been a vast improvement in graduation rates.
sentences.chinese: 过去的五年内，毕业率大幅度提高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 巨大的， 大量的； 浩瀚的
detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: regurgitate
trans: 涌回， 流回； 【动】 反胃， 将返回到口中， 反刍

sentences.english: Some birds and animals regurgitate food to feed their young.
sentences.chinese: 有些鸟兽会回吐食物以喂哺幼崽。

detailed_translations.english: to bring food that you have already swallowed, back into your mouth

name: intervene
trans: 干涉， 干扰； 介于其间

sentences.english: The army will have to intervene to prevent further fighting.
sentences.chinese: 军队将不得不干预以阻止进一步的战斗。

sentences.english: The police don’t usually like to intervene in disputes between husbands and wives.
sentences.chinese: 警方通常不愿意介入夫妻之间的争吵。

detailed_translations.english: to become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

sentences.english: The symbol on the packet is a guarantee that the food has been produced organically.
sentences.chinese: 包装盒上的这个标识保证这种食物是有机生产的。

sentences.english: Fe is the chemical symbol for iron.
sentences.chinese: Fe是铁的化学符号。

detailed_translations.english: a picture or shape that has a particular meaning or represents a particular organization or idea

name: declare
trans: 正式宣布； 声明； 断言

sentences.english: A state of emergency has been declared.
sentences.chinese: 已宣布进入紧急状态。

sentences.english: Mr Steel has been declared bankrupt
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂尔先生被宣布破产了。

sentences.english: We celebrate September 16, the day when Mexico declared independence from Spain (= officially stated that it was no longer ruled by Spain ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们在9月16日举行庆祝活动，这一天是墨西哥摆脱西班牙统治宣布独立的日子。

detailed_translations.english: to state officially and publicly that a particular situation exists or that something is true

name: revelation
trans: 被揭示的真相， 新发现； 揭示， 显示； 泄露

sentences.english: ...following the revelation of his affair with a former secretary.
sentences.chinese: …在他和前任秘书的风流韵事被揭露之后。

detailed_translations.english: a surprising fact about someone or something that was previously secret and is now made known

name: available
trans: 可获得的， 可得到的； 可用的； 有空的

sentences.english: Tickets are available from the box office.
sentences.chinese: 售票处有票出售。

sentences.english: Meetings were held to update employees as soon as new information became available .
sentences.chinese: 一有新的信息就开会告诉员工。

sentences.english: Further building can continue when money is made available .
sentences.chinese: 有了资金就可以继续进一步的施工。

sentences.english: Every available space on the wall was covered in pictures.
sentences.chinese: 墙上每一个可用的地方都挂上了画。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可利用的，现有的；可获得的
detailed_translations.english: something that is available is able to be used or can easily be bought or found

name: express
trans: 快车， 快运， 快递

sentences.english: Parents have expressed their concerns about their children’s safety.
sentences.chinese: 父母对自己孩子的安全表示忧虑。

sentences.english: She expressed an interest in seeing York.
sentences.chinese: 她表示有兴趣见见约克。

sentences.english: Many people have expressed their opposition to the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 许多人反对这些提议。

sentences.english: He first learnt to express himself through movement at his dance classes.
sentences.chinese: 他最初是在舞蹈班学会通过动作表达情感的。

sentences.english: Words can’t express (= it is impossible to describe ) how angry we felt.
sentences.chinese: 我们的愤怒无以言表。

sentences.english: London–Gatwick Express/Orient Express (=a fast train or bus which does a particular journey regularly)
sentences.chinese: 伦敦﹣盖特威克快车/东方快车

sentences.english: Send these books by express.
sentences.chinese: 把这些书用快递寄出去。

detailed_translations.english: to tell or show what you are feeling or thinking by using words, looks, or actions
a train or bus that does not stop in many places and therefore travels quickly

name: advocate
trans: 拥护者， 支持者； 提倡者

sentences.english: Extremists were openly advocating violence.
sentences.chinese: 极端主义者公开鼓吹使用暴力。

sentences.english: Mr. Williams is a conservative who advocates fewer government controls on business.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯先生是一位提倡减少政府对商业的控制的保守人士。
