detailed_translations.chinese: 轻信地， 易受欺骗地

name: credential
trans: 证明书； 资格证书； 证件

detailed_translations.chinese: 外交使节所递的国书, 信任状

sentences.english: The government will review the situation later in the year.
sentences.chinese: 政府将在今年晚些时候对形势重新加以研究。

sentences.english: The decision will be reviewed by the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 这个判决将由最高法院复核。

sentences.english: The team manager’s position will be reviewed at the end of the season.
sentences.chinese: 球队主教练的人选将在赛季末重新考虑。

sentences.english: If you have to cover 12 chapters in American history, begin by planning on three two-hour reviews with four chapters per session.
sentences.chinese: 如果你必须涵盖美国史的12个章节，首先计划3次2小时的复习，每次4章。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully examine or consider sth again, especially so that you can decide if it is necessary to make changes
(North Amercian English) a lesson in which you look again at sth you have studied, especially in order to prepare for an exam

sentences.english: He had their own uniqueness and vitality, and dissemination of a value concept.
sentences.chinese: 他有了自己的独特性和生命力，并传播一种价值理念。

name: justify
trans: 证明…为正当的； 为…辩护

sentences.english: Ministers must appear before Parliament and justify their actions.
sentences.chinese: 大臣们必须就自己的行为向议会作出解释。

detailed_translations.english: to give an acceptable explanation for something that other people think is unreasonable

name: dreadful
trans: 可怕的； 令人不快的

sentences.english: a dreadful accident
sentences.chinese: 可怕的事故

sentences.english: They suffered dreadful injuries.
sentences.chinese: 他们严重受伤。

detailed_translations.english: causing fear or suffering

name: timber
trans: 木材， 木料； 栋木， 大梁

sentences.english: a bench made of timber
sentences.chinese: 木制长椅

detailed_translations.english: wood used for building or making things

name: tighten
trans: 变紧； 使更加严格， 加强

sentences.english: Tighten the screws firmly.
sentences.chinese: 把螺丝拧紧。

sentences.english: I’d put the new tyre on, but I hadn’t tightened up the wheel.
sentences.chinese: 我把新轮胎装上了，但没有上紧轮子。

detailed_translations.english: to close or fasten something firmly by turning it

name: roam
trans: 随便走，漫游；徜徉；漫谈某事

sentences.english: Chickens and geese roam freely in the back yard.
sentences.chinese: 鸡和鹅在后院随意溜达。

sentences.english: You shouldn’t let your children roam the streets .
sentences.chinese: 你不应该让孩子在街上游荡。

detailed_translations.english: to walk or travel, usually for a long time, with no clear purpose or direction

name: simulate
trans: 模仿， 模拟； 假装， 伪装； 扮演

sentences.english: a machine that simulates conditions in space
sentences.chinese: 一台模拟太空环境的机器

sentences.english: Interviews can be simulated in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 可以在教室里模拟面试。

detailed_translations.english: to make or produce something that is not real but has the appearance or feeling of being real

name: inclusive
trans: 包括一切费用在内的； 所有数目包括在内的； 包容广阔的

sentences.english: The fully inclusive fare for the trip is £22.
sentences.chinese: 这次出行的全部费用为22英镑。

sentences.english: The rent is £120 a week, inclusive of heating.
sentences.chinese: 房租连暖气费在内是每星期120英镑。

detailed_translations.english: an inclusive price or cost includes everything

name: efficiency
trans: 效率； 功效， 效能

sentences.english: considerable advancements in energy efficiency
sentences.chinese: 能源效率的显著提高

detailed_translations.chinese: 效率； 功效， 效能
detailed_translations.english: the quality of doing something well and effectively, without wasting time, money, or energy

name: goal
trans: 球门； 射门， 进球得分； 目标

sentences.english: Your goal as a parent is to help your child become an independent adult.
sentences.chinese: 身为父母，你的目标就是要培养孩子成为独立的成年人。

sentences.english: be in goal/keep goal (=be the goalkeeper)
sentences.chinese: 守球门

sentences.english: I scored the first goal.
sentences.chinese: 我踢进了第一个球。

detailed_translations.english: something that you hope to achieve in the future

name: natural
trans: 正常的， 普通的， 自然的； 自然界的， 天然的； 天赋的， 固有的

sentences.english: the study of the natural world
sentences.chinese: 对自然界的研究

sentences.english: an area of spectacular natural beauty
sentences.chinese: 自然风景秀丽的地区

sentences.english: death from natural causes
sentences.chinese: 自然死亡

sentences.english: the need for natural light in offices
sentences.chinese: 办公室里需要自然光的照射

detailed_translations.english: existing in nature and not caused, made, or controlled by people

name: plagiarism
trans: 剽窃， 抄袭； 剽窃物

sentences.english: The journal accused the professor of plagiarism.
sentences.chinese: 那份刊物指控该教授剽窃。

detailed_translations.english: when someone uses another person’s words, ideas, or work and pretends they are their own

name: overhead
trans: 在空中， 在头顶上， 在高处
天花板； 企业管理费用

sentences.english: Bullets whizzed overhead.
sentences.chinese: 子弹嗖嗖地掠过头顶。

sentences.english: A plane flew overhead.
sentences.chinese: 一架飞机从头顶飞过。

sentences.english: She turned on the overhead light and looked around the little room.
sentences.chinese: 她打开顶灯，环视这间小屋。

detailed_translations.english: above your head or in the sky
You use overhead to indicate that something is above you or above the place that you are talking about

detailed_translations.chinese: 经常费用， 管理费用
detailed_translations.english: money spent regularly on rent, insurance, electricity, and other things that are needed to keep a business operating

sentences.english: Why you let her talk you into doing such a foolish thing is beyond my comprehension (= impossible for me to understand ) .
sentences.chinese: 你怎么会被她说服去做这种蠢事，我实在是无法理解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 理解， 理解力， 领悟； 理解力测验
detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand something

name: intact
trans: 完整无缺的； 完好无损的

sentences.english: Only the medieval tower had remained intact.
sentences.chinese: 只有这座中世纪塔楼保存完好。

sentences.english: His reputation survived intact.
sentences.chinese: 他的声望丝毫未受影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 完整的；原封不动的；未受损伤的
detailed_translations.english: not broken, damaged, or spoiled

sentences.english: Have ye suffered so many things in vain? if it be yet in vain.
sentences.chinese: 你们受苦如此之多，都是徒然的吗。难道果真是徒然的吗。

sentences.english: Have ye suffered so many things in vain?
sentences.chinese: 你们受苦如此之多，都是徒然的吗。

name: juvenile
trans: 少年的，少年特有的；幼稚的，不成熟的

sentences.english: juvenile crime
sentences.chinese: 少年犯罪

sentences.english: a juvenile court
sentences.chinese: 少年法院[法庭]

sentences.english: The number of juveniles in the general population has fallen by a fifth in the past 10 years.
sentences.chinese: 在过去的10年中，青少年在总人口中所占的比重下降了1/5。

detailed_translations.chinese: 少年的，少年特有的；幼稚的，不成熟的
detailed_translations.english: law relating to young people who are not yet adults
A juvenile is a child or young person who is not yet old enough to be regarded as an adult

sentences.english: the pervasive influence of television
sentences.chinese: 电视无所不在的影响

sentences.english: the all-pervasive mood of apathy
sentences.chinese: 到处弥漫的冷漠情绪

detailed_translations.chinese: 普遍的；到处渗透的；流行的
detailed_translations.english: existing everywhere

name: managerial
trans: 经理的； 管理的， 经营的

sentences.english: managerial skills
sentences.chinese: 管理技巧

detailed_translations.english: relating to the job of a manager

name: hive
trans: 蜂房，蜂箱；蜂房内的蜂群；闹市，忙碌之地

sentences.english: The most important member of any hive is the queen bee.
sentences.chinese: 任何一个蜂房中最重要的成员都是蜂王。

sentences.english: What people must remember is that one hive quickly become two, two become four and four become eight.
sentences.chinese: 人们一定要记住的是，一个蜂巢很快会变成两个，两个变成四个，四个变成八个。

detailed_translations.english: a small box where  bees  are kept, or the bees that live in this box

sentences.english: a spasmodic cough
sentences.chinese: 痉挛性咳嗽

detailed_translations.chinese: 痉挛的，痉挛性的；间歇性的
detailed_translations.english: of or relating to a muscle spasm

sentences.english: This area is always tender to the touch if the intestines are not functioning properly.
sentences.chinese: 如果肠功能不正常的话，这个部位总是一按就痛。

detailed_translations.english: the long tube in your body through which food passes after it leaves your stomach

name: sympathetic
trans: 同情的， 体谅的； 赞同的， 支持的； 和谐的

sentences.english: a sympathetic friend
sentences.chinese: 一个有同情心的朋友

sentences.english: a sympathetic attitude
sentences.chinese: 一种同情的态度

sentences.english: We hope always to provide a friendly sympathetic ear (= someone willing to listen to someone else’s problems ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们希望总能做到友善地倾听。

detailed_translations.english: caring and feeling sorry about someone’s problems

name: insignificant
trans: 无关紧要的， 无意义的

sentences.english: You realize that your problems are insignificant in comparison.
sentences.chinese: 要知道，你的问题相对来说微不足道。

detailed_translations.english: too small or unimportant to consider or worry about

name: seasonal
trans: 季节性的， 随季节而变化的； 节令性的

sentences.english: heavy seasonal rains
sentences.chinese: 季节性的大雨

detailed_translations.chinese: 季节的；周期性的；依照季节的
detailed_translations.english: happening, expected, or needed during a particular season

sentences.english: freight services
sentences.chinese: 货运公司

sentences.english: We’ll send your personal belongings by air freight and your furniture by sea freight .
sentences.chinese: 你的个人物品我们将以空运方式运送，家具将以海运方式运送。

detailed_translations.english: goods that are carried by ship, train, or aircraft, and the system of moving these goods
to send goods by air, sea, or train

name: range
trans: 变化， 变动； 排列

sentences.english: a temperature range of 72-85˚
sentences.chinese: 72 度到85度之间的温度范围

sentences.english: Even the cheapest property was out of our price range (= too expensive for us ) .
sentences.chinese: 即使是最便宜的房子也超出了我们能承受的价格范围。

sentences.english: There were 120 students whose ages ranged from 10 to 18.
sentences.chinese: 有120名学生，年龄在10至18岁之间。

detailed_translations.english: the limits within which amounts, quantities, ages etc vary
if prices, levels, temperatures etc range from one amount to another, they include both those amounts and anything in between

sentences.english: Dump the topsoil here.
sentences.chinese: 把表土倒在这里。

sentences.english: Stone is the foundation, above which is soil, and then topsoil.
sentences.chinese: 石头是基础，上面是泥土，再上面是表土。

sentences.english: After shoveling out the topsoil, Garfinkel uncovered coins and other artifacts from the time of Alexander the Great.
sentences.chinese: 在铲去了表层土以后，加芬克尔发现了来自亚历山大大帝时期的硬币和其他人工制品。

detailed_translations.english: the upper level of soil in which most plants have their roots

sentences.english: When would be the best time to start weaning my baby?
sentences.chinese: 什么时候开始给我的孩子断奶最好呢？

detailed_translations.english: to gradually stop feeding a baby or young animal on its mother’s milk and start giving it ordinary food

sentences.english: Mr. Ying is one of those happy people who derive pleasure from helping others.
sentences.chinese: 英先生是那种助人为乐的快活人。

detailed_translations.english: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something
to develop or come from something else

sentences.english: Chris is going to work overseas.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯要去国外工作。

sentences.english: Most applications came from overseas.
sentences.chinese: 大部分申请来自海外。

detailed_translations.english: to or in a foreign country that is across the sea

name: impress
trans: 给…留下深刻印象，使铭记；印，压印

sentences.english: Steve borrowed his dad’s sports car to impress his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫借来他爸爸的跑车向女友炫耀。

detailed_translations.english: to press something into a soft surface so that a mark or pattern appears on it

sentences.english: The roof is leaking.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶在漏水。

sentences.english: A tanker is leaking oil off the coast of Scotland.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰海岸附近有一艘油轮漏油。

sentences.english: 英语例句：The boat had sprung a leak (= a hole had appeared in it ).
sentences.chinese: 小船出现了漏洞。

detailed_translations.english: if a container, pipe, roof etc leaks, or if it leaks gas, liquid etc, there is a small hole or crack in it that lets gas or liquid flow through
a small hole that lets liquid or gas flow into or out of something

sentences.english: A design flaw (= a mistake or weakness in the way something was made ) caused the engine to explode.
sentences.chinese: 一个设计缺陷导致了引擎爆炸。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect

name: feature
trans: 以…为特色； 由…主演； 占重要地位

sentences.english: Air bags are a standard feature in most new cars.
sentences.chinese: 气囊是大多数新车的标准配置。

sentences.english: Striped tails are a common feature of many animals.
sentences.chinese: 尾巴上有条纹是许多动物的共同特征。

sentences.english: The hotel’s only redeeming features (= things that make it acceptable ) were that it was cheap and near the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 这家旅馆仅有的可取之处就是价格低廉并且靠近市中心。

sentences.english: One of the distinguishing features (= features that are different from other things of the same sort ) of modern banking is its dependence on computers.
sentences.chinese: 现代银行业的显著特征之一就是依赖电脑。

sentences.english: It's a great film and it features a Spanish actor who is going to be a world star within a year.
sentences.chinese: 那是一部精彩的电影，它由一位西班牙演员主演，他一年之内就会成为国际明星。

sentences.english: The hour-long programme will be updated each week and feature highlights from recent games.
sentences.chinese: 这个一小时的节目将每周更新，重点介绍近期比赛的精彩部分。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特征，特色；面貌；特写，专题节目；故事片
detailed_translations.english: a part of something that you notice because it seems important, interesting, or typical
When something such as a film or exhibition features a particular person or thing, they are an important part of it

name: assert
trans: 断言， 声称； 坚持

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

sentences.english: The bed can be folded flat for storage.
sentences.chinese: 这张床可以折扁存放。

sentences.english: He lay flat on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 他平躺在地板上。

sentences.english: That night I lay flat on my back and stared up at the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 那一夜，我仰面平躺，眼睛直直地盯着天花板。

detailed_translations.chinese: 平直地； 直截了当地
detailed_translations.english: in a position in which the surface of something is against another surface without curving or sloping

detailed_translations.chinese: 平的；固定的；漏气的；单调的，沉闷的；浅的
detailed_translations.english: smooth and level, without raised or hollow areas, and not sloping or curving
a place for people to live that consists of a set of rooms that are part of a larger building

sentences.english: She leapt over the fence.
sentences.chinese: 她跳过篱笆。

sentences.english: He threw a stick into the river and the dog went after it in a flying leap.
sentences.chinese: 他把一根枝条扔到河里，那条狗一个飞跃就追了过去。

detailed_translations.english: to jump high into the air or to jump in order to land in a different place
a big jump

sentences.english: ...accusations that he had been disrespectful to a police officer.
sentences.chinese: ...关于他曾对一名警官无礼的控告。

detailed_translations.english: If you are disrespectful, you show no respect in the way that you speak or behave to someone

name: flap
trans: 薄片； 封盖； 振动； 激动

sentences.english: The flags were flapping in the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 旗帜在微风中飘扬。

detailed_translations.chinese: 飘动， 拍动； 振翅
detailed_translations.english: if a bird flaps its wings, it moves them up and down in order to fly

detailed_translations.chinese: 片状垂悬物；飘动，摆动，振动；激动，慌忙状态
detailed_translations.english: a thin flat piece of cloth, paper, skin etc that is fixed by one edge to a surface, which you can lift up easily
to move quickly up and down or from side to side, often making a noise

name: brazen
trans: 黄铜制的， 黄铜色的； 厚颜无耻的

sentences.english: her brazen admission that she was cheating on him
sentences.chinese: 她恬不知耻地承认自己对他不忠

detailed_translations.english: used to describe a person, or the actions of a person, who is not embarrassed about behaving in a wrong or immoral way

name: irrational
trans: 不合理的，不合逻辑的，荒谬的

sentences.english: an irrational fear of flying
sentences.chinese: 对飞行非理性的恐惧

sentences.english: He’s becoming increasingly irrational.
sentences.chinese: 他变得越来越不可理喻了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不合理的；无理性的；荒谬的
detailed_translations.english: not based on clear thought or reason

name: picturesque
trans: 美丽如画的； 生动的

sentences.english: a quiet fishing village with a picturesque harbour
sentences.chinese: 拥有一座美丽港口的宁静渔村

detailed_translations.english: a picturesque place is pretty and interesting in an old-fashioned way

name: glacial
trans: 冰期的； 冰川的； 寒冷的， 冰冷的； 冷若冰霜的

sentences.english: a glacial valley
sentences.chinese: 冰川谷

sentences.english: glacial deposits
sentences.chinese: 冰川沉积

detailed_translations.chinese: 冰的；冰冷的；冰河时代的
detailed_translations.english: relating to ice and glaciers, or formed by glaciers

sentences.english: Her objection was that he was too young.
sentences.chinese: 她反对的理由是他太小。

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 异议； 反对的理由
detailed_translations.english: a reason that you have for opposing or disapproving of something, or something you say that expresses this

name: dispute
trans: 对…表示异议； 争论， 争吵

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

name: observation
trans: 观察， 观测； 监视； 评述， 评论

sentences.english: Darwin’s observations on the habits of certain birds
sentences.chinese: 达尔文对某些鸟类习性的论述

sentences.english: Paz makes some observations about the role of the critic.
sentences.chinese: 帕斯论述了评论家的作用。

detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written remark about something you have noticed

name: suggest
trans: 建议， 提出； 暗示

sentences.english: The zoo asked its visitors to suggest a name for the new baby panda.
sentences.chinese: 动物园请游客提建议，给刚出生的大熊猫起一个名字。

sentences.english: It has been suggested that the manager will resign if any more players are sold.
sentences.chinese: 有人提议，如果再有球员被出售，球队主教练就辞职。

detailed_translations.chinese: 提议，建议；启发；使人想起；显示；暗示
detailed_translations.english: to tell someone your ideas about what they should do, where they should go etc

sentences.english: drinking water supplied by old-fashioned lead pipes
sentences.chinese: 由老式铅管输送的饮用水

detailed_translations.english: a chemical element. Lead is a heavy soft grey metal, used especially in the past for water pipes or to cover roofs.

name: inhabitant
trans: 居民， 住户， 居住者； 栖息的动物

sentences.english: a city of six million inhabitants
sentences.chinese: 有600万居民的城市

detailed_translations.english: one of the people who live in a particular place

sentences.english: I got these shoes at a fraction of the original price.
sentences.chinese: 我以原价的一个零头买到了这双鞋子。

detailed_translations.english: a very small amount of something

sentences.english: The water in the tank is constantly filtered.
sentences.chinese: 鱼缸里的水在不停地被过滤。

sentences.english: The ozone layer filters harmful UV rays from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 臭氧层过滤掉有害的太阳紫外线。

sentences.english: coffee filter papers
sentences.chinese: 咖啡滤纸

sentences.english: filter cigarettes (= with a filter at the end )
sentences.chinese: 过滤嘴香烟

detailed_translations.english: to remove unwanted substances from water, air etc by passing it through a special substance or piece of equipment
something that you pass water, air etc through in order to remove unwanted substances and make it clean or suitable to use

sentences.english: Her voice was full of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音充满了激情。

sentences.english: She was good at hiding her emotions.
sentences.chinese: 她很会掩饰自己的情感。

sentences.english: Kim received the news without showing any visible sign of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 金接到消息时丝毫不露声色。

detailed_translations.english: a strong human feeling such as love, hate, or anger

sentences.english: The things people will do for charity never cease to amaze me (= I am always surprised by them ) .
sentences.chinese: 人们的慈善义举总是让我感到惊讶。

sentences.english: The rain ceased and the sky cleared.
sentences.chinese: 雨过天晴。

sentences.english: without cease
sentences.chinese: 不停地，持续地

detailed_translations.english: to stop doing something or stop happening
(it is a noun only in the phrase `without cease') end

sentences.english: The test was to assess aptitude rather than academic achievement.
sentences.chinese: 该测试将评估能力而不是学业成绩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 对估价； 评价， 评论
detailed_translations.english: to make a judgment about a person or situation after thinking carefully about it

name: prescription
trans: 处方， 药方； 开处方， 开药方

sentences.english: The new drug will not require a physician's prescription.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药不需要医生的处方。

sentences.english: If you’re pregnant, you can get free prescriptions.
sentences.chinese: 要是怀孕的话可以获得免费的处方药。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes what medicine a sick person should have, so that they can get it from a pharmacist

sentences.english: The match attracted over 40,000 spectators.
sentences.chinese: 这场比赛吸引了四万多名观众。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is watching an event or game

name: scarce
trans: 缺乏的， 不足的； 稀少的， 罕见的

sentences.english: Food was often scarce in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 冬季常常粮食短缺。

sentences.english: There was fierce competition for the scarce resources .
sentences.chinese: 对这些紧缺资源的争夺非常激烈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺乏的， 不足的； 稀少的， 罕见的
detailed_translations.english: if something is scarce, there is not very much of it available

name: argument
trans: 争吵， 争论； 观点， 论据； 说理， 论证

sentences.english: She had a big argument with her husband.
sentences.chinese: 她和丈夫大吵了一架。

sentences.english: We need to provide a convincing argument as to why the system should be changed.
sentences.chinese: 我们得提出有说服力的论据，证明为何要改变体制。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which two or more people disagree, often angrily

name: adequate
trans: 充足的； 合适的， 合格的

sentences.english: Farmers have been slow to make adequate provision for their retirement.
sentences.chinese: 农民们迟迟没有为退休做好适当安排。

sentences.english: Some creams we tested failed to give adequate protection against UV light.
sentences.chinese: 我们检测的有些防晒霜不能提供足够的防紫外线保护。

sentences.english: The standard of his work is barely adequate .
sentences.chinese: 他的工作水准勉强合格。

sentences.english: The company has yet to provide an adequate explanation for its actions.
sentences.chinese: 该公司对其行动仍未作出充分解释。

detailed_translations.chinese: 足够的； 可以胜任的
detailed_translations.english: enough in quantity or of a good enough quality for a particular purpose

sentences.english: ...the flora and fauna of the African jungle.
sentences.chinese: …非洲丛林的植物群和动物群。

detailed_translations.english: all the animals living in a particular area or period in history

sentences.english: pork sausages
sentences.chinese: 猪肉香肠

detailed_translations.english: a small tube of skin filled with a mixture of meat, spices etc, eaten hot or cold after it has been cooked

sentences.english: In this chapter we will look at what happens when a human foetus receives too much or too little male hormone.
sentences.chinese: 在这一章里，我们将看看当一个人类胎儿接收了过多或过少的雄性激素会发生什么。

sentences.english: If the male foetus does not receive enough male hormone at the appropriate time, one of two things may happen.
sentences.chinese: 如果在适当的时间内，男性胎儿没有接收到足够的雄性激素，就会发生两件情况之一。

sentences.english: Gays, Lesbians and TranssexualsResearch shows that the basic template for the body and brain of a human foetus is female in its structure.
sentences.chinese: 对男同性恋、女同性恋和变性人的研究显示，人类胎儿的身体和大脑基础模板在结构上是女性。

detailed_translations.english: a baby or young animal before it is born

name: tremendous
trans: 极大的， 巨大的； 非常的， 惊人的

sentences.english: Suddenly, there was a tremendous bang, and the whole station shook.
sentences.chinese: 突然一声巨响，整个车站都晃动了。

sentences.english: She was making a tremendous effort to appear calm.
sentences.chinese: 她竭力表现出平静的样子。

sentences.english: She praised her husband for the tremendous support he had given her.
sentences.chinese: 她称赞丈夫给了她巨大支持。

sentences.english: Sales have been tremendous so far this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年到目前为止，销售额十分惊人。

sentences.english: This plan could save us a tremendous amount of money.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划能给我们节省一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: very big, fast, powerful etc

name: escalate
trans: 逐步增长或发展， 逐步升级

sentences.english: The costs were escalating alarmingly.
sentences.chinese: 成本在以惊人的速度增长。

sentences.english: policies that escalate their own costs
sentences.chinese: 促使其自身成本增加的政策

sentences.english: escalating crime
sentences.chinese: 愈演愈烈的犯罪活动

detailed_translations.english: to become higher or increase, or to make something do this

name: condense
trans: 压缩， 精简； 凝结

sentences.english: This whole chapter could be condensed into a few paragraphs.
sentences.chinese: 这一整章可以压缩成几个段落。

detailed_translations.english: to make something that is spoken or written shorter, by not giving as much detail or using fewer words to give the same information

sentences.english: A clerk had slipped the wrong tab on Tony's X-ray .
sentences.chinese: 一位职员失手把一个错误的标签贴到了托尼的X光片上。

detailed_translations.english: a  tab key

name: divert
trans: 使绕道， 转移； 娱乐， 供消遣

sentences.english: Northbound traffic will have to be diverted onto minor roads.
sentences.chinese: 北行车辆将不得不绕次要道路行驶。

sentences.english: The war diverted people's attention away from the economic situation.
sentences.chinese: 战争把民众的注意力从经济状况上移开了。

detailed_translations.english: to make sb/sth change direction

name: justice
trans: 正义， 公正； 司法

sentences.english: Children have a strong sense of justice.
sentences.chinese: 儿童有很强的正义感。

sentences.english: His people came to him demanding justice.
sentences.chinese: 他的手下来找他，寻求公正。

detailed_translations.english: fairness in the way people are treated

sentences.english: You just search for an artist, song, album , or just a random search tag.
sentences.chinese: 你只需要搜索艺术家、歌曲、相册、或者仅仅是一个随机搜索标签。

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of paper, plastic etc attached to something to show what it is, who owns it, what it costs etc
to attach a tag to something

sentences.english: We are sitting by the campfire.
sentences.chinese: 我们正坐在营火旁。

sentences.english: The black soot deposited on a kettle by a smoky campfire is nearly pure carbon.
sentences.chinese: 带烟的营火在水壶上熏积的黑煤烟几乎是纯碳。

sentences.english: A group of elderly men in uniforms, eyes bright with reminiscence, are gathered at a Grand Army of the Republic campfire.
sentences.chinese: 一群上年纪穿着制服的退伍老兵，围在伟大共和国军的营火旁边，眼神明亮地回忆着过去的光辉岁月。

detailed_translations.english: a fire made outdoors by people who are camping

sentences.english: She was absolutely furious .
sentences.chinese: 她怒不可遏。

sentences.english: There was a furious row over the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 关于这些提议的争论非常激烈。

detailed_translations.english: very angry

detailed_translations.chinese: 摄政王；摄政者；州立大学董事会董事；统治者
detailed_translations.english: someone who governs instead of a king or queen, because the king or queen is ill, absent, or still a child

name: tan
trans: 晒成棕褐色， 晒黑； 硝

sentences.english: I wish I could get a tan like that.
sentences.chinese: 但愿我也能晒成那样的棕褐色肤色。

detailed_translations.chinese: （日晒后皮肤的）黝黑色；棕褐色；鞣料；马戏团
detailed_translations.english: the attractive brown colour that someone with pale skin gets after they have been in the sun
if you tan, or if the sun tans you, your skin becomes darker because you spend time in the sun
having a light yellowish-brown colour

name: tap
trans: 轻拍； 利用， 开发

sentences.english: She felt a tap on her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得有人轻轻拍了拍她的肩膀。

sentences.english: I went up and tapped on the window.
sentences.chinese: 我走上去轻轻敲敲窗户。

detailed_translations.english: an act of hitting something lightly, especially to get someone’s attention
to hit your fingers lightly on something, for example to get someone’s attention

sentences.english: Each individual leaf on the tree is different.
sentences.chinese: 树上每片叶子都不相同。

sentences.english: the needs of the individual customer
sentences.chinese: 每位顾客的需求

detailed_translations.english: considered separately from other people or things in the same group
a person, considered separately from the rest of the group or society that they live in

sentences.english: No one told me about any briefcase.
sentences.chinese: 没有人和我提过什么公文包。

sentences.english: If you ask about my impression on him, I feel he looks like a typical businessman, you know, dark suit and briefcase.
sentences.chinese: 如果你问我对他的印象如何，我感觉他看起来像是个典型的商人，你知道，黑西装和公文包的那种。

sentences.english: Dennis peered into the room and saw her take a small red object out of her briefcase and quickly hide it in the bottom drawer of her dresser.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯窥视着房间里的一举一动，只见她从公文包里拿出一个红色的小东西，快速地把它藏在梳妆台最底下的抽屉里。

detailed_translations.english: a flat case used especially by business people for carrying papers or documents

sentences.english: The relationship between a parent and a child is instinctual and stems from basic human nature.
sentences.chinese: 父母与孩子之间的关系是本能的，源于人类的本性。

detailed_translations.english: instinctive

sentences.english: Poor soil has constrained the level of crop production.
sentences.chinese: 贫瘠的土地限制了农作物的产量。

sentences.english: Women’s employment opportunities are often severely constrained by family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 女性的就业机会常常受到家庭责任的严重限制。

detailed_translations.english: to limit something

name: excitement
trans: 激动； 兴奋； 令人兴奋的事

sentences.english: We were both new to the excitements of life in the big city.
sentences.chinese: 我们俩都是初次感受大城市多姿多彩的生活。

detailed_translations.chinese: 刺激， 激动， 兴奋； 令人兴奋的事， 刺激的因素
detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being excited

name: informant
trans: 提供消息或情报的人， 线人； 提供资料的人

sentences.english: One of the witnesses was a paid informant for the FBI.
sentences.chinese: 目击者之一是联邦调查局出钱雇用的线人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 被调查者；告密者；提供消息者
detailed_translations.english: someone who secretly gives the police, the army etc information about someone else

sentences.english: By changing the tomato’s genetic blueprint , scientists can alter the rate at which it ripens.
sentences.chinese: 科学家可以通过改变番茄的基因蓝图来改变它的成熟速度。

detailed_translations.english: a plan for achieving something

name: barbaric
trans: 野蛮的， 粗鲁的； 残暴的， 残忍的； 原始部落的

sentences.english: The way the whales are killed is nothing short of barbaric.
sentences.chinese: 对鲸的捕杀方式简直就是野蛮。

detailed_translations.english: very cruel and violent

name: enforce
trans: 实施， 执行； 强制， 迫使

sentences.english: Parking restrictions will be strictly enforced.
sentences.chinese: 停车限制将会严格执行。

sentences.english: It is unlikely that a record company would enforce its views on an established artist.
sentences.chinese: 唱片公司未必能强迫一位已出名的艺人接受他们的意见。

detailed_translations.english: to make people obey a rule or law

sentences.english: The river glittered in the sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 阳光下河面波光粼粼。

detailed_translations.english: to shine brightly with flashing points of light

detailed_translations.chinese: 闪光， 灿烂的光辉； 耀眼， 辉煌
detailed_translations.english: brightness consisting of many flashing points of light

name: fragile
trans: 脆弱的； 虚弱的； 易碎的； 易受伤害的

sentences.english: The economy remains extremely fragile.
sentences.chinese: 经济仍然极其脆弱。

sentences.english: Her father is now 86 and in fragile health.
sentences.chinese: 她的父亲现在86岁，身体虚弱。

detailed_translations.english: weak and uncertain; easily destroyed or spoilt

name: departure
trans: 离开， 出发； 背离， 违反

sentences.english: There are several departures for New York every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天有好几个班次去纽约。

detailed_translations.english: an act of leaving a place, especially at the start of a journey

name: painstaking
trans: 需细心的，辛苦的，煞费苦心的；勤勉的；刻苦的
辛苦； 勤勉； 刻苦

sentences.english: You said in your address that "developing excellence is a slow, painstaking process".
sentences.chinese: 你在你的致词中说“发展卓越性是一个缓慢艰苦的过程”。

sentences.english: In order to transform their environment, he drew up the project with painstaking accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 为了改造环境， 他苦心孤诣地制订了这个计划。

name: stout
trans: 发胖的， 肥胖的， 强壮的； 结实的， 牢固的； 顽强的， 坚毅的

sentences.english: a stout pair of shoes
sentences.chinese: 一双厚实耐穿的鞋子

detailed_translations.chinese: 结实的；矮胖的；勇敢的；激烈的
detailed_translations.english: strong and thick
strong dark beer

sentences.english: Out with every theory of human behavior, from linguistics to sociology.
sentences.chinese: 从语言学、社会学的人类行为原理里解脱吧。

sentences.english: Basic courses in sociology and psychology as well as other humanities courses give students plenty of opportunity to explore their own emotions.
sentences.chinese: 社会学和心理学的基础，以及其他人文学科的课程，赋予学生大量的机会去探索其个人情感。

sentences.english: And I spent part of my second grade year in Sweden, where my father was on sabbatical as a professor of sociology.
sentences.chinese: 因为我父亲休假的缘故，我的小学二年级有一段时间是在瑞典上的，那个时候他是一名社会学教授。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of societies and the behaviour of people in groups

sentences.english: His attackers turned and fled.
sentences.chinese: 袭击他的人转身逃走了。

sentences.english: Masaari spent six months in prison before fleeing the country .
sentences.chinese: 正有蹲了六个月监狱，然后逃出了该国。

detailed_translations.english: to leave somewhere very quickly, in order to escape from danger

sentences.english: a gigantic skyscraper
sentences.chinese: 摩天大楼

detailed_translations.english: extremely big

name: distinct
trans: 清楚的， 明显的； 有区别的， 不同的

sentences.english: The outline of the ship became more distinct.
sentences.chinese: 船的轮廓变得更加清晰了。

detailed_translations.english: easily or clearly heard, seen, felt, etc.

sentences.english: He was visiting professor of geology at the University of Georgia.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是佐治亚大学的地质学客座教授。

sentences.english: the geology of the British Isles
sentences.chinese: 不列颠群岛的地质

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of the earth, including the origin and history of the rocks and soil of which the earth is made

sentences.english: That’s a nice tune.
sentences.chinese: 那曲调很美。

sentences.english: She sang some old classics and a few new tunes.
sentences.chinese: 她唱了几首经典老歌和一些新曲。

sentences.english: Someone’s coming tomorrow to tune the piano.
sentences.chinese: 明天有人来给钢琴调音。

detailed_translations.english: a series of musical notes that are played or sung and are nice to listen to
to make a musical instrument play at the right pitch

sentences.english: I don't think people are really aware of just how much it costs.
sentences.chinese: 我认为人们并不真正明白这要花多少钱。

sentences.english: Were you aware that something was wrong?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有意识到已经出了问题？

detailed_translations.english: knowing or realizing sth

name: cap
trans: 〔对物件起保护作用的〕罩，盖，套

sentences.english: a baseball cap
sentences.chinese: 棒球帽

sentences.english: a bottle cap
sentences.chinese: 瓶盖

sentences.english: a graceful tower capped with a golden dome
sentences.chinese: 一座漂亮的金色圆顶塔

detailed_translations.english: a type of flat hat that has a curved part sticking out at the front, and is often worn as part of a uniform
to have a particular substance on top

sentences.english: Moodie has been awarded a golf scholarship at the University of Hawaii.
sentences.chinese: 穆迪获授夏威夷大学高尔夫奖学金。

sentences.english: The movie has won a number of awards.
sentences.chinese: 该片获得了多个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to officially give someone something such as a prize or money to reward them for something they have done
something such as a prize or money given to someone to reward them for something they have done

name: eligible
trans: 符合条件的； 合适的

sentences.english: Stephen was regarded as an eligible bachelor.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬被认为是一个钻石王老五。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is eligible for something is able or allowed to do it, for example because they are the right age

sentences.english: a pot of soup simmering on the stove
sentences.chinese: 在炉灶上煨着的一锅汤

sentences.english: a wood-burning stove
sentences.chinese: 烧木柴的火炉

detailed_translations.english: a piece of kitchen equipment on which you cook food in pots and pans, and that contains an oven

name: alarm
trans: 惊恐，恐慌；报警器；闹钟；警报

sentences.english: I forgot to set the burglar alarm.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记打开防盗警报器了。

sentences.english: Car alarms are always going off in the street.
sentences.chinese: 街上总有汽车警报器在响。

sentences.english: a sophisticated alarm system
sentences.chinese: 精密的警报系统

sentences.english: We could not see what had alarmed him.
sentences.chinese: 我们不明白是什么吓着他了。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn you of danger
If something alarms you, it makes you afraid or anxious that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen

sentences.english: What is needed in such cases is a calm appraisal of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 在此类情况下需要的是对形势的冷静估计。

detailed_translations.chinese: 对...作出的评价；评价，鉴定，评估
detailed_translations.english: a statement or opinion judging the worth, value, or condition of something

sentences.english: the constant battle against weeds
sentences.chinese: 对付杂草的长期斗争

sentences.english: I've been weeding the flower beds.
sentences.chinese: 我一直在除花坛里的杂草。

detailed_translations.english: a wild plant growing where it is not wanted that prevents crops or garden flowers from growing properly
to remove unwanted plants from a garden or other place

sentences.english: The glacier calved a large iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 冰川崩解而产生一个大冰山。

sentences.english: The glacier dislocated great stones.
sentences.chinese: 冰川使许多大石块移位了。

sentences.english: A river or glacier debouches on the plains.
sentences.chinese: 一条河流或冰川流向平原。

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of ice which moves slowly down a mountain valley

name: smooth
trans: 顺利的； 流畅的； 协调的

sentences.english: Her skin felt smooth and cool.
sentences.chinese: 她的皮肤摸上去又滑又凉。

sentences.english: a smooth pebble
sentences.chinese: 光滑的卵石

sentences.english: The stone steps had been worn smooth .
sentences.chinese: 石阶被磨得光溜溜的了。

sentences.english: She stood up and smoothed down her frock.
sentences.chinese: 她站了起来，抚平了自己的连衣裙。

detailed_translations.english: a smooth surface has no rough parts, lumps, or holes, especially in a way that is pleasant and attractive to touch

detailed_translations.chinese: 使光滑；消除（障碍等）；使优雅；缓和
detailed_translations.english: to make a rough surface flat and even
If you smooth something, you move your hands over its surface to make it smooth and flat

sentences.english: To pipe installation is complete and experience the qualified, conducted only after backfill earthwork.
sentences.chinese: 待涵管道安装完成并经验收合格后，方可进行土方回填。

sentences.english: This paper states some treatment methods and relevant precautions of groundwater in earthwork construction.
sentences.chinese: 论述了在土方施工中几种地下水处理的方法及注意事项。

sentences.english: Abstract: : this article with the water conservancy project for example expounds the earthwork balanced deployment principle, namely, the minimum balance should dig fill.
sentences.chinese: 筡摘要：本文以水利工程为例阐述了土方平衡调配的原则，即挖填平衡、运距最小。

detailed_translations.english: a large long pile of earth, used in the past to stop attacks

name: orientation
trans: 定位； 方向， 方位； 情况介绍； 培训， 训练

sentences.english: The company needs to develop a stronger orientation towards marketing its products.
sentences.chinese: 公司需要针对其产品的营销设定一个更为明确的目标。

sentences.english: How can we get students to adopt a serious orientation to learning?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎样才能让学生对学习采取认真的态度呢？

detailed_translations.english: the type of activity or subject that a person or organization seems most interested in and gives most attention to

sentences.english: She motioned for the locked front doors to be opened.
sentences.chinese: 她打手势示意把锁着的前门打开。

sentences.english: He stood aside and motioned Don to the door.
sentences.chinese: 他站在一边，示意唐到门口。

detailed_translations.english: If you motion to someone, you move your hand or head as a way of telling them to do something or telling them where to go

detailed_translations.chinese: 运动；手势，眼色，动作；提议
detailed_translations.english: the process of moving or the way that someone or something moves

sentences.english: My knowledge of the business is limited.
sentences.chinese: 我对这一行了解有限。

sentences.english: The organization has very limited resources.
sentences.chinese: 这家机构资源非常有限。

sentences.english: So far, the education reforms have had only limited success.
sentences.chinese: 迄今为止，教育改革只取得了有限的成效。

detailed_translations.english: not very great in amount, number, ability etc

sentences.english: The earthworm is a useful animal. On the ground it is food for other animals. Under the ground, it makes rich soil for fields and gardens.
sentences.chinese: 蚯蚓是一种有益的动物。在地面上它是其他动物的食物。在地下，它为田园和花园制造肥沃的土壤。

sentences.english: But when genetic characterization of the contents of beetle guts gave some unexpected results, the researchers decided to take a closer look at earthworm DNA.
sentences.chinese: 但是，当甲虫背脊骨包容的遗传特性显示出一些意想不到的结果时，这些研究人员决定仔细查明蚯蚓的DNA。

sentences.english: Germination is complicated with the bursting forth of a meteor and with the peck of a swallow cracking its egg, and it places on one level the birth of an earthworm and the advent of Socrates.
sentences.chinese: 万物的化育是复杂的，有风云雷电诸天象，有破壳而出的乳燕，一条蚯蚓的出生和苏格拉底的来临同属于化育之列。

detailed_translations.english: a common type of long thin brown worm that lives in soil

name: match
trans: 火柴；比赛，竞赛；对手，敌手

sentences.english: It’s our last match of the season.
sentences.chinese: 这是我们本赛季最后一场比赛。

sentences.english: They’re preparing for a big match tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 他们在为明天的一场大赛做准备。

sentences.english: McClaire’s goal earned him the title of man of the match (= the person in a team who plays best ) .
sentences.chinese: 麦克莱尔的进球为他赢得了“本场最佳球员”的称号。

sentences.english: Carlos was no match for the champion.
sentences.chinese: 卡洛斯根本不是冠军的对手。

detailed_translations.english: an organized sports event between two teams or people

name: fault
trans: 缺点， 瑕疵， 毛病

sentences.english: I’m really sorry - it’s all my fault.
sentences.chinese: 我真的很抱歉——都是我的错。

sentences.english: I didn’t sleep well that night, but it was my own fault .
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上我没有睡好，但这是我自己的问题。

detailed_translations.english: if something bad that has happened is your fault, you should be blamed for it, because you made a mistake or failed to do something

name: interplay
trans: 相互作用， 相互影响

sentences.english: The law bring into effect is an organism concerned with the interplay among society, economic and culture.
sentences.chinese: 实际运作中的法律制度是一个社会、经济和文化互相作用的有机体。

sentences.english: The equipment design must grow by continual interplay between the technical specification and the packaging .
sentences.chinese: 仪器设计必须根据工艺指标和装配之间不断地交互影响而发展。

sentences.english: To date, most research into the interplay of exercise and anxiety has focused on the actions of various neurotransmitters or chemical messengers within the brain, like serotonin and dopamine.
sentences.chinese: 迄今为止，大多数有关锻炼和焦虑的相互影响的研究都集中在大脑内的各种神经递质或化学信使，如血清素、多巴胺上。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people or things affect each other

name: fragment
trans: 碎片， 小部分， 片断

sentences.english: glass fragments
sentences.chinese: 玻璃碎片

detailed_translations.chinese: 碎片；片断或不完整部分
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of something that has broken off or that comes from something larger
to break something, or be broken into a lot of small separate parts – used to show disapproval

name: response
trans: 回答， 答复； 反应， 响应

sentences.english: His immediate response was one of disbelief.
sentences.chinese: 他的第一反应是不相信。

sentences.english: Carl made no response , and carried on with his meal.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔没有回答，继续吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done as a reaction to something that has happened or been said

sentences.english: He was very skilled at pointing down the blocks of granite.
sentences.chinese: 他善于把花岗岩石凿平。

sentences.english: If you're working in steel or granite, redesigning or adding onto something is very expensive.
sentences.chinese: 如果你用钢或花岗岩来工作，重新设计或增加一些东西是很贵的。

sentences.english: Everything you see, from the cobblestones the characters walk on to the granite within the buildings, all those details help to bring you into that era.
sentences.chinese: 影片里你所见之处，从角色走过的鹅卵石路到大楼的花岗石，所有的细节都能帮助将你置身于那个年代。” 克罗尔解释道。

detailed_translations.english: a very hard grey rock, often used in building

name: category
trans: 种类； 类别； 范畴

sentences.english: people in the over-45 age category
sentences.chinese: 属45岁以上年龄组的人

sentences.english: Seats are available in eight of the ten price categories .
sentences.chinese: 座位共有10种票价，现有8种可售。

sentences.english: Williams’ style does not fit easily into the category of jazz.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯的风格不能轻易归入爵士乐的范畴。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people or things that are all of the same type

name: rival
trans: 竞争者，竞争对手；可与匹敌的人
与…竞争； 与…匹敌， 比得上； 竞争， 对抗

sentences.english: This gives the company a competitive advantage over its rivals.
sentences.chinese: 这使该公司与其对手相比具有一项竞争优势。

sentences.english: He finished 39 seconds ahead of his main rival .
sentences.chinese: 他比主要对手早39秒到达终点。

sentences.english: She was 2 minutes faster than her nearest rival .
sentences.chinese: 她比紧随其后的对手快两分钟。

sentences.english: a game against their old rivals , Manchester United
sentences.chinese: 和他们的老对手曼联队的比赛

sentences.english: They still remain bitter rivals (= hate each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们仍是死敌。

sentences.english: Their sales have now overtaken those of their arch-rival (= main or strongest rival ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的销售额现已超过了主要竞争对手。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc
